Faavae is 44 years of age and married with three children. Faavae owns and operates a business venture selling dairy products in the local community. She has four years of experience in this business. Faavae needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2008, Faavae joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Faavae's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve her business.

loans.name: Tuana

texts.en:
Tuana is 26 years of age and married with one child. Tuana owns and operates a taxi-driving business venture. She has 2 years of experience in this business.

Tuana is seeking a loan in the amount of 1,500 WST to purchase car parts for her vehicle. She plans to use the profits from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2010, Tuana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Tuana's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase car parts for her vehicle

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca earns a living through farming. She helps her husband till their land, located in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Rice is the main crop that they grow to sell. According to Rebecca, they earn about 13,000 PHP per month from farming.  Rebecca's husband mainly manages their rice farm while she runs their sari-sari store business. She sells items like bread and canned goods.

Rebecca is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and herbicides. She hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and herbicides

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 27-year-old married woman with a 3-year-old child. She lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with her family. Rose's husband works as a farmer.

Rose has been in the business of raising hogs for 4 years. She earns about 10,000 PHP per month from her business. Rose plans to use her loan to purchase piglets, feeds, rice seeds and fertilizers. Rose works hard to support her family.

In the future, Rose hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feeds, rice seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee is a married woman who lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She is a mother of 6 children.

Haydee and her husband are both farmers. They primarily grow rice crops to sell. Haydee's husband is the one who mainly manages their rice farm. Haydee, on the other hand, runs their retail shop. She sells shirts, jeans and slippers. She also helps at the farm when she can.

Haydee has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and seeds. She hopes this loan will help increase their yield.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and seeds

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a 35-year-old married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 14 years old.

Jessica is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She helps her husband till their land and plant rice. She also raises pigs and ducks to help augment their income. Jessica plans to use her loan to purchase feeds, fertilizers and herbicides.

In the future, Jessica hopes to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Neil

texts.en:
Neil is 41 years old and married. He has 3 children, ages 13, 12 and 1. He is engaged in a hog-raising business and earns about 5000 PHP per month. Neil also tills a parcel of land where he grows rice crops for family consumption and selling. He also put up a sari-sari store that his wife manages. Neil works hard to sustain his family and especially to save for his children's education.

Neil is requesting a loan to purchase pig feeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes to provide a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca has a rice farm and piggery. She tills land located in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato, where she also lives with her family. Rebecca grows rice because she said it is always in demand, as it is a basic Filipino food.  Rebecca raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market. She works hard to support her family. She plans to use her loan to purchase pig feeds, farm fertilizers and herbicides. She hopes to be successful in all her ventures.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds, farm fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomas is a farmer who tills land in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He is 35 years old and married, with 3 children, ages 8, 7 and 6. Tomas grows rice and cassava crops to sell. He works hard to feed his family and send his children to school.

Tomas has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and insecticides. In the future, Tomas would like to own a bigger farm. He also wants to see his children finish college and be successful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Vanessa Jireh

texts.en:
21-year-old Vanessa Jireh is a married woman with 2 young children. Her oldest child is only 2 years old.

Vanessa is engaged in rice farming and in the hog-raising business. She helps her husband grow rice crops on their land. She raises pigs in their backyard and sells them at the market. Vanessa does her best to help improve their living conditions. She also makes sure her children are in good health.

Vanessa requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and pig feeds. She hopes to be successful in her ventures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and pig feeds

loans.name: Aliaskar

texts.ru: Aliaskar jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Aliaskar 24 qoda. On uje 3 qoda kak zanimayetsya selskim xozaystvom i virashivayet cveti dlya prodaji. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kulenku i balki dlya togo chtobi sdelat parnik, tak kak nastupayut xoloda.
texts.en: Aliaskar lives in the Baku Region together with his relatives. He is single, without children. Aliaskar is 24 years old. For three years, he has been working in agriculture, growing flowers for sale. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy beams and poly film for building a greenhouse as the cold season of the year is about to begin.

loans.use: to buy beams and poly film for  a greenhouse

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.en: Arnaldo is a 48-year-old hard-working farmer, working in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He grows rice crops and vegetables. He sells his harvest to traders. Arnaldo works hard to increase his harvest and income. He also wants to improve his living conditions. He requested a loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Arnaldo hopes to have a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely earns a living through rice farming and raising hogs. She grows rice crops to sell to her community. Fely raises pigs in her backyard and sells them at the market. Fely said her businesses are a big help to her family. They are able to eat and buy their basic needs. Fely is also able to send her children to school.

Fely wants to be able to continue generating income from raising hogs and rice farming. She requested a loan to purchase pig feeds, rice seeds and fertilizers. Fely hopes that in the future, she will not borrow money but will be the one to lend money to her fellow farmers.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds, rice seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 47-year-old married woman. She has an eight-year-old child.

Gemma is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Gemma said the farm is very helpful to her family. They are able to eat, buy food, and send her child to school. Gemma hopes to continue earning from her farm. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm inputs. In the future, Gemma hopes to be successful in her endeavors.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.ru: Rovshan rodilsya v 1982 qodu. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey. Rovshan vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy jivet v Baku regione. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit balki i kulenku dlya svoyego parnika. Uje 7 let kak Rovshan zanimayetsya selskim xozaystvom. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca.
texts.en: Rovshan was born in 1982.  He is married and has three children.  Rovshan and his friendly family live in the Baku region.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy beams and plastic for his greenhouse.  Rovshan has been involved in agriculture for seven years.  He learned this business from his father.

loans.use: to buy plastic and beams for a greenhouse

loans.name: Ogtay

texts.ru: Ogtay ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. On jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoim bratom. Ogtay 31 qod. On uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya selskim xozaystvom i razvodit kuric(ciplat). Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kuricci dlya pereprodaji. Etomu biznessu Ogtay nauchilsya u svoyego dyadi kotoriy toje zanimalsya etim delom.
texts.en: Ogtay is not married and has no children.  He lives in the Baku region together with his brother.  Ogtay is 31 years old.  He has been involved in agriculture and raising chickens for seven years.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy chickens for resale.  Ogtay learned this business from his uncle, who is also involved in this type of business.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Janette

texts.en: 27-year-old Janette earns a living through farming. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Janette works for her family. Janette says she is able to provide for her family through her business. She hopes to continue generating income from her farm. She requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, Janette hopes to have a stable business and successful children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.ru: Nusrat 30 let. On uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya selskim xozaystvom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit udobreniye dlya rossteniy. Nusrat jenat i imeyet 2 deyet. On i yego semya projivayut v Baku regione. Etomu biznessu Nusrat nauchilsya u svoyego dedushki, on s malix let pokazival svoy interes k etoy rabote.
texts.en: Nusrat is 30 years old.  He has been involved in agriculture for nine years.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy fertilizers for plants.  Nusrat is married and has two children.  He lives with his family in the Baku region.  Nusrat learned this business from his grandfather.  Nusrat showed his interest for this business since childhood.

loans.use: to buys fertilizers for plants

loans.name: Guey Wod Dobalof 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "Guey wod dobal of 1" est composé de cinq femmes toutes mariées.Leur principale activité durant l'hivernage est la culture du petit milet et de l'arachide. Contrairement aux hommes qui marchent des kilométres pour aller aux champs, leurs parcelles de culture sont juste situées à proximité des habitations.Elles partagent ainsi leur temps entrent les taches ménagères et les activités champetres.Toutefois, durant cette période, la seule activité génératrices de revenus est l'emouche ovine.Ainsi, les femmes participent fortement à la prise en charge des besoins de leurs familles et de leurs propres besoins.le chef du groupe (en rouge à droite),est mère de 8 enfants dont 5 fréquentent l'école primaire. Ces derniers l'accompagnent aux champs et l'aident  à engraisser ses moutons qui seront vendus à terme.Le groupe est membre de l'UIMCEC qui lui a octroyé 8 crédits.Les femmes sollicitent aujourd'hui un pret de   500 000F pour l'achat de 10 moutons  et d'aliment bétail. Leur ambition est d'arriver à pratiquer l'embouche bovine.
texts.en:
The "Guey wod dobal of 1" group is made up of 5 married women. Their main activity during the wintertime is the cultivation of millet and groundnuts. Unlike the fields the men work in, which are located several kilometers away, the women's plots of land are situated near the village. The women normally divide their time between doing household chores and working on their allotments. However, at present, the only available money-making activity is sheep fattening. The women therefore find themselves extremely busy taking care of their family's needs, as well as their own.
The group's leader (on the right of the picture, in red) is the mother of 8 children, 5 of whom go to primary school. Her school-age children also accompany her to the fields to help her to fatten the sheep, which will eventually be sold. The "Guey wod dobal of 1" group is a member of UIMCEC and has already been granted 8 loans. The women are now asking for a loan of 500000F with which to buy 10 sheep and some animal feed. Their goal is to successfully carry out sheep fattening.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep and some animal feed.

loans.name: Atamurod

texts.ru: Атамурод проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 50 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он четыре года как занимается животноводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кроме того он работает в средней школе района, преподавателем. У него имеется высшее педагогическое образование. Он берет кредит для закупа скота.
texts.en: Atamurod lives in the Shahrituz.  He is 50 years, married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for four years.  Atamurod breeds livestock for future sale.  Besides this business, he works as a teacher at a district's secondary school.  He has a higher pedagogical education.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Balagardash

texts.ru: Balagardash uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya selskim xozaystvoom i virashivayet pomidori. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kulenki i balki dlya parnika. Balagardash ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. On rodilsya v 1988 qodu. Seychas projivayet v Baku regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca.
texts.en: Balagardash has been involved in agriculture and growing tomatoes for two years.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy plastic and beams for a greenhouse.  Balagardash is not married and does not have children.  He was born 1988.  He now lives in the Baku region together with his parents.  He learned this business from his father.

loans.use: to buy plastic and beams

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 42 years old and married with five children.  He is able to provide for his family with the income he gets from selling milk.  He has been selling milk for one year.  In addition, he does farming for more income generation.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business.  He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 9,000 Kenyan shillings to buy solar lamps.

loans.use: To purchase solar lamps

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 52-year-old widower with two children.

To earn a living, he makes and repairs shoes. He has been in this business for one year. He also sells groceries for additional income. Previously, he owned and operated a retail shop. He has been able to improve his business operations through financial support from Faulu Kenya.

He hopes to fully establish his business within five years. He has requested a loan in the amount of 9,000 KES to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Nemat

texts.ru: Немат житель района Шахритус. Ему 51 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его сын находится в России. Сам Немат более пяти лет предоставляет услугу. Он занимается развозкой людей. Кредит берет для приобретения запасных частей автомашины, чтобы отремонтировать машину.
texts.en: Nemat lives in the Shahrituz district.  He is 51 years old, married and has three children.  His son is in Russia.  Nemat has been providing a passenger transportation service for over five years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of spare auto parts in order to repair his car.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Guey Wod Dobalof Of 2 Group

texts.fr: Les 6 membres qui composent le groupement "Guey wod dobal of 2" sont des femmes au ménages.Toutefois, durant les trois mois de l'hivernage, elles partagent leur temps entre la culture du mil, de l'arachide et l'embouche ovine.Si le mil est essentiellement destiné à la consommation, la vente de arachide et des moutons leur procure des revenus assez consistants pour satisfaire leurs besoins et ceux de leurs enfants.Le chef du groupe (en foulard rouge au milieu) a cinq enfants.Son mari lui a donné un lopin de terre dans lequel elle cultive du haricot et de l'oseille.Chaque soir, en rentrant des champs,elle ramène, porté sur la tete, un sac de 50 kilo d'herbe humide destiné aux  moutons qu'elle engraisse.  Membres de l'UIMCEC depuis trois ans, elle et ses amies sollicitent un pret de 500 000 F pour acheter 40 moutons et des aliments concentrés pour un renfort nutritionnel.L'ambition du chef du groupe est de faire de l'embouche bovine.
texts.en: The 6 members of the "Guey wod dobal of 2" group are housewives. However through the three months of wintering they share their time between the cultivation of millet, of groundnuts and the fattening of sheep. If the millet is principally intended for domestic consumption, the sale of the groundnut and the sheep provides them with sufficient income to meet their needs and those of their children. The leader of the group (in the middle with the red headscarf) has five children. Her husband gave her a plot of land on which she grows beans and sorrel. Every evening she carries home from the fields on her head, a 50 kilo sack full of damp grass for fattening her sheep. Members of the UIMCEC for 3 years, she and her friends request a 500 000 F loan to buy 40 sheep and concentrated foodstuff for nutritional support. The group leader’s ambition is to fatten bovines.

loans.use: Purchase 40 sheep and concentrated foodstuffs.

loans.name: Zinatsho

texts.ru: Зинатшо проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 55 лет. Женат. Имеет 6 детей. Его сын находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сам Зинатшо имеет среднее образование. Он занимается животноводством. В основном он откармливает и продает скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Zinatsho lives in the Shahrituz district.  He is 55 years old, married and has six children.  His son is working in the Russian Federation.  Zinatsho has a secondary education.  He is involved in animal husbandry.  He primarily raises and sells livestock.  He has been involved in this business for five years.  Zinatsho is requesting this loan for the purchase of calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Chipenyo

texts.en:
Chipenyo is a married woman with four children. Three of her children attend school, while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a charcoal-selling business. Specifically, she sells charcoal from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge due to the high cost of transportation in her business. Her dream is to establish a wholesale business of charcoal-selling in the future.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 80,000 KES to start a motorcycle business by purchasing a motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu so that she could have greater access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To start a motorcycle business by purchasing a motorcycle.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with five children, one of whom still attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a fruit-vending business. Specifically, she sells fruit in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of fruit and establishing a parlor business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan she is requesting, she would like to establish a fruit parlor and purchase additional sacks of fruit. She decided to join Yehu so that she could have greater access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To establish a fruit parlor and to purchase additional fruit.

loans.name: Zohir

texts.ru: Зохир проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 29 лет. Он женат. У него имеется один ребенок. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 4 года. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Zohir lives in the Shahrituz district.  He is 29 years old, married and has one child.  His wife is a homemaker.  He is involved in animal husbandry and breeds livestock at home.  He primarily breeds livestock for future sale.  Zohir has been involved in this business for four years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma is a married man with two children, both of whom graduated from school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For ten years, he has operated a retail shop business. Specifically, he sells various goods to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of competition from other retail operators in the area. He dreams of expanding his business and establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan he is requesting, he would like to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. He decided to join Yehu so that he could have greater access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional retail items (bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice).

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a single man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, he has operated a retail shop business. Specifically, he sells various retail goods to his local neighbors. His major business challenges include delayed payments (by customers who purchase goods on credit) and the high cost of transportation. He dreams of becoming a wholesale retailer in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan he is requesting, he would like to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil, and washing detergents. He decided to join Yehu so that he could have greater access to loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase various retail items (bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil, and washing detergents).

loans.name: Fama

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée qui pratique avec son époux l'activité de commerce de gomme arabique.Ce dernier achète  le produit au nord du pays et son épouse se charge de la vente.Ayant épargné sur ses bénéfices, elle a acheté une parcelle de terrain et y a construit trois pièces.Son activité lui permet également de prendre en charge ses besoins et ceux de ses deux filles.Elle sollicite un pret de 250 000f pour acheter 300 kg de gomme arabique,du jujub et du "sump".Son ambition est de construire une grande maison et y loger sa famille.
texts.en: The loan seeker is a married woman who works with her husband, selling gum arabic. He buys the goods from the northern part of the country and his wife is in charge of selling them. Having put some profits aside, she has managed to save up to buy a plot of land and is building a three-roomed dwelling there. Her business enables her to see to her own needs and those of her two daughters.  She is seeking a 250,000F loan in order to purchase 300kg of gum arabic, jujub (a date plant) and a water collection basin. Her goal is to build a large house and house her family there.

loans.use: to purchase 300kg of gum arabic, jujube (a type of date plant) and a water collection basin

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring/clothing sales business. Specifically, she makes dresses and sells them to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge due to the seasonality of her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan she is requesting, she would like to purchase bundles of clothing materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu so that she could have greater access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothing materials for her tailoring/sales business.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a fruit- and vegetable-selling business. Specifically, she sells fruits and vegetables from a retail stall to her neighbors and passersby. Amina faces a major challenge due to the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 19,250 KES loan she is requesting, she would like to purchase additional sacks of fruits and vegetables, including potatoes, tomatoes, and onions. She decided to join Yehu so that she could have greater access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of fruits and vegetables (e.g., potatoes, tomatoes, and onions).

loans.name: Saidou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un enseignant qui a démarré sa carrière il y'a 34 ans.Il a servi dans cinq régions du pays et est aujourd'hui directeur de l'école primaire de sa localité.Il est marié et père de sept enfants. Ne pouvant plus supporter les dépenses de location, il a entamé la contruction de sa maison.Il sollicite un pret de 500 000F pour l'achat de ciment, de matériel électrique et de paiement de la main d'oeuvre.Son ambition est de terminer sa maison et d'encadrer ses enfants.
texts.en: This borrower is a teacher who began his career 34 years ago. He has served in five different regions of the country and now is the principal of the primary school in his locality. He is married and the father of seven children. Being unable to continue putting up with the expense of renting, he began building a house. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 500,000 francs to buy cement, electrical goods, and pay for labor. His ambition is to finish his house and settle his children there.

loans.use: to buy cement, electrical material, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Jennebby

texts.en:
Jennebby is a 54-year-old, married woman with 10 children. Jennebby's younger children still attend school.

Jennebby is a farmer, and she works in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Specifically, she grows rice and vegetables on her land, and she then sells her harvest at her town's market.

She has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and school supplies for her children. In the future, Jennebby would like to have a bigger farm.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for her business (seeds and fertilizers) and school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Saikou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un fleuriste qui a aménagé son jardin au bord de la route qui mène vers une grande station balnéaire. Il fait des plants de divers fleurs et d'arbres fruitiers qu'il vend à une clientèle composée en majorité d'européens.Il a démarré cette activité après avoir arrété il y'a dix ans ses études au collège.Il est marié et père de 3 enfants.Il sollicite un pret de 200000F pour acheter 80 sachets de plastique et des plants d'arbres fruitiers.Son ambition est d'acheter un terrain et d'y construire sa maison.
texts.en: The loan seeker is a florist who has constructed a garden on the roadside near a large seaside port. He grows flowering plants and fruit-bearing trees that he sells to a customer base mainly consisting of Europeans. He entered this trade 10 years ago after finishing his college studies. He is married and has three children. He is seeking a 200,000F loan in order to purchase 80 plastic bags and fruit-bearing plantlings. His goal is to purchase some land on which to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase 80 plastic bags and fruit-bearing plantlings

loans.name: Kasichana

texts.en:
Kasichana is a married woman with eight children. Three of her children attend school, while five have already graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a poultry business. Specifically, she sells poultry to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she operates a vegetable-selling business, which provides supplemental income. She faces a major challenge due to poultry disease outbreaks in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan she is requesting, she would like to purchase additional chicks and poultry feed. She decided to join Yehu so that she could have greater access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of maize for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Sakha

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme qui vit seule avec sa fille, élève au primaire.Divorcée il y'a quatre ans, elle vend des tissus et des chaussures au marché.Elle s'approvisionne dans les pays limitrophes ou les prix sont plus abordables.Elle sollicite auprès de l'UIMCEC un pret de 300000F pour l'achat de 2 bales de basin, 25 pièces de tissu wax, 7 pièces de brodé et 5 pièces de wakh.Les revenus tirés de la vente de ce stock l'aideront à satisfaire ses besoins et à entretenir sa fille . Son ambition est de construire sa propre maison.
texts.en: The loan seeker is single, and lives with her daughter who attends primary school. She divorced four years ago and now sells fabric and shoes at the market. She sources her goods from nearby towns where prices are reasonable. She is seeking a 300,000F loan from UIMCEC to purchase two rolls of basin (African cloth), 25 pieces of wax cloth, 7 pieces of embroidered fabric and 5 pieces of wakh (a locally-made fabric). The revenues generated by this business will enable her to look after her daughter. Her goal is to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase 2 rolls of 'basin' (African cloth made of cotton), 25 pieces of wax cloth, 7 pieces of embroidered fabric and 5 pieces of wakh (a locally-made fabric)

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with four children. Two of her children attend school while two are still too young to go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a bicycle spare parts shop, where she sells the spare parts to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a hardware shop in the future.

With the 30,000 KES loan she is requesting, she would like to purchase additional bicycle spare parts for re-sale purposes. She decided to join Yehu so that she could have greater access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional bicycle spare parts for re-sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase various retail items (e.g., bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and washing detergents).

loans.name: Diariyetou

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme agée qui n'a qu'un fils unique, hoteleir dans sa localité.Elle fait un commerce de tissus, de parfum et d'ustensuls de cuisine.Cette activité lui permet de satisfaire ses besoins et de soutenri son fils,confronté aux difficultés que traverse le secteur touristique.Elle sollicite un pret de 100000F pour acheter des bols, des parfums et des tissus.Son ambition est de rejoindre sa soeur au maroc pour faoire l'import et l'export.
texts.en: This borrower is an older woman who has an only child. She runs a hotel in her town. She does commerce in cloth, perfumes, and kitchen utensils. These businesses enable her to meet her needs and to support her son faced with problems throughout the tourist sector. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to buy some bowls, perfume, and cloth. Her ambition is to join her sister in Morocco to work in the import-export trade.

loans.use: to buy bowls, perfumes, and cloth

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with five children, all of whom have already graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food vending business, selling food from her home to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to develop and expand her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan she is requesting, she would like to purchase cereals for re-sale purposes. She decided to join Yehu so that she could have greater access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional cereals for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married man with five children. Three of his children attend school, while two have already graduated from school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, he has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling to his neighbors. He faces a major business challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season. He dreams of securing larger loans in order to expand his business in the future.

With the 10,000 KES loan he is requesting, he would like to purchase additional sacks of charcoal for re-sale purposes. He decided to join Yehu so that he could have greater access to loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of charcoal for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en:
Rajab is a married man with one child who attends school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past twelve years, he has owned and rented houses for a profit. He explains that his potential customers are his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of delayed payments by tenants. He dreams of expanding his rental houses in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan he is requesting, he would like to renovate his rental house. He decided to join Yehu so that he could have greater access to loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To renovate his rental house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shoes and bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mashrab

texts.ru: Машраб проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его дети маленькие. Машраб предоставляет услугу. Он развозит людей по маршруту Турсунзаде – Шахринав – Турсунзаде. В этой области он пять лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Mashrab lives in the Tursun-zoda.  He is 28 years old, married and has two children, all of whom are little.  Mashrab provides a service.  He transports people on the Tursun-zoda - Shahrinav - Tursun-zoda route.  He has been in this business for five years.  Mashrab is requesting this loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a widowed woman with five children, including two who attend school and three who are adults. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also owns a school which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and pay for a school permit. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and pay for a school permit.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: L'emprunteur a conduit pendant deux ans une charette de transport de marchandises avant d'arreter cette activité pour embrasser le métier de vulcanisateur qu'il considère plus rentable.Il fait du gonflage, de la réparationet vend aussi des pneus d'occasion.Son travail lui permet d'entretenir son épouse et ses deux enfants.Il sollicite un pret de 200000F auprès de l'UIMCEC pour acheter un groupe électrogène qui lui permettra de faire face aux multiples coupures d'électricité qui s'évissent dans son pays.Son ambition est d'élargir son magasin.
texts.en:
This borrower drove a delivery cart for two years and then he quit this work to embrace a trade in tires that he considers to be more profitable. He inflates the tires and repairs them, and he also sells used inner tubes. His work enables him to support his wife and two children. 

He is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs from the micro-finance institution U-IMCEC to buy an electrical generator that will allow him to cope with multiple power outages that the country is subject to. His ambition is to expand his store.

loans.use: to buy an electrical power generator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for tailoring and to purchase food products.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a single woman who owns a house that neither has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are water bills and food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a restaurant business, selling to town dwellers and neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding to become self dependent in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase food products, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and salt. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase food products, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and salt for her restaurant

loans.name: Bakyala Kwekulakunya Group

texts.en:
50 year old Sarah's enterprising disposition is what has put her business in a favorable position. She plys her business in Lugazi.
It's been 30 years of unremitting purposefulness and diligence.
The light hearted widowed mother of 7 set forth in her business with start-up capital courtesy of her farming business.
She has not dispensed with her farming business.  With earnings from the retail business, she says she is able to reinvest in her farming business.
Sarah says her retail shop generates sales income of 200,000 Uganda shillings per month.
She intends to use her loan to purchase more retail commodities like sugar, rice, maize flour, beans, etc to resell

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities like sugar, rice, maize flour, beans, etc to resell

loans.name: Rima Group

texts.fr:
Christine est une commerçante âgée de 27 ans qui habite la  commune de Rugombo de la Province de Cibitoke à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce d’articles divers de boutique (savons, souliers pour enfants, sel, riz, haricot, huile végétale) depuis 3ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’au niveau de l’école primaire en 5e année. Elle est mère de 2 enfants dont 2étudient. Elle  arrive au 10e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités d’articles divers de boutique (savons, souliers pour enfants, sel, riz, haricot, huile végétale) a revendre pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« RIMA».
texts.en:
Christine is a merchandise, 27 years old, who lives in the Commune of Rugombo of the Province of Cibitoke, in western Burundi. She has been doing commerce in a variety of store goods (soaps, children’s shoes, salt, rice, beans, oil) for three years. She is also a farmer. Christine attended school through the 5th grade. She is the mother of two children, who are both students. 

Christine is now on her tenth community loan cycle with the micro-finance institution Turname. She is asking for a Kiva loan to increase her capital by buying large amounts of various goods (soaps, children’s shoes, salt, rice, beans, vegetable oil) to resell in order to make a large profit. 

Christine is a member of the community group “RIMA”.

loans.use: to increase capital by buying large amounts of various store goods (soaps, children's shoes, salt, rice, beans, vegetable oil) to resell in order to make a large profit

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a hand bags and shoes selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During festive season the demand for clothes and shoes is higher. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase hand bags and shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase hand bags and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Abdulvahob

texts.ru: Абдулвахоб проживает в районе Хуросон. Ему 56 лет. Он женат. Его жена, домохозяйка. У него имеется семеро детей. Более 15 лет Абдулвахоб занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Abdulvahob lives in the Khuroson district.  He is 56 years old, married and has seven children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Abdulvahob has been involved in animal husbandry for over 15 years.  He fattens up and sells livestock.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Gory

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié , père de quatre enfants qui fréquentent tous l'école.Il a hérité de ses parents un troupeau de vaches qu'il entretient pour les léguer à ses enfants qui devront en faire de meme.C'est pourquoi, pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il est obliger d'acheter d'autres animaux, de les engraisser pour les vendre et obtenir des ressources financières.Il achéte des moutons dans les marchés hebdomadaires, les nourrit pendant quatre mois puis les revend.A l'approche de la fete du mouton (Tabaski), il sollicite un pret de 400000F à l'UIMCEC pour acheter 15 moutons.Son ambition est de faire de l'embouche bovine.
texts.en: This borrower is a married man, the father of four children, who all attend school. His parents passed down to him a herd of cows that he maintains in order to leave to his children, who should in turn do the same. This is why, to support his family, he is compelled to buy more animals, fatten them, and sell them to obtain financing. He buys sheep from the weekly markets, feeds them for four months, and then sells them. As the sheep festival (Tabaski) approaches, he is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs from U-IMCEC to buy 15 head of sheep. His ambition is to be a livestock farmer.

loans.use: to buy 15 head of sheep

loans.name: Zurfa

texts.en:
Zurfa is a married woman with three children, who all attend school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes in the upbringing of the family. They own a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of developing to expand to her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman with two children, one who attends school while the other is still young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a beauty salon business; her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of power rationing leading to her loss of customers in the day. She dreams of establishing her business to meet her customer demands. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a blow dryer machine, chemicals and hair weaves. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a blow dryer machine, chemicals and hair weaves.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling in a shop to local residents. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Mary dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Khursandmurod

texts.ru: Хурсандмурод житель района Хуросон. Ему 24 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Хурсандмурод имеет средне - специальное образование, он электрик. По специальности работает два года. Кроме того он занимается растениеводством. У него рядом с домом имеется участок земли, где он выращивает овощи и кукурузу. Этим видом деятельности занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для повторного посева. Он хочет купить семена и минеральные удобрения.
texts.en: Khursandmurod lives in the Khuroson district.  He is 24 years old, married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Khursandmurod has a secondary-specialized education; he is an electrician.  He has been working in this field for two years.  Besides this work, he is involved in agriculture.  He has a plot of land near his house, where he grows vegetables and corn.  He has been involved in this business for six years.  Khursandmurod is requesting this loan for a repeat sowing.  He wants to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for a repeat sowing

loans.name: Kunama Group

texts.fr:
Emelyne est une commerçante âgée de 30 ans qui habite la  commune de Rugombo de la Province de Cibitoke a l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de sorgho depuis 3ans. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’au niveau de l’école primaire en 5e année. Elle est mère de 3 enfants dont 1étudie. Elle  arrive au 4e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités de sorgho à revendre à ses clients et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« KUNAMA».
texts.en:
Emelyne is a merchant, 30 years old, who lives in the Commune of Rugombo of the Province of Cibitoke, in western Burundi. She has been doing commerce in sorghum for three years. She attended school through the 5th grade. She is the mother of three children, of whom one is in school. 

Emelyne is now on her fourth community loan cycle with the micro-finance institution Turame. She is asking for a Kiva loan to increase her capital by buying large quantities of sorghum to resell to her customers and thus to increase her savings. 

Emelyne is a member of the group “KUNAMA”.

loans.use: to increase capital by buying large amounts of sorghum to resell to customers and thus to increase her savings

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Après un deuxième échec au Baccalauréat, l'emprunteuse s'est mariée et a ouvert un télécentre à son domicile conjugal.L'arrivée massive des téléphones portables sur le marché l'obligera à fermer et à se lancer dans l'aviculture qui s'est avérée très rentable. Malheureusement, c'est à ce moment que sa fille unique, qui venait de décrocher avec brio le BAC,décéde, noyée dans une piscine olympique.Traumatisée, elle n'arrive plus à s'occuper de ses affaires et pire, elle se fracture elle meme une cheville.Le malheur ne venant jamais seul, son fils sera amputé d'une jambe à cause d'une tumeure chronique.le poulailler tombé en faillite, son mari lui vient en aide et lui ouvre dans leur maison, une boutique de vente de produits alimentaires.Aujourd'hui, elle commence à se relever et sa boutique génére des revenus qu'elle utilise pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants.Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite 400000F afin d'acheter du riz, de l'huile, du sucre, du lait et d'autres divers produits. Son ambition est de devenir le grossiste de la zone.
texts.en:
After failing to earn her high school diploma for a second time, this borrower got married and opened a “telecenter” in her home. Mobile phones have inundated the market, and this compelled her to close up her business and start off in poultry farming, which proved to be very profitable. 

Unfortunately her only daughter, who just brilliantly clinched her high school diploma, has died having drowned in an Olympic swimming pool. Traumatized, she is no longer able to take care of things; worse, she fractured her ankle. Misfortune never travels alone; her son will have his leg amputated due to a chronic tumor. And her poultry business has failed. 

Her husband is helping out and has opened a store in their house for selling grocery items. Today, she is starting to pick herself up, and her shop generates the revenues she uses to meet her needs and those of her children. 

To increase her working capital, she is requesting 400,000 francs to buy some rice, oil, sugar, milk, and various other goods. Her ambition is to become a wholesale merchant in her area.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, milk, and various other goods

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne is a married woman with three school-age children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothing business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Roselyne dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lozi

texts.en:
Lozi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fess.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also sells fruits of mangoes and green vegetables which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Azizmo

texts.ru: Азизмо проживает в районе Дангары. Ей 38 лет. Она вдова. У нее двое детей. После смерти мужа она занялась бизнесом. Сейчас Азизмо занимается торговлей. Она продает мужскую одежду и парфюмерию. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 4 года. Кредит берет для покупки парфюмерии и детской одежды.
texts.en: Azizmo lives in the Dangara district.  She is 38 years old, a widow and has two children.  After her husband's death, she started her own business.  Currently, Azizmo is involved in retail sales.  She sells men's clothing and perfumery.  She has been in this business for four years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of perfumery and children's clothing.

loans.use: to purchase perfumery and children's clothing

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a charcoal business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation of commodities in her business. 

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to establish a charcoal stall and purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To establish a charcoal stall and purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 45 years old and lives in West Point and is married and her husband is a Tailor. They have four children ages 12 to 22, all of whom are in school and live with their parents. For the past five years she has been operating a bar & restaurant where she sells drink and food. She has a lot of customers but she normally closes very late. Caroline is requesting a loan to purchase soda, rice and other food items for her business, and she hopes to improve her restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase soda, rice and other food items for her business

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman with two children. One of her children attends school and one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

For the past two years, she has operated a food café business. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food café operators in the area. She dreams of establishing a clothes-selling business in the future.

With the KSHS 35,000, she wants to purchase three bales of clothes and pay for transport. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase three bales of clothes and pay for transport.

loans.name: Cheikh Oumar

texts.fr: Depuis trois ans, l'emprunteur tient une boutique de vente de produits alimentaires.Il a suivi des études jusqu'au lycée mais a du arréter à cause de problèmes de vision.N'étant plus capable d'étudier, il s'engage comme apprenti dans la boutique de son oncle qui l'aidera plus tard à ouvrir sa propre boutique de vente de produits alimentaires.Aujourd'hui,il sollicite auprès de l'UIMCEC un pret de 500000F pour acheter 2 tonnes  de riz, 200 litres d'huile et des produits divers.Il ambitionne de se lancer dans l'import - export.
texts.en:
For three years, this borrower has been running a grocery store. He pursued his studies up to the lycee (high school) but had to stop because of vision problems. Being no longer able to study, he became an apprentice in the store of his uncle, who later helped him to open his own grocery store. 

Today he is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs from UIMCEC to buy two tons of rice, 200 liters of oil, and various other products. His ambition is to start working in import-export.

loans.use: Acheter 2 tonnes de riz , 200 liters of oil, and various other products.

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru: Салима проживает в районе Яван. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж работает охранником. А старший сын находится в России. Сама Салима имеет высшее педагогическое образование. На сегодняшний день по профессии не работает. Он более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. В основном она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Salima lives in the Yavan district.  She is 45 years old, married and has four children.  Her husband works as a security guard, and the oldest son is in Russia.  Salima has a higher pedagogical education.  Today, she does not work in that field.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for over 15 years.  She breeds livestock at home, primarily for future sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a married man with seven children, five of whom attend school.  He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

For the past twenty years, he has operated a carpentry business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. His major challenge is the high cost of transportation for his business. He dreams of expanding his business to a wholesale shop in the future.


With the loan of Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase timber, iron sheets, sandpaper, varnish and glue. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase timber, iron sheets, sandpaper, varnish and glue.

loans.name: Ngom

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un paysan qui cultive du mil, de l'arachide et fait du maraichage.Il dispose de huit hectares qu'il exploite et dont une bonne partie de la récolte est destinée à la nourriture de sa famille qui est très large.Pour financer son activité d'agriculture, il pratique l'embouche bovine qui lui rapporte des revenus assez substanciels.Ainsi, il sollicite un pret de 150000F à l'UIMCEC pour acheter une vache qui sera engraissée et vendu au bout de quelques mois. Sona ambition est de creuser un puits foraghe dans ses chammps pour avoir de l'eau et faire du maraichage.
texts.en: The borrower is a peasant farmer who cultivates millet and groundnuts and does market gardening. He has at his disposal eight hectares that he cultivates and a large part of his harvest is used to feed his big family. To finance his agricultural activity he fattens cattle which brings in a fairly substantial income. Thus he requests a loan of 150000F from the UIMCEC to buy a cow which will be fattened up and sold in a few months. His ambition is to dig a well in his fields so that he can have water there and to do market gardening.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is 32 years old and lives in Kakata. He is single and has two children ages 5 and 10 who live at home and attend school. For the past two years he has been operating a bus for commercial transport. He makes a lot of profit and intends to make his business bigger. He is requesting a loan to purchase a taxi for his business. He hopes to purchase one truck in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a taxi for his business

loans.name: Yawah

texts.en:
Yawah is 40 years-old and lives in Kakata.  She is married and her husband is a business man. They have two children aged 19 and 26 who are presently attending school.

For the past 13 years she has been selling  used clothes and peanuts by buckets and cups.  She makes a great deal of profit, since she is the only one who is involved in this business in the community.  She is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes and bags of peanuts for her business.  Her plan is to build a house for her children in years to come.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes and bags of peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.ru: Саноат проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 38 лет. Замужем. Имеет 5 детей. Ее муж находится на заработках заграницей. Сама Саноат занимается растениеводством. Она выращивает овощи для продажи. В этой области она уже 7 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян.
texts.en: Sanoat lives in the Yavan district.  She is 38 years old, married and has five children.  Her husband is working abroad.  Sanoat is involved in agriculture.  She grows vegetables for sale.  She has been in this business for seven years.  Sanoat is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.ru: Комилджон проживает в районе Рудаки. Ему 29 лет. Он женат. Образование у него среднее. Комилджон уже 8 лет как занимается торговлей. На сегодняшний день у него имеется магазин, где он продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для покупки продуктов. Он хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Komiljon lives in the Rudaki district.  He is 29 years old and married.  He has a secondary education.  Komiljon has been involved in retail sales for eight years.  Today, he has a store, where he sells food products.  Komiljon is requesting this loan for the purchase of products.  He wants to expand an assortment of his merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bales of clothing to resell.

loans.name: Buvumu Development Group

texts.en:
Talk about being highly productive, 41 year-old Robert personifies that. Robert's resolve and prolificacy has been part and parcel of his success the last four years as he plys his charcoal sales trade in Kampala.

The affable father of three is also a teacher by profession.

Like many of his contemporaries, his involvement in an auxiliary business is, by and large, brought to pass by the low remuneration which teachers in Uganda have to contend with.  Many teachers have to supply the deficiencies in their salaries with side businesses. The earnings from his charcoal sales trade are invaluable in elevating his overall income.  Weekly this business's gross sales returns are to the tune of Uganda shillings 100,000.

Robert's group is on their second loan cycle. The repayment record has been good.

Robert says this Kiva loan will render him help in the purchase of more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a married man with one child who is too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his young siblings.

For the past four years, he has operated a retail shop, selling to his neighbors and passersby. His major business challenge is delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. Salim dreams of expanding his business to improve his standard of living.

With the loan of Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar to sell. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Baasanpurev

texts.en:
Baasanpurev is a 37-year-old father of two children. He is married to Enkhmunkh. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife works as an assistant teacher in the local kindergarten. Their son attends secondary school and their daughter will attend a primary school this autumn.  

Baasanpurev finished secondary school in 1992. Since 2008, he has been working as a seller in a local Korean market. He faces some risks in his work currently, such as thievery.  

Baasanpurev is requesting a 1.700.000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase necessary construction materials to finish his housing project, which is 80% done. In order to complete the project, he needs to buy materials for the interior structure as well. He is a responsible and ambitious man who is willing to provide a good quality of life for his family. He is very thankful to the lenders who are giving him an opportunity to finish the housing project.

loans.use: to buy necessary construction materials to finish his housing project.

loans.name: Tserendulam

texts.en:
Tserendulam is 53 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in Mongolia. From 1979 to 1991, she worked as a typist for the Price Standard Committee. She studied in secondary school from 1991 to 1995. Her husband works as a driver for a local petroleum company; their son works in Korea on a government labor contract. 
Since 1996, she has been operating a grocery store in her city. She has much business experience, so she has many customers.  She is requesting a 1.200.000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase products to sell in her store. She wants to expand her business and earn more money to make a good living.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell in her small store.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a restaurant, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is theft because of the security issues in her area of operation. She dreams of expanding her business to earn enough to provide a better education for her children. 

With the loan of Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and beans for her restaurant. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and beans for her restaurant.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with two children, ages 6 and 2. One of her children attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a business selling fuel to motorcycle operators in the area. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Bahati dreams of expanding her business to become a wholesale supplier of charcoal in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase fuel for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fuel for resale

loans.name: Karurama Group

texts.fr:
Esperance est une commerçante âgée de 30 ans qui habite la  commune de Rugombo de la Province de Cibitoke a l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de produits alimentaires consommables dans un restaurant depuis 3ans. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’au niveau de l’école primaire en 6e année. Elle est mère de 2 enfants dont 2étudient. Elle  arrive au 4e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités de produits alimentaires pour son restaurant et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  solidaire« KARURAMA»
texts.en:
Esperance is a businesswoman of 30 who lives in the commune of Rugombo in the province de Cibitoke in the west of Burundi. She has been selling consumable foodstuffs in a restaurant for three years. She studied up to the sixth year of primary school. She is the mother of two children; both are enrolled in school. She is on her fourth community loan with Turame. 

She is requesting this Kiva loan to grow her working capital by buying large quantities of foodstuffs for her restaurant so as to able to put aside more in savings. 

She is a member of the solidarity group «KARURAMA».

loans.use: to grow her capital by buying big quantities of foodstuffs for her restaurant so as to be able to put aside more in savings.

loans.name: Abasangiyurugendo Group

texts.fr:
Julienne est une commerçante âgée de 27 ans qui habite la  commune de Rugombo de la Province de Cibitoke à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de riz depuis 7ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a  fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 5e année primaire. Elle est mère de 6 enfants dont 3étudient. Elle  arrive au 4e cycle dans le crédit Solidaire avec Turame. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités de riz à revendre pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  solidaire« ABASANGIYURUGENDO».
texts.en:
Julienne is a 27 year old merchant who lives in the commune of Rugombo in Cibitoke Province in West Burundi.She has been selling rice for 7 years.She is also a farmer.She went to school until the 5th year of primary school.She has 6 children of whom 3 go to school.She has had 4 Solidarity loans with Turame.

She requests a Kiva loan to increase her capital by purchasing large quantities of rice which she will sell to make big profits.

She is a member of the ABASANGIYURUGENDO solidarity group.

loans.use: To increase her capital by purchasing large quantities of rice for resale to make big earnings.

loans.name: Abadahemana Group

texts.fr:
Claudine est une commerçante âgée de 35 ans qui habite la  commune de Rugombo de la Province de Cibitoke à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de tomates depuis 2ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle n’a fait pas fréquenté l’école. Elle est mère de 6 enfants dont 4étudient. Elle  arrive au 4e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités de tomates à revendre pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« ABADAHEMANA».
texts.en:
Claudine is a 35 year old merchant who lives in Rugombo in Cibitoke Province in West Burundi. She has been selling tomatoes for 2 years. She is also a farmer. She did not go to school. She has 6 children of whom 4 attend school. She has had 4 credit cycles with Turame.

She requests a Kiva loan to increase her capital by purchasing large quantities of tomatoes for resale to make big proceeds.

She is a member of the ABADAHEMANA community group.

loans.use: Increase her capital by purchasing large quantities of tomatoes for resale to make a significant gain.

loans.name: Kazoza Group

texts.fr:
Jacques est un commerçant âgé de 36ans qui habite  dans la ville de Gitega au centre du pays dans la Province de Gitega. Il  fait le commerce de produits  alimentaires(pommes de terre,manioc) depuis 5ans. Il est aussi cultivateur.Il a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 6e année des études primaires. Il est et père de 4enfants dont 2 etudient a l’ecole primaire. 

 Le crédit Kiva  de 110,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital en achetant une  plus grande quantité de produits alimentaires (pommes de terre et manioc) a revendre pour  réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« KAZOZA».
texts.en:
Jacques is a 36 year old merchant who lives in Gitega in the centre of the country in Gitega Province. He has been selling food products (potatoes, cassava) for 5 years. He is also a farmer. He attended school until the 6th year of primary studies. He has 4 children of whom 2 go to primary school.

The 110,000 Burundi franc Kiva loan that he requests  will allow him to increase his means by buying a larger quantity of food products (potatoes and  cassava) for resale to make a good profit.

He is a member of the « KAZOZA» community group.

loans.use: Increase his means by buying a larger quantity of food products (potatoes and cassava) for resale to make a good profit.

loans.name: Tugume Group

texts.fr:
Thomas est un commerçant âgé de 38ans qui habite  la localité de Mumuri au centre du pays dans la Province de Gitega. Il  fait le commerce de produits de boutique(haricots,riz,savons,biscuits,huile de palme,sel…) depuis 8ans. Il est aussi cultivateur. Il a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 5e année des études primaires. Il est marié a Henriette et père de 1 enfants qui etudie en 1ere annee primaire.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 250,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital en achetant une  plus grande quantite de produits de boutique( haricots,riz,savon,huile de palme,sel…) a revendre afin de  réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« TUGUME».
texts.en:
Thomas is a merchant, 36 years old, who lives in the town of Mumuri in the middle of the country in Gitega Province. He has been doing commerce in grocery items (beans, rice, soap, palm oil, salt...) for eight years. He is also a farmer. He attended school through the 5th grade. He is married to Henriette and is the father of one child, who is in the first grade. 

The Kiva loan of 250,000 Burundi francs that Thomas obtained will allow him to increase his capital while buying a bigger quantity of grocery items (beans, rice, soap, palm oil, salt...) to resell in order to make a large profit. 

Thomas is a member of the community group “TUGUME”.

loans.use: to increase capital while buying bigger quantities of store goods (beans, rice, soap, palm oil, salt...) to resell in order to make a large profit

loans.name: Tuvyurane Group

texts.fr:
Come est un commerçant âgé de 52ans qui habite  la localité de Mweya au centre du pays dans la Province de Gitega. Il  fait le commerce de chevres et porcs depuis 22ans. Il est aussi cultivateur. Il a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 2e année des études primaires. Il est marié a Goreth et père de 9 enfants dont 5 déjà maries et  3 sont a l’ecole. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 150,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital en achetant beaucoup de chevres et porcs a revendre afin de  réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« TUVYURANE».
texts.en:
Come is a merchant, 52 years old, who lives in the town of Mweya in middle of the country in Gitega Province. He has been doing commerce in goats and pigs for 22 years. He is also a farmer. He attended school through the 2nd grade. He is married to Goreth and is the father of nine children, of whom five are already married and three are in school. 

The Kiva loan of 150,000 Burundi francs he obtained will allow him to increase his capital by buying many goats and pigs to resell in order to make a large profit. 

He is a member of the community group “TUVYURANE”.

loans.use: to increase capital by buying a lot of goats and pigs to resell in order to make a large profit

loans.name: Elvis Daniel

texts.es: El Sr. Elvis es un joven trabajador de 23 años de edad, soltero; con ganas de salir adelante y superarse día a día, el joven Elvis se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi en su moto taxi; el viene trabajando desde los 18 años de edad en este servicio, ya que su padre le compro la moto y luego gracias a su trabajo y perseverancia se compro una nueva unidad (moto); Elvis gana aproximadamente S/.360 nuevos soles semanales. El joven Elvis va a utilizar el crédito otorgado en mejorar su cochera de su casa ya que actualmente necesita refaccionarla y también para mejorar su habitación. Sus sueño de Elvis es comprarse un automóvil y de esta manera tener otro ingreso adicional. El Sr. Elvis está muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado ya que con ello contribuye a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Elvis, 23, is a young, single worker driven to get ahead and improve day to day.  Young Elvis provides taxi services in his mototaxi.  He’s been working since the age of 18 providing this service since his father bought him the motorcycle and then, through his work and perseverance, he bought himself a new motorcycle.  Elvis earns about 360 new soles per week.  Young Elvis will use the granted loan to improve the carport at home because he needs to refurbish it and also to do some improvements in his bedroom.  Elvis’ dream is to buy a car to have an additional source of income.  Elvis is very grateful for the granted loan because it contributes to his improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to refurbish his carport and make improvements in his bedroom.

loans.name: Bhagabati

texts.en:
Bhagabati is 50 years-old .  She is married and has two children aged 25 and 21 years-old  In 1997, she established her grocery shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, she supports her family.

She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Kiva Partner Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to increase store inventory.  In the future, Bhagabati plans to expand the business.  She thanks you for your support. 

As a borrower extra training is needed in order to improve living standards. In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods for her shop.

loans.name: Reeta

texts.en:
Reeta is 36 years-old .  She is married and has two children aged 19 and 18 years-old.  In 2002, she established  her cow raising business.  Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Kiva partner Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a young milk giving cow.  In the future, Reeta plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

As a borrower extra training is needed in order to improve living standards.  Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buys a young milk giving cow.

loans.name: Neetu

texts.en:
Neetu is 29 years-old .  She is married and has one child, aged seven.  In 2004, she established  her grocery store business.  Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Kiva partner Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy store inventory.  In the future, Neetu plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support

As a borrower extra training is needed in order to improve living standards. In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.
