Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy costume jewelry.

loans.name: Leonsa Esperanza

texts.es: Leonza, 51 años edad, habitante de la ciudad de Granada, madre de un hijo, ella es comerciante, es dueña de una pequeña pulpería, también se dedica a la venta de sopas y cares, lleva 12 años en el negocio. A la edad de 15 años tenia un tramo de frutas y verduras en Estelí pero después se caso y se mudo a la ciudad de Loen don de puso una pequeña pulpería en su casa posteriormente quiso ampliar mas sus ingresos decidió vender comida. Su esposo aporta en el hogar con lo que gana de su salario y en sus ratos libre ayuda atender el negocio. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar granos básicos, leña, carne de res y productos de limpieza para vender en su pulpería Con esta inversión pretende surtir un poco mas u pulpería, atraer mas clientes al ofrecer mejores productos alimenticios mejorar sus ingresos. En lo próximo quiere hacerle mejoras a su negocio, reparaciones en su hogar, mantener  su negocio prosperando.
texts.en: Leonza is 51 years old, resident of the city of Granada, and mother of one child.  She is a merchant, owner of a small general store.  She also sells soups and meats.  She has been in this business for 12 years.  When she was 15 years old she had a stand selling fruits and vegetables in Esteli.  Later she got married and moved to the city of Loen where she opened a small general store in her home.  Later she wanted to increase her income and decided to sell meals.  Her husband contributes to the home with his salary and in his free time he helps with the business.  She needs the loan to buy basic grains, firewood, beef, and cleaning products to sell in her store.  With this investment she will better stock her general store, offering better products will attract more customers which will improve her income.  In the future she wants to make improvements to her business, repairs to her house and continue to prosper in her business.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, firewood, beef, and cleaning products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Sarita is 27 years-old .  She is married and has one child, aged four.  In 2005, she established  her grocery store business.  Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Kiva partner Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy store inventory.  In the future, Sarita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

As a borrower extra training is needed in order to improve living standards. In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods.

loans.name: Twitange Group

texts.fr:
Joselyne est une commerçante âgée de 30ans qui habite  la localité de Gihamagara au centre du pays dans la Province de Gitega. Elle  fait le commerce de bananes depuis 8ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 6e année des études primaires. Elle est mariée a Pontien et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 sont a l’ecole. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 120,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital en achetant beaucoup de bananes a revendre afin de  réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« TWITANGE».
texts.en:
Joselyne is a merchant, 30 years old, who lives in the town of Gihamagara the middle of the country in Gitega Province. She has been doing commerce in bananas for eight years. She is also a farmer. She went to school through the 6th grade. She is married to Pontien and is the mother of five children, of whom two are in school.

The Kiva loan of 120,000 Burundi francs she obtained will enable her to increase her capital to buy a lot of supplies in order to make a large profit.  

Joselyne is a member of the community group “TWITANGE”.

loans.use: to increase capital to buy a lot of bananas to resell in order to make a large profit

loans.name: Yuderlin Yuritza

texts.es: La Joven Yuderlin, de 19 años de edad, esta casada, es madre de un niño de 2 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, de oficio comerciante. Ella inicio  a los 6 años de edad vendiendo de manera ambulante ropa en los mercados y terminales de buses, después ella compro un carretón con estructura metálica ahí coloco ropa y calzado para vender desde entonces se ha convertido en su herramienta de trabajo ahora ya tiene un punto fijo donde vender, su esposo le ayuda a ella con lo que el gana como albañil. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa y calzado para vender. Ella quiere poder tener mercadería para vender pues considera que el mes de Agosto y Septiembre son buenos meses de venta para ella. Su meta próxima es terminar sus estudios de secundaria ya que solo tiene aprobado el tercer año, y quiere comprar otro carretón para vender ropa.
texts.en:
Yuderlin, 19, is married and the mother of a two-year-old child.  She lives in the city of León and is a saleswoman by trade.  At the age of 6 she began selling clothing as a street vendor in markets and bus terminals.  Later she bought a small metal cart from which to sell clothing and footwear.  Since then, the cart has become her equipment for work, and now she has a fixed location where she sells.  Her husband helps her with what he earns as a bricklayer.

Yuderlin needs a loan to buy clothing and shoes to sell.  She wants to be able to have merchandise to sell because she thinks August and September are good months for sales for her.

Yuderlin's next goal is to finish high school, since she only completed her third year.  She also wants to buy another cart for selling clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Karla, es originaria de Santa Rosa del Peñón municipio de León, tiene 33 años de edad, esta casada, madre de tres hijos, ella es comerciante tiene una tienda de ropa. Inicio su negocio hace un año pero anteriormente ya se dedicaba a la comercialización de ropa, pero de manera ambulante al no colocar alguna mercadería la distribuía en su casa y se dio cuenta que la podía vender en su propio vecindario, entonces compro de vitrinas, luego 2 estantes y cuando se dio cuenta ya tenia una mini tienda de ropa siendo este su primer negocio y medio de subsistencia. 
Solicito el préstamo para comprar mercadería en general como camisas sport de hombre  de mujer, pantalones, carteras, bolsos y maniquíes para dar una mejor presentación a su negocio. Con esta inversión  quiere amplia su mercadería, hacerla mas atractiva al ofrecer variedad de ropa. Su meta es ampliar mas su tienda y ofrecer calidad y variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Karla, originally from Santa Rosa del Peñón municipality of León, is 33 years old, married, and mother of three children.  She owns a clothing store.  She started her business a year ago, although before that she used to sell clothing as a street vendor and also sold from her home.  She realized that she could sell in her own neighborhood so she bought display windows and later two racks. Before she realized she had a mini store which was her first business and her way of making a living.
She is requesting the loan to buy general merchandise such as sport shirts for men and women, pants, wallets, bags and mannequins to give a better appearance to her business.  With this investment she wants to increase her merchandise, and make it more attractive with the offer of a larger variety of clothing.  Her goal is to expand her store and offer better quality and variety of products.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise such as sport shirts for men and women, pants, wallets, bags and mannequins.

loans.name: Abibumbiyehamwe Group

texts.fr:
Daphrose  est une commerçante  âgée de 47 ans . Elle habite  la localité de Mweya en province de Gitega.  Elle vend les produits alimentaires dans un restaurant depuis 16 ans et fait aussi la broderie.Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait les études jusqu’en 6e année primaire.Elle est divorcee et a 8 enfants dont  4 étudient avec 1 qui est a l’ecole secondaire .
 Le crédit de Kiva de 80000 Fbu va  lui permettre  d’augmenter  le capital  afin d’acheter beaucoup  de  produits  alimentaires comme la farine et des fils pour sa broderie dans le but de realiser de grands bénéfices. 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire  “ABIBUMBIYEHAMWE”
texts.en:
Daphrose is a merchant, 47 years old, who lives in the town of Mweya in Gitega Province. She has been selling food in a restaurant for sixteen years, as well as embroidery. She is also a farmer. She went to school through the 6th grade. She is divorced and has eight children, of whom four are in school with one in middle school. 

The Kiva loan of 80,000 Fbu is going to enable her to increase her capital to buy a lot of supplies, such as flour and thread for her embroidery, with the goal of making a large profit.  

Daphrose is a member of the community group “ABIBUMBIYEHAMWE”.

loans.use: to increase capital to buy a lot of grocery items, such as flour and thread for her embroidery, with the goal of making a large profit

loans.name: Guadalupe Elizabeth

texts.es:
Guadalupe, de 44 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de León, tiene dos hijos, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería. Inicio su negocio con dinero proveniente de su liquidación de su antiguo trabajo en un supermercado local donde trabajo por 7 años, empezó vendiendo galletas elaboradas por ella misma y posteriormente fue invirtiendo en compra de granos básicos y poco a poco fue surtiendo su pulpería. 
Requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, gaseosas y otros productos de consumo masivo. Con esta inversión espera mantener satisfechos a sus clientes, variar su mercadería y hacer crecer su negocio. Su próxima meta es comprar 2 estantes de aluminio y dos vitrinas para colocar productos.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 44, lives in the city of León.  She has two children and is a merchant.  She owns a grocery store.  She started the business with money from her severance pay from her previous employment in a local supermarket where she worked for seven years.  She started out selling cookies she made herself and later started investing in the purchase of basic grains and gradually stocked her grocery store.

She needs the loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, soft-drinks and other mass consumption items.  With this investment she hopes to keep her customers satisfied, to vary her merchandise and to make her business grow.  Her next goal is to buy two sets of aluminum shelving and two display cases to place her products.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, soft-drinks and other mass consumption items.

loans.name: Adilia Esperanza

texts.es:
Adilia casada, su esposa trabaja como chofer, sus hijos ya mayores. Su proyecto mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda. Trabaja cocinera desde hace tiempo. Inicio a realizarle mejora a su vivienda con fondo propio y esfuerzo. La seguridad y comodidad es la meta para cumplir.  Con el préstamo comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, piedrines, piedra cantera, láminas de zinc entro otros materiales para la construcción de un anexo a la casa. 
Agradece a ala financiera por el apoyo a l desarrollo socio económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Adilia is married, her husband works as a driver and her children have now grown up. Her project is to improve the infrastructure of her home. She has worked as a cook for some time. She began her home improvements with her own funds and effort. The ultimate goal is safety and comfort. With the loan she will buy construction materials such as: cement, sand, gravel, quarry stones and zinc roofing sheets, among other items needed for the construction of a house extension.

She is grateful to the financier for the support of the socioeconomic development of her family.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Twunguke Ii Group

texts.fr:
Chantal  est une commerçante  âgée de 26 ans . Elle habite  la localité de Gihamagara en province de Gitega.  Elle vend la farine de manioc et l’huile de palme depuis 6 ans.Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait les études jusqu’en 6e année primaire.Elle est mariée  à Zeduc qui fait lui aussi le commerce de haricot.Ils ont ensemble 3 enfants  dont  1 étudie a l’école primaire.
 Le crédit Kiva de 300000 Fbu va  lui permettre  d’augmenter  le capital  afin d’acheter  beaucoup  d’huile de palme et de  farine de manioc à revendre pour réaliser  de grands bénéfices. 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire  “TWUNGUKE II”
texts.en:
Chantal is a merchant, 26 years old, who lives in the town of Gihamagara in Gitega Province. She has been selling cassava flour and palm oil for six years. She is also a farmer. She went to school through the 6th grade. She is married to Zeduc, who also does commerce in beans. Together they have three children, of whom one is in primary school. 

The Kiva loan of 300,000 Fbu is going to enable Chantal to increase her capital to buy a lot of palm oil and cassava flour to resell in order to make a large profit. 

Chantal is a member of the community group “TWUNGUKE II”.

loans.use: to increase capital to buy a lot of palm oil and cassava flour to resell in order to make a large profit

loans.name: Migambi Group

texts.fr:
Concilie est une commerçante âgée de 32ans qui habite au centre du pays dans la localité de Bukirasazi. Elle fait le commerce des produits de boutique comme le sel, la farine, le haricot, le savon,etc depuis 16ans. Elle a commence ce métier après sa sortie d’école. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 6e année primaire. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 3 étudient a l’école primaire. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 550,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de produits de boutique(sel de cuisine,farine,haricot,savon) à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  solidaire« MIGAMBI».
texts.en:
Concilie is a 32-year-old shopkeeper who lives in the middle of the country in Bukirasazi. She has been selling small products, like salt, flour, beans, soap, etc. for 16 years. She started doing this after she left school. She attended school until the 6th grade. She is married and a mother of four, three of whom attend elementary school. The Kiva loan of 550,000 Burundi francs that she is getting will allow her to increase her means to buy large quantities of small products (salt, flour, beans, soap) for resale to make a good profit.
She is a member of the Migambi group.

loans.use: to increase her means to buy large quantities of small products (salt, flour, beans, soap) for resale to make a good profit.

loans.name: Cleotilde

texts.es: Cleotilde de 41 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 12 a 23 años, en el municipio de San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolívar, tierra de tejidos verticales con los que fabrican hamacas, mochilas, sandalias y otras artesanías, actividades transmitidas de generación en generación, aprendidas principalmente por mujeres desde tempranas edades. Esta es justamente la tarea en la que  Cleotilde ha encontrado una forma de generar ingresos, para apoyar la gestión de su hogar, pues fabrica y vende artesanías variadas y materiales que compran principalmente artesanas de San Jacinto, para con sus manos elaborar los más hermosos y reconocidos productos en el Caribe Colombiano, que impactan a los turistas de otros países cuando transitan esa vía, al ser conducidos a la bella e histórica ciudad de Cartagena de Indias.  La experiencia emprendedora de Cleotilde inició con la fabricación de galletas tradicionales llamadas almojábanas, donde le fue muy bien, pero debió abandonarlas por los efectos negativos, que la actividad causó en su salud; así fue como inició el negocio de producción de hamacas, oficio que ya conocía y gradualmente fue adicionando su comercialización,  simultánea a la venta de materiales e insumos, para que las artesanas de su pueblo consiguieran en su punto comercial lo que necesitaban para ejercer su actividad productiva. Cleotilde tiene tres años de estar vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización de la cual ha recibido 6 créditos  con los cuales ha logrado incrementar su capital de trabajo, comprar vitrinas, un peso electrónico un devanadora de hilo eléctrica y sus ingresos han generado el mejoramiento de las condiciones habitacionales de su vivienda. Su meta es continuar la expansión de su negocio adicionar maquinarias para realizar mejores acabados a los bolsos que fabrica y brindarle a su hijo menor, a su cargo, educación universitaria. Su mayor desafío es responderle a su clientela pues como todos los días crece su capital de trabajo aún se torna insuficiente, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, séptimo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materiales para responder oportunamente a pedido de bolsos, mochilas y hamacas; su experiencia en la actividad es su mayor fortaleza y su éxito radica en ello y especialmente en el buen manejo de sus obligaciones y su permanencia con la Fundación organización con la que ha logrado incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Cleotilde is 41, lives with her husband, and has 3 children ages 12 to 23. They live in the San Jacinto municipality in Bolívar department,  an area where fabric is woven on vertical looms, from which hammocks, knapsacks and sandals are made. This skill is handed down from generation to generation, and learned from an early age, mainly by women. 

This is precisely the work in which Cleotide has found a way of generating income, and meeting her household expenses. She makes and sells a variety of handicrafts, and materials that are mainly bought by the artisans of San Jacinto. They use these to make the finest and most-renowned hand-crafted products in the Columbian Caribbean; the ones that impress tourists from other countries when they travel that route on their way to the beautiful and historic city of Cartagena de Indias. 

Cleotilde's entrepreneurial experience began with making traditional cookies called almojábanas. This went very well, but she had to give it up, because of the negative effect this work had on her health.  This was how she started her business of making hammocks; a trade that she already knew. Gradually she started selling them. At the same time she began selling materials and supplies, so that the artisans of her town could get what they needed for their production at her store.

Cleotilde has been associated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 3 years, and has received 6 loans from the organization. With these, she has managed to increase her working capital, and to buy a display case, an electronic scale, and an electric thread winder. Her income has allowed her to improve her housing conditions. 

Her goal is to continue expanding her business, adding more machines to do better finishing work on the bags she makes. She also wants to offer a university education to her youngest son, for whom she is responsible.  Her greatest challenge is meeting customer demand, since even though her  working capital increases daily, it is becoming insufficient. 

This is why she is coming to her Credikiva for her seventh loan from Fundación Marion Santo Domingo. She will use the loan to buy materials to fill orders for bags, knapsacks and hammocks in a timely way.  

Her experience in this business is her greatest strength; this and her good management of her obligations, as well as her long association with the Fundación, are the reasons for her success, and what has enabled her to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy materials to fill orders for bags, knapsacks and hammocks in a timely way.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: La señora Marisol , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo e hijas , él le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que labora en una empresa privada , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar siempre en sus estudios a sus pequeñas para que logren   realizar una carrera profesional , doña Marisol tiene serios problemas con el techo del hogar ya que en tiempos de lluvia la casa que llena de agua ocasionando inundación , lo cual solicita que se le apoyo debido a que su salario no le ajusta para comprar de una sola vez todos los materiales que necesita para la inversión del techo . Agradece la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondo Kiva para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marisol lives in the town of Ticuantepe with her husband and daughters.  Her husband helps her with the household expenses since he works for a private company.  Her plans for the future are to improve her living conditions and always support her daughters in their studies so they succeed in accomplishing professional careers.

Marisol has serious problems with the roof of her house since the house fills with water in the rainy season and causes flooding.  For this reason she is requesting support, given that her salary is not enough to buy all at once the materials she needs to invest in the roof.

She is grateful for the trust that Afodenic places in her through the Kiva funding, so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy zinc for the roof.

loans.name: Brenda De La Concepcion

texts.es:
Brenda, de 42 años de edad, nacida en la ciudad de León, madre de dos hijos uno de 18 años y el otro de 14 años el mayor de sus hijos estudia su primer año en la universidad, estudia la carrera de administración de empresas, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de tomates, cebolla y papas al por mayor y al detalle. Ella inicio en este negocio por la falta de empleo y la necesidad de criar a sus hijos, ella estudio Ingeniería Agrónoma trabajo  8 años es un programa para asistencia técnica del algodón pero después quedo sin empleo y ella necesitaba buscar un medio que le permitiera sacar a su familia adelante y fue de esta manera que comenzó a vender café con leche en el mercado de manera ambulante luego paso al sector de las frutas ya tiene 14 años de vender en el mercado de la terminal de buses de León, y es de esta manera que ella para los estudios a sus hijos.   
Requiere el préstamo para comprar tomate, cebolla, y papas. Con esta inversión tendrá producto para ofrecer y vender. En sus planes futuros quiere comprar un camión para vender en todo león y sus municipios.
texts.en:
Brenda, 42, was born in León.  She’s the mother of two children, an 18-year-old and a 14-year-old.  The oldest is in the first year of university studying Business Administration.  She’s a merchant selling tomatoes, onions and potatoes at wholesale and retail.  She started the business because employment was scarce and she needed to raise her children.  She studied Agronomy and worked for 8 years in a cotton technical assistance program but became unemployed later and she needed to find a way to support her family.  This led her to start off selling coffee with milk at the market and then moved into fruit sales.  She’s now been selling in the León bus terminal market for the last 14 years and this is how she’s earned enough for her children’s education.

She needs the loan to buy tomatoes, onions and potatoes.  With this investment she’ll have product to offer and sell.  In her future plans is the purchase of a truck to sell throughout León and its townships.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Nelis Beatriz

texts.es: Nelis de 43 años vive con sus dos hijos en las edades de 16 y 21 años y es la propietaria una tienda escolar  donde vende refrescos y mecatos,  negocio 	que inició con sus ahorros y el apoyo del centro educativo donde estudia su hijo, que le posibilitó tener la tienda escolar, negocio del cual genera sus ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus dos hijos. Allí inició vendiendo salpicón de frutas y gradualmente fue introduciendo otros productos, como gaseosas, jugos y pasabocas en general. Su meta es lograr recursos de financiación, porque su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente para lograr su crecimiento y esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con la cual comprará nuevas líneas de pasabocas para diversificarlo y ver su negocio bien surtido. Esta inversión será exitosa por el potencial de clientes fijos que tiene en el colegio y su capacidad personal de trabajo, experiencia en el marco de este negocio y su gran impulso por aumentar cada día más el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nelis is 43 years old and lives with her two children, aged 16 and 21 years old. She owns a school store where she sells soft drinks and packed lunches. She initiated the business with her savings and also with the support of the educational institute at which her son studies. This support afforded her the opportunity to have the school store, a business which generates income for the support of her two children. She began by selling fruit cups and gradually introduced other products, such as sodas, juices and snacks in general. 

Her goal is to obtain funding as her working capital is not sufficient to achieve growth. This is precisely why she has turned to credikiva and it is the first time she has approached the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for financing, with which she will buy new lines of snacks to diversify and have a well-stocked shop. This investment will be successful for the potential of the fixed customers that she has at the school and also for her personal work experience in the business and her strong drive to improve her children's welfare everyday.

loans.use: To buy new lines of snacks to diversify and have a well-stocked shop.

loans.name: Evelia Francisca

texts.es: Evelia, de 40 años de edad, es originaria de León, esta casada, madre de 4 hijos todos ellos están estudiando el mayor de sus hijos estudia su cuarto año en la universidad el estudia matemáticas, de oficio comerciante, tiene una pulpería donde vende frutas, verduras, gaseosas y granos básicos, su nivel académico es básico solo termino el 4 grado de primaria. Su primer negocio fue un comideria lo tuvo por 8 años, luego puso su pulpería que tiene 2 años de tenerla. Requiere el préstamo para compra de frutas, verduras, y granos básicos. Pues quiere surtir su pulpería de productos que le demandan sus clientes, hacerla mas popular para atraer clientela. En sus planes esta vender carne, pollo, embutidos que son productos que aun no vende .Su meta próxima es sacar adelante a sus hijos, pagarle sus estudios universitarios y mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Evelia, 40, is from León.  She’s married and the mother of four children who are all in school.  Her oldest child is in the fourth year of university studying Mathematics.  She’s a merchant.  She has a grocery store where she sells fruit, vegetables, soft-drinks and basic grains.  Her academic level is basic, she only completed fourth grade of elementary school.  Her first business was an eatery; she had it for 8 years.  Then she opened a grocery store that she’s had for two years now.  

She needs the loan to buy fruit, vegetables and basic grains because she wants to stock her store with the products her customers request to make it more popular and attract customers.  In her plans is meat, chicken and cured meat sales:  all products she still does not sell.  Her next goal is to move her children forward, to pay their university studies and to improve the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and basic grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy perfumes, cosmetics, talcum powders, and other products that have been ordered by her customers.

loans.name: Dalibeth

texts.es: Dalibeth  de 30 años tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 3 a 7 años y se dedica a la actividad comercial en punto de ventas, que nació hace 4 años, para adquirir experiencia empresarial y hacerlo crecer hasta convertirlo en una gran empresa familiar, legado que sueña con dejar a sus hijos. Dalibeth vende de contado y a crédito a clientes entre amas de casa, vecinos y especialmente referidos. Su meta es capitalizar su negocio porque su proyección de crecimiento no es coherente con el dinero que tiene para lograrlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su Credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará artículos de la canasta familia, confitería, ropa de cama, productos para el hogar, accesorios femeninos etc. Su inversión planea será exitosa porque la realizaría a propósito de la época donde hay un gran repunte en sus ventas, el mes del amor y de la amistad para la cual se prepara con un negocio surtido y una exhibición que impacte los sentidos y potencialice la compra. Su sueño es tener varios puntos comerciales y muy seguramente estaría capacitándose antes de iniciar el cumplimiento de su sueño, con el cual aumentaría sus ingresos familiares y generaría posibilidades exitosas para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dalibeth is 30 years old and has three children who range in age from 3 to 7 years old.  She has a business that she started four years ago.  This has allowed her to gain experience as an entrepreneur and grow her venture into a successful family business, which will be a legacy that she dreams of leaving to her children. Dalibeth conducts cash and credit sales with her customers who include housewives, neighbors, and especially referrals.  Her goal is to capitalize her business because her projected growth does not correspond with the money that is coming in the door.  For this reason she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  

Dalibeth will use the money to buy everyday food products, candy, bedding, household products, women’s accessories, and other items.  Her investment will be successful because she expects a huge spike in her sales during the month of love and friendship (the Colombian equivalent of Valentine’s Day).  Exhibiting her products should stir up the sentiments of her customers and result in potential sales.  Her wish is to have several business locations and to assure herself with additional training before fulfilling her dream.  As a result, Dalibeth hopes to increase her family income and create successful opportunities for her children.

loans.use: to buy everyday food products, candy, bedding, household products, women’s accessories, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials and accessories for sewing as well as products that have been ordered by her customers.

loans.name: Nelcy

texts.es: Nelcy de 32 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos, en la ciudad de Cartagena, e inició su negocio de venta de mercancías variadas como ropa, calzado, cosméticos, y gradualmente con sus ingresos que se fueron incrementándose, agregó la oferta de servicios de alquiler de lavadoras;  La iniciativa de emprender su aventura empresarial la tuvo pues necesitaba apoyar en los gastos de su hogar, pero con su éxito ahora su negocio es su proyecto de vida. La mayor parte de sus mercancías las vende a crédito y por eso sus cuentas por cobrar son altas y es un gran desafío responderle a sus clientes oportunamente, pues debe reunir el dinero que recupera para hacerlo. Su razón por la cual acude a su credikiva es para financiar su cartera y lograr incrementar sus clientes y oxigenar su negocio, así mismo aumentar la oferta de servicios de alquiler de lavadora, pues en la actualidad se queda corta su respuesta a su creciente clientela. Este es su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará 1 lavadora y mercancía variada, que planea vender a propósito del mes del amor y amistad, periodo en el que tradicionalmente hay un gran incremento en  sus ventas y Nelcy no piensa dejar de aprovechar esta coyuntura. Más adelante sus planes de crecimiento se centran en agregar otros negocios, como el de telecomunicaciones e internet, para generar crecimiento por nuevas fuentes de trabajo que incrementen sus ingresos y respondan a un mayor bienestar para su hogar.
texts.en:
Nelcy is 32 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the city of Cartagena. She started her business by selling various types of merchandise such as clothes, shoes, and cosmetics. As her income gradually increased, she began renting out washing machines. This venture was started because she needed to contribute to the household expenses. Now that her business is successful, it has become her project for life. Most of her sales are made on credit, so her rate of billing collections is high. Her greatest challenge is getting her customers to respond in a timely manner because she needs to collect the money in order to recoup her investment.

Her reason for applying for a Kiva loan is so that she can finance her bills, increase her customer base, and pump new life into her business. Nelcy also wants to expand her washing machine rental service because she cannot respond quickly enough to her growing clientele. This is her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use the money to buy one washing machine and a variety of merchandise in time to sell during the month of love and friendship (the Colombian equivalent of Valentine’s Day). This period is when she traditionally sees a large spike in her sales and Nelcy does not plan to forego this opportunity. Going forward she plans to grow by adding other businesses, such as telecommunications or an Internet café, so that she can create new sources of work to increase her income and provide for the greater well-being of her household.

loans.use: to acquire an additional washing machine for rental and to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly es una mujer D. 60 años que tiene 6 hijos en las edades D. 32 a 43 años y se dedica a la actividad comercial desD. hace 8 años, para apoyar la gestión D. bienestar D. su hogar, que hasta ese momento se encontraba a cargo D. su cónyuge quien se dedica al oficio D. albañil, actividad estacionaria con la que muchas veces queda cesante y se requería seguir adelante con un generador D. ingresos constante como el que representa su venta D. mercancías variada con la que hoy se siente satisfecha y desea hacer crecer. Su credikiva es el segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que la ha apoyado en el ligero crecimiento D. su capital D. trabajo y con la cual quiere seguir creciendo. Con este financiamiento Nelly comprará en mayor volumen mercancías, cervezas, gaseosas, ropa D. cama etc. En mayor volumen, con el fin D. ganar descuentos y generar mayores utilidades para su negocio, con las que pueda hacer mejoras habitacionales que es uno D. sus mayores desafíos.
texts.en:
Nelly is a 60-year-old woman who has six children between the ages of 32 and 43. She has managed a business for eight years in order to support the welfare of her household. At the moment Nelly is the sole breadwinner because her husband, who is a bricklayer by traD., is on furlough because his job has frequent stops. However, she is able to move her family forward by generating a steady income through the sale of various goods. Today Nelly feels satisfied and has the desire to grow. This Kiva loan is her second occurrence of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization that has helped her by providing slight increases in her operating capital which she has used to continue growing.

With this loan Nelly will buy large volumes of merchandise, beer, sodas, bedding, and other products. By purchasing in bulk, she will be able to obtain discounts and generate bigger profits from her business. This will allow her to make home improvements, which is one of her greatest challenges.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, beer, sodas, bedding, and other products in bulk.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: Rodrigo de 60 años es un hombre casado que tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 23 a 35 años, y vive en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, donde inició su negocio de tienda, aprovechando su experiencia de 35 años como comerciante y 31 de haber emprendido su aventura de negocios, hoy convertida en una tienda donde vende ranchos, víveres, licores, enlatados, abarrotes, refrescos y todos los artículos de la canasta familiar. Sus principales clientes son las amas de casa de sus alrededores, a quienes les otorga créditos de rotación  semanal, quincenal y mensualmente, aunque también vende de contado. Con su negocio ha sacado adelante a su familia, pero cada día tiene un gran desafío y es el de tenerlo surtido con todo lo que solicita su creciente clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará mercancía a un mayor volumen para disminuir los costos de transporte y obtener buenos descuentos. Su meta mas adelante mejorar la infraestructura física de su tienda, y a corto plazo, mantenerla surtida con productos comprados de contado y con descuentos para hacerle frente a la competencia fuerte con la que interactúa.
texts.en:
Rodrigo, age 60, is a married man with five children between the ages of 23 and 35. He lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias, where he opened his store. Rodrigo has taken advantage of his 35 years of experience as a merchant. He started this business venture when he was 31 and has now converted it into a store where he sells snacks, food, liquor, canned goods, groceries, soft drinks, and all types of everyday consumer products. His main customers are housewives from the surrounding areas. He extends credit to them and offers repayment plans on a weekly, biweekly, or monthly schedule. Rodrigo also conducts cash sales. Through his business, he is able to help his family move forward. However, his greatest challenge each day is having to restock with everything that his customers request. For this reason he is requesting a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

Rodrigo will use the money to buy merchandise in greater volume so that he can lower his transportation costs and obtain good discounts. His goal later on is to improve the physical infrastructure of his store and, in the short-term, maintain an inventory of products through cash purchases and discounts. This will help him confront the strong competition that he must deal with every day.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in bulk.

loans.name: Esther Judith

texts.es:
Esther de 48 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 19 a 30 años, dos de los cuales ya independientes y a su cargo su hija menor, en el municipio de San Jacinto. Tierra del tejido vertical, técnica con la que elaboran hamacas, mochilas, sandalias y otras artesanías, actividades transmitidas de generación en generación, aprendidas principalmente por mujeres desde tempranas edades. Esta es justamente la tarea en la que  Esther se desempeña  desde hace tres años y ha encontrado una forma de generar ingresos, para apoyar la gestión de su hogar: fabrica y vende artesanías variadas como las hamacas, mochilas, bolsos y accesorios y otras manualidades reconocidas en el Caribe Colombiano y que impactan a los turistas de otros países, cuando transitan por la carretera Troncal de Occidente, variante de San Jacinto, población muy cerca  a la bella e histórica ciudad de Cartagena de Indias.  
Su mayor desafío es tener capital de trabajo para comprar sus insumos y otras artesanías que piden sus clientes ubicados en las ciudades de Cartagena, san pues y en los mismos negocios ubicados al borde de la carretera troncal de Occidente. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará hilo, para elaborar bolsos y mochilas, pellones y hamacas, su inversión en estos materiales le genera seguridad porque está basada en pedidos y está rodeada de muy buenos clientes. Su meta más adelante es tener mejores condiciones habitacionales, pero mientras esto ocurre se esmera en trabajar generando una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 11% desde la cual proyecta el progreso de su negocio.
texts.en:
Esther is 48 years old and lives with her husband. They have three children who are between the ages of 19 and 30. Two of her children are already independent and her youngest daughter is still under her responsibility. Esther lives in the town of San Jacinto, a place known for “vertical knitting”, a technique used for making hammocks, satchels, sandals, and other handicrafts. This skill is passed from generation to generation, taught primarily to women at an early age. Esther began learning this skill when she was three years old and now it is how she earns an income to support her household. She produces and sells various handicrafts such as hammocks, satchels, bags, and other items that are known throughout the Colombian Caribbean. They have made an impact on tourists from other countries whenever they travel along the Troncal de Occidente Highway, which turns off of San Jacinto, a town that is close the beautiful historic city of Cartagena de Indias.

Her greatest challenge is having operating capital to buy supplies and other crafts that have been ordered from her customers in the city of Cartagena who have businesses located along the Troncal de Occidente Highway. For this reason she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Esther will use the money to buy yarn for making bags, satchels, cushions, and hammocks. Her investment in these materials will generate security because she has enough orders and is surrounded by very good customers. Her goal in the future is to have better living conditions. In the meantime, Esther continues to work hard and is able to generate profitability of no less than 11%, which is an indicator of the progress her business has made.

loans.use: to buy yarn for making bags, satchels, cushions, and hammocks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: La señora Rebeca y su esposo son una pareja muy estable, que desean que su pequeño hijo de 1 año no le falte nada, hacen lo posible para que tengan una vida digna. Desde hace 2 años viven en casa prestada de un familiar, por lo que ellos desean tener su propio patrimonio y en este momento se les presenta la oportunidad de enganchar un terreno a un precio accesible y pagos cómodos que no afecte la estabilidad económica de la familia. Rebeca quiere aprovechar la oportunidad ya que es la forma que iniciaría la construcción de lo que será su hogar, de esta manera le podrán ofrecer a su pequeño hijo un mejor patrimonio.
texts.en:
Sra. Rebeca and her husband are a very stable couple. They want their one-year-old son to not lack anything so that it is possible for him to have a decent life. For the past two years, they have lived in a rented house that belongs to a relative. They want to have their own property and have been presented with the opportunity to acquire a plot of land at an affordable price and with convenient payment options. This will not have a negative impact on the economic stability of their family.

Rebeca wants to take advantage of this opportunity to begin the construction of their home since it will allow them to provide an inheritance for their son.

loans.use: to acquire a plot of land for building a house.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es: El señor Norberto y su esposa la señora  desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de productos de segunda mano, los productos que ella vende son ropa usada de temporada, zapatos, juguetes, artículos para el hogar, muebles, bolsas de dama; Norberto es hombre emprendedor que con la ayuda de su esposa han logrado cada objetivo y cada obstáculo que les presenta la vida. A esta pareja de comerciante la crisis económica que vive el país no los detiene para seguir con su trabajo ya que es la forma que sostienen los gastos del hogar. Durante los 7 años que ha permanecido en el negocio ha sido su única fuente de ingresos y sabe que entre más producto tenga en existencia sus ventas incrementaran y solicita el apoyo para compra de ropa de temporada.
texts.en:
Sr. Norberto and his wife have been selling secondhand clothing for seven years. The products they offer include used seasonal clothing, shoes, toys, household goods, furniture, and women’s handbags. Norberto is an enterprising gentleman who, with the help of his wife, has been able to achieve each of his goals and overcome every obstacle that life presents. The economic crisis in their country has not prevented this pair of merchants from continuing their work because this business enables them to sustain the household expenses. For the past seven years, this business has been their only source of income.

Norberto knows that having more products will result in increased sales, so he is requesting assistance so that he can buy seasonal clothing.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing to restock his business.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar es un hombre trabajador y muy responsable hace unos años se divorcio de su esposa por circunstancias que estuvieron fuera de sus manos, aunque la perdida fue mayor por los años de matrimonio que vivieron juntos, el siguió adelante y se refugio en el trabajo para olvidar sus penas. Cesar ya contaba con su propio negocio de abarrotes, denominado “Miscelánea C.” que ya tiene 15 años establecido en su misma vivienda, donde ofrecer variedad de producto como lo es botanas, refrescos, lácteos, tortillas, latería y mas. Este negocio ha sido su única fuente de ingresos al igual que su propio refugio, por lo que el desea comprar mayor mercancía para que  este mejor surtido y obtenga mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Cesar is a very hardworking and responsible man who got divorced from his wife a few years ago due to circumstances that were beyond his control.  Although the loss was great after years of living together in the marriage, he pushed ahead and took refuge in his job in order to forget his pain.  Cesar has had his own grocery store, called “Miscelánea C.,” for 15 years; it is located in his house.  In the store, he offers a variety of products for sale, including: snacks, soft drinks, dairy products, tortillas, canned goods, and more.  This business has been his sole source of income as well as his place of refuge.  He wants to buy more merchandise so that he can stock the store better and obtain greater earnings.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Claudia Azeneth

texts.es: La señora Claudia Azeneth ya tiene mas de 15 años de casada, pero en tan largo tiempo de matrimonio no había podido embarazarse, recurrió a infinidad de doctores para que resolvieran su caso pero nadie le podía ayudar, por lo que se dio por vencida. Hace unos meses ocurrió el milagro mas esperado y mas anhelado de esta familia, se encuentra embarazada de lo que será su primer hijo. Ahora lo que a Claudia le preocupa es el bienestar y comodidad del pequeño, la casa donde actualmente vive, las paredes se están deteriorando por lo que necesita  comprar material y pagar mano de obra para que se las reparen y las enyesen. Este proyecto lo quiere realizar antes de que nazca el pequeño para que no le  afecte en la salud
texts.en: Claudia Azeneth had already been married for more than 15 years, but over the long period of her marriage she was not able to get pregnant.  She went time and again to a large number of doctors to try to resolve the problem, but none of them were able to help her, and so she gave up.  Then a few months ago, the most unexpected miracle occurred, one that this family had wished for so much.  She found herself pregnant with her first child.  Now Claudia worries about the well-being and comfort of the child.  In the house where she currently lives, the walls are deteriorating and so she needs to buy material and pay for labor to have them repaired and plastered.  She wants to finish this project before the birth of her little one, so that the child's health will not be affected.

loans.use: to plaster the walls of her house

loans.name: Jose Rubén

texts.es: El señor José Rubén se dedica al transporte público de esta misma ciudad desde hace 12 años, trasladando a la gente de un lugar a otro. En este momento el camión donde hace sus rutas necesita mantenimiento por eso quiere un préstamo para comprar las partes que necesita y pagar al mecánico que le hará el trabajo. José Rubén desea tener su unidad en mejores condiciones para ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio, de esta manera prevenir un accidente a causa de un problema técnico. El oficio de chofer que el desempeña lo realiza con gusto ya que es su única fuente de ingresos para el sostén familiar.
texts.en: José Rubén has worked in the public transport business in this same city for 12 years, moving people from one place to another. In this moment the bus where he run his routes needs maintenance, which is why he wants a loan to buy the parts that he needs and to pay the mechanic to do the job. José Rubén desires to have his unit in better conditions to offer his customers better service and prevent an accident due to a technical problem. He performs his occupation as a chauffeur with gusto, since it is the only source of income to support the family.

loans.use: to repair his bus.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es: La señora María Angélica cuenta su propio negocio de abarrotes desde hace 16 años, denominado “Miscelánea Águilas Aztecas” donde ofrece variedad de producto en general. Angélica demuestra a sus clientes una amabilidad al igual que buena calidad en sus productos que ofrece, lo cual le permite tener mayor número de clientes.  Por tal motivo desea comprar mercancía como lo es refrescos, lácteos, abarrotes, botanas, por que ella sabe que entre mas producto y variedad tenga sus ventas incrementan. Angélica es madre de dos pequeños los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida, el negocio y su esposo que trabaja en maquiladora es la fuente de ingresos que sustenta a la familia.
texts.en: Señora María Angélica has had her own general store for more than 16 years.  It is called, "Miscelánea Águilas Aztecas" (Aztec Eagle General Store), where she offers a variety of general merchandise.  Angélica shows her customers friendship as well as good quality in the products she offers, which lets her have a bigger number of customers.  This is why she wants to buy merchandise like soft drinks, dairy products, groceries, and snacks, because she knows that the more products and variety she has, the more her sales will increase.  Angélica is the mother of 2 small children to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life.  Her business and the money her husband earns from working in an assembly plant are the sources of income that support their family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: El señor Armando solicita  un préstamo para impermeabilizar su vivienda; por que en las temporadas de lluvias el agua se trasmina y su techo se esta deteriorando. Armando quiere prevenir que el problema se agrave  y tenga que gastar más de lo previsto. Para poder cubrir los gastos el trabaja en maquiladora de Lunes a Viernes al igual que su esposa para tener un ingreso mas  se  quedan tiempo extra. Armando es padre de una niña de 4 años, de la que quiere formar una mujer de bien y para hacerlo el necesita ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Armando is requesting a loan to waterproof his house.  During the rainy season the water seeps through, and his roof is deteriorating.  Armando wants to prevent the problem from getting worse, and he has to spend more than he thought he would.

In order to be able to cover the expenses he works in an assembly plant from Monday through Friday.  His wife does the same.  In order to have more income they work overtime. 

Armando has a four year old daughter, and he wants her to become a good woman.  In order to do so he needs to provide her with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to waterproof the roof.

loans.name: Rosa Patricia

texts.es:
Rosa casada, su esposo albañil, sus hijos estudiantes. Su proyecto establecer su venta de frutas. Trabaja para una empresa privada desde hace un tiempo. Con el apoyo de su esposo anda ido mejorando poco a poco su vivienda faltándole mayor inversión en la casa ya que requiere mejoras las paredes y poner el piso. Utilizara el préstamo que solicitad para la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, piso entre otros materiales. 
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo en el desarrollo de mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is married.  Her husband is a bricklayer, and her children go to school.

Her project is establishing her fruit sales.  She has worked for a private company for some time.  With her husband’s support she has little by little been improving her house.  Greater investment in the house is needed because the walls need improvements, and the floor needs to be put down.

She will use the requested loan to buy construction materials like cement, sand, and flooring, among other things.

She is grateful for the loan for the support in developing a better standard of living.

loans.use: to put down a floor.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Mujeres Activas.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 9, 7 y de 1 año de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en escuela. El marido trabaja en el campo. 

Nuestra amiga a mas de ser una gran madre y ama de casa también se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos para lo cual tiene una pequeña graja aprovechando que su casa  está ubicada en el campo, allí tiene las facilidades para poder criar estos animalitos que le dejan muy buenos ingresos cuando los vende. Nos cuenta que los compra cuando están pequeños y luego los mantiene por un tiempo y cuando están listos los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa y ellos los llevan a los distintos mercados del cantón y la provincia, lleva 5 Años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimento y medicinas tanto para los pollos como para los chanchos para que tengan un buen desarrollo. Lleva 3 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y no quedar mal con los pagos al banco.
texts.en:
In the 24 de Mayo Canton in Manabí province, known for its beautiful scenery, its forests, its varied fauna and for its kind, hardworking people dedicated to farming and animal husbandry, the “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) communal bank meets every two weeks.

Rosa lives here.   She’s 30 and in a common law relationship.  She has three children who are 9, 7 and 1 year old.  The two oldest are going to school.  Her husband is a field hand.

Our friend, besides being a great mother and housewife, also raises chickens and pigs.  She has a small farm taking advantage of the fact that her house is located in the countryside.  She has all the facilities there needed to raise these little animals which produce good profits when she sells them.  She tells us that she buys them when they are small and then raises them for a time and when they are ready she sells them to merchants that come by her house and then they take them to the various markets in the canton and province.  She’s been in this business for five years and does quite well.

This loan is to buy chickens and feed and medicines both for the chickens as for the pigs so that they will develop properly.  She’s been in the communal bank for three years and likes it because the loans have helped her out quite a bit.  Her dream is to continue forward and not to disappoint with her bank payments.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed and medicine for pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Luisa Maribel

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Mujeres Activas.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Luisa, tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 9 hijos, uno mayor de edad y ocho menores seis de ellos estudian en colegio y  escuela. El marido se dedica a la agricultura.
 
Ella al ver que lo que hace su esposo en el campo no le alcanza para solventar los gastos del hogar  se dedica a la cría de pollos para lo cual tiene una granja en la cual mete hasta 200 pollos por temporada, nos cuenta que ella compra los pollitos en una incubadora en Portoviejo y luego los mantiene por espacio de tres meses tiempo adecuado para que tengan un buen crecimiento para luego entregarlos a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa y también distribuye a algunas tiendas locales, además de vender en su casa a los vecinos y personas de la localidad.

Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimento y medicinas  para que los pollos tengan un buen desarrollo. Lleva 3 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Sus sueños son tener buena salud ella y su familia.
texts.en:
In the 24 de Mayo Canton in Manabí province, known for its beautiful scenery, its forests, its varied fauna and for its kind, hardworking people dedicated to farming and animal husbandry, the “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) communal bank meets every two weeks.

Luisa, 37, lives in this place.  She’s in a common law relationship and has nine children.  One is an adult and eight are minors.  Six of them go to secondary and elementary school.  Her husband is a farmer.

Seeing that what her husband earns in the field was insufficient to cover household expenses she started to raise chickens.  She has a farm where she can raise up to 200 chicks per season.  She tells us that she buys the chicks from an incubator in Portoviejo and then raises them for a period of three months which is enough time for them to reach good growth and be sold to merchants that come by her house.  She also sells to some local stores as well as from home to her neighbors and local people.

This loan is to buy chicks, feed and medicine for them so that they will have good growth.  She’s been in the communal bank for 3 years and likes it because the loans are easy to do.  Her dream is that she and her family enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy chicks, fed and medicine for them.

loans.name: Dalia Asunción

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Mujeres Activas.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora Dalia, tiene 45 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, dos mayores de edad y tres de 13, 7 y 3 años dos estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido trabaja en un taller mecánico.
 
Nuestra amiga se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos para lo cual tiene una pequeña graja en su casa. Nos cuenta que mete hasta 100 pollos por temporada y que estos los compra cuando están pequeños en un centro de ventas en el cantón y luego los mantiene por un tiempo y cuando están listos los vende en su casa a personas que llegan hasta allí o si no los pela y lleva a entregar al mercado local a comerciantes que venden por libras, a los chachos su esposo los faena y luego venden la carne en su casa a vecinos y conocidos. Nos cuenta que llevan más de seis años que se dedican a esta labor.
Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimento y medicinas tanto para los pollos como para los chanchos para que estos  tengan un buen desarrollo. Lleva 8 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en: The Mujeres Activas (Active Women) Community Bank meets every 15 days in the village of 24 De Mayo, province of Manabí, which is known for its beautiful landscapes, its forests, the variety of fauna and for its friendly and hard-working people who typically make a living in agriculture and livestock. It is here we find Dalia. She is 45, married and has five children, two of whom are adults and the youngest three are ages 13, 7 and 3 and in school. Her husband works at a mechanic's shop. Dalia makes a living raising chickens and pigs on the small farm she has at her house. She tells us she gets up to 100 chickens a season, which she buys when they're little at a commercial center in the village and then raises them for a time until they're ready to sell. She sells the birds out of her home to people who come there and if not she plucks them and takes them to the market to sell to the local merchants. Her husband takes care of the pigs and then they sell the meat out of their home to neighbors and acquaintances. Dalia tells us that she has six years of experience with this job. She plans to use the loan to purchase chickens as well as feed and medicines for both the chickens and the pigs to ensure they have a good development. She has been with the community bank for eight years and she enjoys it because the loans have helped her a lot. Her goals are to keep making headway and to have good health.

loans.use: to purchase chickens as well as feed and medicine for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Nelly Marlene

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Mujeres Activas. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nelly, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos de  22, 20, 18, 17, 15, 12 y 5 años de edad, los tres menores estudian en colegio y escuela, seis de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y tala de árboles.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de zapatos, zapatillas y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días ya que además de realizar sus ventas también se dedica a la cría de gallinas y chanchos ya que cuenta con un lugar adecuado para esto, sus productos los vende puerta a puerta y deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para invertirlo en sus negocios, va a comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos para la venta y alimento de chanchos para sus animales. Lleva dos años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho.
 
Sus sueños son ver que sus hijos estén bien.
texts.en: The Mujeres Activas (Active Women) Community Bank meets every 15 days in the village of 24 De Mayo, province of Manabí, which is known for its beautiful landscapes, its forests, the variety of fauna and for its friendly and hard-working people who typically make a living in agriculture and livestock. It is here we find Nelly. She is 37 years old, married and has seven children, ages 22, 20, 18, 17, 15, 12 and 5. The youngest three are in school, and six of the seven still live with her. Her husband makes a living in agriculture and logging. Nelly is a housewife who in order to earn her own income makes a living selling shoes, slippers and Avon beauty products. She works every day because along with being a saleswoman she also raises hens and pigs because she has a place set up for it. She sells her products door to door on credit, which she collects every eight days. She has three years of experience with the job and it's going very well. She plans to use the loan to invest in her businesses by purchasing perfumes, creams and cosmetics to sell and then pig feed for her animals. She has been with the community bank for two years and enjoys it because the loans have helped her a lot. Her dreams are to see her children do well.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and pig feed.

loans.name: Genny Marlene

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Montecristi se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Genny, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, de 21, 19, 14 y 11 años de edad, uno de los mayores estudia en universidad y los menores en  colegio. Su esposo es chofer.

Nuestra amiga realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el cual tiene un taxi que es el sustento de toda la familia, su esposo trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 en la ciudad de Manta, nos cuenta que el lleva con esa profesión más de 18 años y que gracias a Dios nunca ha tenido ningún contratiempo  a pesar de que la profesión del taxista es muy peligrosa.

Este crédito lo van a emplear en comprar tres llantas y repuestos para arreglar el taxi. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por tres años y le gusta porque con los créditos han podido mantener el taxi en buen estado.
 
Sus sueños son comprar otro carro más nuevo.
texts.en: The Montecristi Community Bank meets every 15 days in the village of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-Columbian culture and for its craft-work recognized on a national and international level. The village is famous for its straw hats. It is here we find Genny. She is 40 year old, married and has four children, ages 21, 19, 14 and 11. One of the older ones attends a university, while the younger ones are in school. Her husband is a taxi driver. Genny is requesting the loan for her husband's taxi, which is the sustenance for the entire family. Her husband works every day from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. in the city of Manta. She says he has been in the profession for more than 18 years and thanks to God has never had any problems even though being a cab driver is very dangerous. They plan to use the loan to purchase three tires and spare parts to fix the taxi. Genny has been with the community bank for three years and enjoys it because the loans have helped her and her husband keep the taxi in good shape. Their dream is to buy another, newer car.

loans.use: to purchase three tires and spare parts for her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Nanny Soledad

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Montecristi se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nanny, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de  24 años de edad el mismo que estudia en universidad y  aun vive en su casa. Su esposo trabaja con maquinaria pesada.

Ella tiene una tienda general en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, además de ciertos artículos de bazar, papelería y algunas medicinas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando está desocupado. Tiene dos años con su negocio el cual a crecido poco a poco.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, cuadernos, tarjetas y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 ciclos y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.   

En la foto está la Señora Nanny con su sobrina.
texts.en: The Montecristi Community Bank meets every 15 days in the village of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-Columbian culture and for its craft-work that is recognized at a national and international level. The village is famous for its straw hats. It is here we find Nanny. She is 43 years old, married and has a 24-year-old son who attends a university and still lives at home. Her husband works with heavy machinery. Nelly runs a general store out of her home selling all kinds of products, such as rice, sugar and oils as well as bazaar items, stationery items and some medicines. She works every day from 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. and sometimes later. Her son helps her with the work when he is free. She has had the business for two years and it has grown little by little. She plans to use the loan to better stock her store, purchasing rice, sugar, oils, detergents, notebooks, cards and other primary-need products. She has had four loan cycles with the community bank and enjoys it because the group is very close. Her goals are to make headway with the business and for her store to grow every day. Nelly is with her niece in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oils, detergents, notebooks, cards and other primary-need products.

loans.name: Diana Beatriz

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Montecristi  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Diana, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija de  19 años la cual ya está comprometida y tiene una hermosa bebe que es la adoración de nuestra amiga. Su esposo es distribuidor de sodas.

Nuestra amiga trabaja de maestra en una escuela de la ciudad y también se dedica al comercio, ella vende productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja de lunes a viernes y  sus ventas las realiza en su tiempo libre, vende a sus compañeras y madres de familia que llegan hasta el plantel, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene tres  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien. Su esposo también se dedica a distribuir sodas en su carro por toda la ciudad.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos para la venta y sodas para el negocio del esposo. Lleva tres años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos en relación a otros bancos. 

Sus sueños son tener un nombramiento del estado como maestra.
texts.en: The Montecristi Community Bank meets every 15 days in the village of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-Columbian culture and for its craft-work that is recognized at a national and international level. The village is famous for its straw hats. It is here we find Diana. She is 43 years old, married and has a 19-year-old daughter, who is engaged and has a beautiful baby whom Diana adores. Diana's husband is a soda distributor. She works as a teacher at a city school and also makes a living in commerce, selling Avon beauty products and accessories. She teaches Monday through Friday and makes her sales in her free time, selling items to co-workers and mothers who come to the campus. She sells her items on credit and collects every 15 days. She has been doing this activity for three years and it is going very well. Her husband distributes soda all over the city with his car. With the loan, Diana plans to purchase perfumes, creams and cosmetics to sell as well as sodas for her husband's business. She has been with the community bank for three years and enjoys it because the interest rates are a lot lower compared to other banks. Her dream is to have a state appointment as a teacher.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and sodas.

loans.name: Briggiti Maribel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Montecristi  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Briggiti, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de  17 años de edad el mismo que estudia el último año de colegio. Su esposo es empleado público.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse algo propio se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta  donde llegan sus clientes cuando tiene mercadería nueva, nos cuenta que también trabaja a base de pedidos de sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil y también en ocasiones le envían desde los Estados Unidos ya que allá tiene familiares. Lleva seis  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal dos años.
 
Sus sueños es ver que su hijo termine sus estudios y sea un buen profesional.
texts.en:
The Montecristi village bank meets every 15 days in the village of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and its crafts, which are famous around Ecuador and abroad. It is the place where the famous straw Panama hats are made.
Here we met Briggiti, a 47-year-old woman. She and her husband have a 17-year-old son who is in his last year of high school. Her husband is a civil servant.
In order to earn something for herself, our friend sells all sorts of clothes door to door. Customers also come to her house when she has new merchandise, and she tells us that she also takes special orders from her customers. She works every day, and offers eight-day credits to her customers. She travels to Guayaquil to purchase her goods and sometimes receives shipments from the United States, where some of her relatives live. She's been making a living this way for six years and it's going rather well.
She will use this loan to buy more goods to sell, including pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing. She's been a member of the village bank for two years.
Her dream is to see her son finish his studies and get a good job.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is 47 years old and married with six children: four boys and two girls. None of her sons could complete their education due to financial constraints and they started working to financially support the family. Her eldest son operates a lathe machine. The son next to him is a welder and the younger one is an expert in mobile repair. The youngest doesn’t do anything. Her eldest daughter has completed her graduation and now works as a teacher in a private school. Her younger daughter has also become a teacher after completing her matriculation. Her husband is an electrician by profession. He offers electrical repair services to his customers and earns income for the family.
  
Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy electrical repair tools and some electrical supplies like bulbs, tube lights, wires, etc. to diversify his business. Khalida is hopeful that her husband's business will be established further after making the loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Khalida.

loans.use: To buy electrical repair tools and electrical supplies

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Naseem akhtar is 39 years old and married with four children: two daughters and two sons. Her eldest daughter was educated to the 10th standard and now stays at home and does her household work. Her youngest daughter is in 9th standard. Her eldest son is a welder and the youngest one is in 5th standard. 

Naseem herself is a health worker and she provides health awareness facilities to her community members. Besides her work, she carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well.  

Her husband is involved in a vegetable-selling business. He has been serving his customers for the past six years. He has a good reputation and maintains a good clientele base that prefers buying vegetables from him instead of others due to his good and fresh quality vegetables. 

Naseem akhtar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy onions, potatoes and other vegetables in bulk to offer more to his customers and earns better profits. Naseem is hopeful that her husband’s financial position will be improved further after the loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Naseem akhtar.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen supports her family financially by stitching clothes and selling clothes. Mostly her clients are from her community. They give her regular orders because she offers them a good variety of clothes to buy. She is married and has five children. Two of her sons are married and operate a printing business. Her second son is a rickshaw driver. Her daughters are enrolled in a school and getting their education.
 
Shaheen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her business selling clothes. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk to be able to provide a variety to her clients and increase her sales.  She has been operating her business for the past eight years and hopes that by offering a better variety of clothes to her clients, she will be able to earn more profits and improve the living standard of her family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shaheen.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: 23 De Junio Group

texts.es:
El Grupo 23 de Junio es una Unidad de desarrollo (UDE) que esta conformada por nueve integrantes, La señora Teresita es uno de los integrantes ella tiene la edad de 35 años estudio hasta la preparatoria y esta casada con el señor Misael que trabaja como soldador, ellos tienen dos hijos pequeños que asisten al sexto y tercer grado de primaria.
