Doña Teresita nos platica su esposo trabaja como soldador de muelles de autos y siempre tenia problemas para conseguir los materiales para realizar su trabajo ya que tenia que tranladarse a otra comunidad para comprarlo asi que ella platico con su esposo ahorraron un poco de dinero y abrieron ya hace diez años una pequeño negocio de venta de Lubricantes y mofles, ella nos dice que su negocio ha hido cresiendo poco a poco y asi ha podido ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos, ella nos dice que su negocio ha tenido exito ya que piensa que la clave es el buenservicio que brindan y  la amabilidad con que se trata a los clientes. 

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de  partes electricas, suspencion, mofles, escapes, fuel inyection,balatas, lubricantes, cables de bujias y bujias para resurtir su negocio su negocio.

ella espera que este credito le ayude a que su negocio prospere ya que  en el futuro le gustaria  convertirlo en una refaccionaria.

los demás  integrantes son:

Olga venta de ropa
Guadalupe venta de pollo
Claudia venta de ropa
Dalia venta de abarrotes 
Helodia venta de abarrotes
Jose venta de carne
Cistina venta de tortillas 
Giovanny venta de sandalias
texts.en:
The June 23rd Group is a Communal Bank that consists of nine members, one of them being Sra. Teresita.  She is 35 years old and has a preparatory school education.  Teresita is married to Sr. Misael, who works as a welder.  They have two young children, who are in the 6th and 3rd grades respectively.  

Doña Teresita says that her husband, in his work as a welder, always has problems with acquiring materials for his job.  He must travel to another community to buy what he needs.  After talking with her husband, Teresita saved up a little bit of money and opened a small business 10 years ago.  There she sells lubricants and mufflers.  Teresita says that her business has grown a little bit at a time and has enabled her to help her husband with the household expenses and the education of their children.  She says that the key behind the success of her business is providing good service and treating her customers in a friendly manner.

Teresita needs this loan to invest in the purchase of electrical parts, suspensions, mufflers, exhaust pipes, fuel injectors, balances, lubricants, spark plug wires, and spark plugs to restock her business.  She hopes that this loan will help her business prosper so that she can convert it into a repair shop in the future.  

The other members are:
•	Olga – clothing sales
•	Guadalupe – chicken sales
•	Claudia – clothing sales
•	Dalia – grocery sales
•	Helodia – grocery sales
•	Jose – meat sales
•	Cristina – tortilla sales
•	Giovanny – selling sandals

loans.use: to buy electrical parts, suspensions, mufflers, exhaust pipes, fuel injectors, balances, lubricants, spark plug wires, and spark plugs.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is unmarried and lives with her father. She is 38 years old and is involves in making & selling artificial jewelry. She makes bracelets and neck chains with beads. There is a high demand for these items among women and especially girls. She also sells jewelry in her region by purchasing them from different areas in good quantities.
   
EID (a Muslim occasion) is near and she has a larger number of orders to fulfill. That’s why she has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. With the loan, she will buy jewelry of good designs in a larger quantity and beads of different varieties to be able to meet her orders and earn a profit. She is very talented and has been operating her business for more than a year. She is very confident that an investment will help her earn large profits and improve her business conditions.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Farzana.

loans.use: To buy jewelry and beads

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her second son who is a movie maker and offers movie-making services on different occasions such as wedding ceremonies, birthdays etc. With the loan, he will buy a movie camera and film rolls to provide better quality work to his clients and increase his income. He is very good in his work and has started doing this business just a year ago. Bilqees is very much hopeful that an investment will help him establish his business and increase his profits. 

Bilqees is married and her husband is a mason.  She is the mother of three sons. The eldest son works in a factory and the youngest son is studying in class 5th. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Bilqees.

loans.use: To buy a movie camera and film

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan is married and her husband is involved in making & selling bread. He makes bread in a tandoor (a kind of oven made with mud and burns with fire in it). Bashiraan also supports her husband in his business. Both Bashiraan and her husband have divided working hours between them and operate their business in this way. Bashiraan is also a very good housewife and performs her routine tasks very well. She has given birth to six children. One of her children works while the others stay at home. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of their business of making bread. With the loan, they will buy flour and wood in a larger quantity to make bread and increase their profits. Bashiraan hopes that an investment will bring positive changes to their business and make them more profits.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bashiraan.

loans.use: To buy flour and firewood

loans.name: Anwer's Group

texts.en:
Anwer is a very talented lady who makes artificial flowers to support her husband financially. She has a good number of business contacts and makes a regular income from her business. She not only sells the flowers to her neighboring areas but also sells them to different gift shops at a profit. Out of her six children, she has enrolled three of them in school. The others do work. Her husband is involved in a business selling farm supplies (fertilizers, seeds and pesticides). He sells these products through his shop and handles a good clientele base. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides in a larger quantity to be able to fulfill the demands of his customers and increase his sales and profits. He has been operating his business for many years and has a vast experience in his field. Anwer hopes that her husband’s business will get better after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Maqsooda's Group

texts.en:
Maqsooda is a very active and caring lady in nature. She carries out her responsibilities of a housewife very well. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. Her husband is involved in making calendars. He is very talented and makes beautiful calendars according to his customer demands. Maqsooda is the mother of four children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her husband’s calendar-making business. With the loan, he will buy the required materials such as paper, thread, etc. to make calendars in larger quantities to sell. He has been operating his business for the past 22 years and has a vast knowledge of his field. Maqsooda hopes that after the loan investment, her husband’s business will be improved further and her family will be able to live a better financial life as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Maqsooda.

loans.use: To buy materials to make calendars

loans.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Tahira is a very active and talented lady who supports her family financially by stitching clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very good at her work and receives regular orders every month. Her husband makes boxes used for packing shoes and supplies them to shoe factories and shoe shops.   
Tahira has five children. Her eldest son is an employee in a private firm. Her younger son works with his father in his shoe box making business and her youngest son is in kindergarten. Her elder daughter stitches clothes and her younger daughter is a teacher.
  
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy glue, hard paper etc. in a larger quantity to be able to make boxes in larger numbers and earn higher profits. Tahira is very confident that her husband’s business will grow in a positive direction after making the loan investment.
  
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Tahira.

loans.use: To buy glue and hard paper to make shoe boxes

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a 51-year-old woman. She is married and has three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a municipality employee with a decent salary. In addition, he works as a taxi driver to improve the family income. Nawal has a taxi that takes internal and external requests. She wants to pay the taxi insurance fees and make some internal finishing to her house such as putting down tiles, painting the walls, etc. The money Nawal has isn't enough to pay for all these expenses, so she is in need of a loan of 2,000 from FATEN.

When Nawal gets the FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will pay the insurance fees for the taxi. That will help her husband who is the taxi driver to work extra hours and take more requests, which will improve the family's source of income. In addition, Nawal will pay to make some finishing to her house. Then she and her family will live in better conditions. Nawal is a religious conservative woman so her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: To pay for taxi insurance fees and house finishing expenses.

loans.name: Jamela

texts.en:
Jamela is a 40-year-old woman. She is married and has four sons and one daughter. She lives in Jenin city located in Palestine. Jamela and her husband are employed with decent salaries, but Jamela also has a project raising ornamental birds to sell, which is a good source of income for her family. Jamela wants to buy more new cages and fodder for the ornamental birds she is raising to sell, but the amount of money Jamela has isn't enough to pay. So, she needs to take a loan from FATEN for $3,000.

When Jamela has the loan from FATEN, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to increase the number of cages for sale and to buy fodder to feed the ornamental birds to stay for a longer time. That will improve the family's source of income, especially since there is a good demand for this kind of bird.

Jamela is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead while holding his son.

loans.use: To pay for cages and fodder for ornamental birds.

loans.name: Dusangire I Group

texts.fr:
Munaria est une commerçante âgée de 35ans qui habite au centre du pays dans la localité de Bukirasazi. Elle fait le commerce de vaches depuis 15ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 6e année primaire. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 3 étudient a l’école primaire. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 170,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter des vaches à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« DUSANGIRE I».
texts.en:
Munaria is a 35-year-old merchant who lives in the town of Bukirasazi in the center of the country. She is a member of the community group DUSANGIRE I.

She started selling cattle 15 years ago, and she is also a farmer. She attended primary school up to the 6th grade. She is married with five children, three of whom are in primary school. 

This first loan of 170,000 Burundian francs will help her to increase her working capital and buy cattle for resale to earn substantial profits.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy cattle for resale

loans.name: Khosbayar

texts.en:
Mr.Khosbayar requested a loan to renovate his business equipment. He is 30 years-old and manages a small photo studio near the downtown.  He lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Since 2007, he has been running his business constantly. At first, he took a loan from Khas Bank and used it to start his business.  At present, his photographic equipment has become old and he needs to replace them immediately because they are the main tools of his job.  Therefore, he needs to purchase a new photo camera and other complete sets.  He believes that his earning will be notably increased if he can replace his equipment and kits.

loans.use: to purchase a new photo camera and other complete sets.

loans.name: Sangwe I Group

texts.fr:
Clotilde  est une commerçante  âgée de 44 ans . Elle habite  au centre du Burundi dans la  province de Gitega.  Elle vend la biere locale de banane  et du sorgho  depuis 6 ans.Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle  n’a  pas fait les etudes mais a suivi l’alphabetisation des adultes. Elle est veuve avec 2 enfants qui etudient a l’ecole primaire.
 Le crédit Kiva de 200000 Fbu va  lui permettre  d’augmenter  le capital  afin d’acheter  une grande quantite de biere locale à revendre pour réaliser  de grands bénéfices. 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire  “SANGWE”
texts.en: Clotilde is a 44-year old businesswoman.  She lives in the center of Burundi in the Gitega province.  She has been selling local beer made of bananas and sorghum for the past six years. She is also a farmer. She did not go to school but has attended adult literacy classes.  She is a widow with two children who attend primary school.  The Kiva loan of 200,000 Fbu will allow her to increase her working capital in order to buy a large quantity of local beer to resell for a large profit.  She is a member of the "SANGWE" community group.

loans.use: to increase her working capital in order to buy a large quantity of local beer to resell for a large profit.

loans.name: Bat

texts.en:
Mr. Bat is 30 years-old.  He is a taxi driver who lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Last April, he bought a new car for his business from another loan and he repaid it successfully and on time. He had been paying MNT37,700 everyday to the lender and now he has been saving this amount of money everyday due to having finished that loan.

Recently, he purchased a small sized piece of land in a suburb and he must build a timber fence there.  Therefore, he requested a loan to purchase some timbers to build a fence for his land. Currently, this family lives in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent.  They plan to build a house on their land after the fence is built.

loans.use: to purchase some timber to build a fence for his land.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.ru:
Виктор женат, у него трое взрослых детей. Виктор родом из Каменки. Он одно время работал на севере, откуда приехал 14 лет назад. Сейчас Виктор занимается животноводством, торгует мясом и к тому же выращивает овощи. В Каменке этим заниматься выгодней всего.  Виктору больше нравится заниматься животными, а жена активно помогает ему с работой в теплицах, где они выращивают помидоры. Виктор занимается фермерством уже 11 лет. У Виктора большое хозяйство, 2 га земли. 

Виктору необходим кредит в размере 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить комбикорма и вырастить свиней до зимы. Он надеется подогнать вес и через 3 месяца сдать партию свиней. Виктор – трудолюбивый фермер, ему нравится заниматься этим делом, а желание развиваться помогает ему двигаться дальше и вкладывать еще больше сил и средств в свое дело. В этому году Виктор расширяет животноводство и строит дополнительный маточник на 50 поросят.  

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Victor is married and has three adult children. He was born in Kamenka. For a while he used to work in the North, from where he returned 14 years ago. Now Victor raises farm animals and sells meat and also grows vegetables. This is the most profitable business in Kamenka. Victor especially likes taking care of the animals, and his wife actively helps him working in the green houses where they grow tomatoes. Victor has been working as a farmer in 11 years. He has a large farm, with two ha [about 5 acres] of land.

Victor needs a loan of 10,000 UAH in order to buy compound animal feed and raise pigs before the onset of winter. He is hoping to fatten a herd of pigs and sell them   three months later. Victor is a hard-working farmer. He likes his work, and the desire to develop his business motivates him to keep going and invest even more effort and resources in his farm. This year Victor is expanding  by building an additional farrowing pen for 50 piglets.


Note: the loan description is in Russian

loans.use: to buy compound animal feed and fatten up pigs before winter

loans.name: Rimma

texts.ru:
Римма – разведена. Она сама воспитывает двоих дочерей. Римма живет в Каховке и работает на местном рынке, торгуя женской подростковой одеждой. Римма занимается этим видом торговли уже на протяжении нескольких лет. У нее товара на сумму 50 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль превышает 7 000 гривен. 

Римма планирует использовать кредит в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить подростковую одежду к школе и увеличить прибыль благодаря дополнительным продажам. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Rimma is divorced.  She is raising two daughters on her own.  Rimma lives in Kahovka and works at the local market selling junior girls' clothes.  Pimma has been doing this work for several years.  She has stock worth 50,000 hryvnia, and her net profit exceeds 7,000 hryvnia. 

Rimma plans to use her loan for 10,000 hryvnia to buy juniors' school clothes and increase her profit through increased sales.

loans.use: to buy juniors' school clothes and increase her profit through increased sales.

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга замужем. Она – предприниматель из Каховки, где она торгует женской и мужской обувью, а также сезонно канцтоварами перед началом учебного года. Бизнесом Ольга занимается уже около 14 лет, а начала она свое дело, потому что вынуждена была найти возможности обеспечивать свою семью в непростое экономическое время.  

Ольге необходим КИВА кредит размером в 20 000 гривен для пополнения ассортимента обуви, а также для закупки канцтоваров для розничной реализации перед началом нового учебного года. Ольга надеется разнообразить свой ассортимент и тем самым удовлетворить потребности покупателей и получить дополнительную прибыль. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Olga is married. She's an entrepreneur from Kahovka and owns a business dealing in men's and woman's shoes and, seasonally, school supplies prior to the school year's start. She began her business 14 years ago in order to provide for her family during difficult economic times. She's asking for a loan in order to resupply her shoe stock and purchase school supplies (intended for retail sale) before the school year starts. By diversifying her merchandise, she hopes to fulfill the needs of her customers and attain some additional profit.

loans.use: restock her shoe supply and purchase school supplies before the beginning   of the school year.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр женат, у него уже взрослые дети. Александр живет и работает в Каховке, Херсонская область. Он торгует женской обувью на местном городском рынке вот уже 14 лет. На данный момент у Александра в товаре – 40 000 гривен, а чистая прибыль составляет около 7 000 гривен. 

Александру необходим кредит на сумму 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить ассортимент осенней обуви перед новым торговым сезоном. Ему нравится работать именно с этим товаром, потому что у него высокая оборачиваемость, что помогает бизнесу Александра удержаться на плаву в непростое экономическое время. Клиент надеется и в будущем продолжать развивать свой бизнес и благодаря этому иметь возможность содержать семью. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Alexander is married and his children are already grown. He lives and works in Kahovka, Hersonskaya region. For 14 years he has sold women's shoes on the local city market. Alexander's goods are currently valued at 40,000 grivna, his profits are around 7,000 grivna.
He's asking for a loan in order to stock up on autumn shoes before the new trade season. He enjoys working with his product; it has a high turnover value which helps his business in difficult economic times. Alexander hopes to continue expanding his business and providing for his family.

loans.use: to purchase autumn shoes before the new trade season.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis de 41 años vive en San Juan Nepomuceno, en el departamento de Bolívar; desde su casa en esta población,  ha encontrado una forma de generar ingresos a través de un trabajo independiente como la venta de calzado y mercancías en general. Su negocio inició cuando su prima le enviaba calzado de Bucaramanga, ciudad perteneciente al departamento de Santander, caracterizada por la producción de calzado y bolsos de calidad inigualable, para que ella los vendiera en su pueblo. Inició con pocos clientes a quienes distribuía a crédito y gradualmente fue ganando una muy buena clientela, que le permitió diversificar hacia otras mercancías y fue así como con un capital prestado compró directamente bolsos y ropa, para la venta. En su condición de madre cabeza de hogar ha sacado a su única hija adelante mediante su trabajo y en la actualidad vive con su madre y con sus hermanos. Su meta más adelante es tener un punto comercial donde diversifique aún más su oferta de productos, respondiendo así a las necesidades de la población por acceder a lo que requieren. Su mayor desafío es que su clientela se torna cada vez mayor y su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente para responder oportunamente y debe esperar recoger sus cuentas por cobrar para lograrlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará en mayor volumen y de contado calzado, ropa y bolsos, garantizados y esto es justamente lo que genera mayores encargos por eso su inversión será exitosa porque responderá a clientes especiales que así lo exigen. Mientras Gladis trabaja por alcanzar sus sueños, maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas de 11% desde la cual planea su crecimiento, con inyecciones de capital de trabajo que hoy empieza a lograr con su credikiva.
texts.en:
Gladis is 41 years old and lives in San Juan Nepomuceno in the Department of Bolívar. She works independently from home selling shoes and general merchandise so that she can generate an income. Her business started when her cousin sent her shoes from the city of Bucaramanga, which is in the Department of Santander, so that she could sell them in her town. Bucaramanga is known for producing shoes and handbags of unmatched quality. Gladis started out with a few customers who purchased on credit and gradually she built up a good clientele. This has allowed her to diversify into other types of merchandise. Using borrowed capital, she made direct purchases of handbags and clothing that she could sell. As a mother and female head of household, Gladis has worked hard so that her only daughter can get ahead. She currently lives with her mother and her siblings. Going forward, her goal is to have a retail shop where she can diversify her product offerings even more so that she can meet the demands of the local residents. Her greatest challenge is having sufficient capital to respond to her customers in a timely manner because they are placing larger and more frequent orders. Since she extends credit, she has to wait to collect payment before ordering more merchandise.

For this reason Gladis is requesting a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy clothing and handbags in bulk and with cash since these items have been pre-ordered. Her investment will be successful because she will generate more orders and be able to respond to her special customers. In the meantime, Gladis strives to fulfill her dreams. She maintains a profitability rate from her sales of 11%. With this injection of capital provided by her Kiva loan, she will be able to carry out her plans for growth.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, and handbags that have been pre-ordered.

loans.name: Narly Esther

texts.es:
Narly de 47 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 22 a 27 años en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias; ciudad donde tiene un negocio a través del cual vende mercancías variada en las modalidades de financiación y de contado, en un pequeño local que tiene en su propia casa y que inició con el objetivo de genera ingresos para apoyar los gastos de su hogar, pero que poco a poco se ha convertido en su proyecto de vida y por eso diariamente planea su crecimiento. Sus mayores ventas las realiza a crédito y no tiene pasivos por eso se convierte en un desafío responder a un cliente con la rapidez que ella quisiera. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva porque quiere financiar su cartera, aprovechando que se acerca una de las épocas de repunte en las ventas, como lo es la celebración del amor y de la amistad, que se convierte en un mes de muchos pedidos y sus clientes rentables le han solicitado mercancías variadas como ropa para damas, caballeros, y especialmente papelería y tarjetería.
Su meta más adelante es convertir su punto de venta en un gran almacén donde ofrezca diversidad de productos que roten fácilmente porque definitivamente es el cliente quien manda.
texts.en:
Narly is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two children, ages 22 and 27, in the city of Cartagena de Indias. She has a business selling various types of merchandise through financing arrangements or for cash. Narly established a small shop in her own home so that she could generate income to help with the household expenses. Slowly this business has now become her life’s project, so she plans for it to grow each day. Most of her sales are made through credit. Even though she has no liabilities, Narly finds it challenging to respond to her customers as quickly as they want. For this reason, she is requesting a Kiva loan to finance her portfolio of outstanding orders and to take advantage of this time of year when she usually sees a spike in sales. The month of love and friendship (the Colombian equivalent of Valentine’s Day) is currently being celebrated, so she receives many orders from her profitable customers. They are requesting various types of merchandise such as men’s and women’s clothing, and especially stationery and postcards.

Her goal moving forward is to convert her shop into a large warehouse where she can offer a diversity of products with quick turnover because her customers are definitely demanding this.

loans.use: to buy men’s and women’s clothing, stationery, and postcards.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raul de 72 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 23 y 29 años y es el propietario de un taller de confecciones dedicado exclusivamente a fabricar limpiones industriales, llamados wiper, actividad que inició en el año 2007, gracias al apoyo de una iglesia cristiana, donde inició como empleado y finalmente cuando la iglesia desistió del negocio le vendieron toda la infraestructura, con la que hoy genera ingresos independientes. Sus cuentas por cobrar representan un 74% de sus ventas totales y no posee endeudamiento, pero su capital de trabajo es insuficiente ante su decisión de crecer y tiene un gran potencial, tiene una buena rentabilidad, unas cuentas por cobrar coherentes con los plazos de pago que ofrece.  Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el cual comprará materias primas para cubrir su creciente demanda de empresas, que cada día utilizan más los wiper en sus tareas productivas industriales y con las cuales iniciaría su potencial crecimiento.
texts.en:
Raul is 72 years old and lives with his wife. They have two children, ages 23 and 29. Raul is the owner of a sewing workshop that exclusively manufactures industrial cleaning cloths called “wipers”. He started this business in 2007 thanks to the support of a Christian church. Raul started out as an employee of the church, but then the decision was made to sell this business and the entire infrastructure. Today he works independently and generates his own income. His accounts receivable make up 74% of his total sales and he has no debt. However, his operating capital is insufficient for growth even though he has great potential. Raul has good profitability because some of his accounts receivable are consistent with the payment terms stated in the agreements.

Raul is requesting a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the money to buy raw materials so that he can keep up with the growing demand from businesses that use these “wipers” for various industrial tasks. This loan should initiate his potential growth.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making industrial cleaning cloths.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is 35 years-old .  She is married and has one child, aged ten.  In 2005, she established  her grocery shop business.  Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Kiva partner Patan BPW and used her most recent loan  to increase store inventory.  In the future, Sabita plans to expand the business.  She thanks you for your support.

As a borrower extra training is needed in order to improve living standards. In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 60 years old, married and has one child who is 30 years old. In 1995, she went into business for herself by opening a grocery store where she now works seven days a week, 14 hours a day to support her family. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used it to buy more items to sell to her customers. In the future, Laxmi plans to expand her store and wishes to thank Kiva lenders for helping make this possible.  

As one of our borrowers, Laxmi is getting extra training on how to run a pasal, which is the term used to describe grocery stores in the Kathmandu Valley. These stores are an important part of the Nepalese economy and the place people go every day for fresh produce, milk and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour. People who own these stores are turning to Kiva to increase their purchasing power and profit margins, which they can do through microloans. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.es:
Ivonne es una mujer que sabe mucho D. restauración y D. artesanías y para ella es un deleite trabajar y ofrecer sus servicios como educadora D. las técnicas que conoce, porque es su potencial innato. Si usted llega a la casa D. Ivonne, además D. su amabilidad encuentra un taller D. cerámica donD. produce todo tipo D. adornos al frio, al calor, ofrece servicios D. horneado, trabaja figuras D. yeso, cuadros esculturas D. madera, restaura toda clase D. artículos que la gente aprecia y que cree haber perdido y como si fuera poco está siempre dispuesta a enseñar para que esta tradición creativa D. la que Dios la dotó, continúe en la sociedad. Ella es una mujer apoyada siempre por su familia, feliz y autodidacta que trabaja porque le gusta lo que hace y con ello obtiene inmensa satisfacción personal, para ella su trabajo es inigualable, le ayuda a recobrar la calma cuando está estresada y le permite su genial expresión artística.
Ivonne tiene 5 años D. estar vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que la ha apoyado logrando aumentar sus habilidades administrativa y con ello el incremento D. sus ventas y  D. utilidades. Su sueño más adelante es formalizar la escuela D. artesanos para jóvenes. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva mediante el cual logrará invertir en materias primas, pues se propone elaborar manualidades en cerámica y ponerle su buena energía y todo su potencial creativo con lo cual siempre realiza su trabajo.
texts.en:
Ivonne is a woman who is very knowledgeable about restoration and crafts. She takes delight in her work and offers her services as a teacher, sharing her techniques with others, because it is part of her innate being. When visiting Ivonne’s home, in addition to being welcomed with kindness, one would find a ceramics workshop where she produces all types of decorations maD. by using cold and heat. She also offers the services of her kiln. Ivonne also produces plaster figurines, paintings, and wood sculptures. She restores all types of artifacts that people appreciate, but believe have been lost.

Ivonne is always willing to teach because she believes this creative tradition is a gift from God so that society can continue. She is a woman who has always been supported by her family. Since she is happy and self-taught, Ivonne enjoys her work and receives immense personal satisfaction. For her, there is no other type of work because it helps her to remain calm in times of stress and provides her an outlet for artistic expression.

Five years ago she joined Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization that has helped Ivonne improve her management skills so that she can increase her sales and her profits. Her dream going forward is to establish an art school for young people. At the moment, she is applying for a Kiva loan so that she can invest in raw materials for making ceramic handicrafts. Ivonne always has a good energy level and all the creative potential to pour into her work.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making ceramic handicrafts.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es: Ligia  de 30 años es una mujer que vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 13 años. Su actividad generadora de ingresos es el comercio de ropa femenina, negocio que desempeña con su esposo quien es pensionado del Ejército de Colombia. Ellos se dedican a distribuir a credito estas mercancías, entre sus clientes que son principalmente mujeres en todas las edades, pues vende jeans, blusas, bermudas, y vestidos deportivos. Sus compras las realiza en la ciudad de Bogotá, capital de Colombia, desde donde le envían la mercancía. Cuando inició su negocio tenia ventas muy bajas, pero gradualmente ha ganado un mercado especializado, con capacidad para comprar este tipo de ropa que son de muy buena calidad y valen lo que cuestan. Es por esto que su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responder a la clientela creciente y esta la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará vestidos para damas, a propósito del acercamiento de una época de mucho repunte en sus ventas, como lo es el día del amor y de la amistad, que se convierte en dos meses de solicitudes. Con su crédito ella sería oportuna con sus clientes y conservaría el buen nombre del que goza, por ser una empresaria que responde muy pronto a sus pedidos. Su meta más adelante es lograr la apertura de un almacén de este tipo de ropa, para lograr un mayor posicionamiento y alcanzar clientes vendedores. Mientras esto ocurre, maneja un margen de utilidad no inferior a un 35%, desde al cual planea su crecimiento y desarrollo empresarial y el de sus esposo
texts.en:
Ligia is a 30-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children, ages 9 and 13. She generates income by selling women’s clothing. Ligia started this business with her husband, who is retired from the Colombian army. They decided to sell their merchandise on credit. Her customers consist primarily of women of all ages. She sells jeans, blouses, Bermuda shorts, and sportswear. Ligia purchases her products in the city of Bogotá, the capital of Colombia, and then has the goods shipped. When she started her business, her sales were very low but she gradually acquired a niche market that has the capacity to buy all types of clothing that are of good quality and worth their value. For this reason, her operating capital is insufficient for responding to her growing customer base. This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

Ligia will use the money to buy women’s dresses so that she can take advantage of the time of year when she sees a spike in sales, such as the Day of Love and Friendship (the Colombian version of Valentine’s Day), which results in two months worth of orders. With this loan, Ligia will be able to respond promptly to her customers and preserve the good reputation that she enjoys for being a businesswoman who fulfills her orders quickly. Her goal for the future is to open a clothing shop so that she can be better positioned and be reached by customers and vendors. Meanwhile she manages a profit margin of no less than 35%, from which she plans her growth and the development of her business with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase women's dresses.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es: Elías de 36 años tiene un hijo de 12 años y se dedica a la venta de mobiliario Momposino, esto es muebles artesanales fabricados en Santa Cruz de Mompox, municipio del departamento de Bolívar caracterizado por la calidad con que fabrican muebles aplicando técnicas artesanales. Elia es el propietario de este negocio de tradición familiar que iniciara su abuelo, continuado por su padre y ahora está en sus manos transmitir esta tradición. Sus ventas son de contado y a crédito y siempre esta consciente de oportunidades comerciales de participación en ferias ruedas de negocios para lograr dar a conocer sus productos, aumentar sus clientes y posicionarse en el mercado. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará mercancías para surtir el negocio, como sillas, mecedoras, muebles de sala de cama etc, para responder a nuevos clientes, pues su desafío es su capital de trabajo que con su creciente clientela muchas veces se torna insuficiente para ser oportuno. Su meta es convertirse en el principal productor de muebles momposinos en la ciudad de Barranquilla posicionarse para en un futuro lograr exportar cuando esté preparado.
texts.en:
Elías is 36 years old and has a 12-year-old son. He sells “Momposino” pieces, a type of handcrafted furniture that is produced in Santa Cruz de Mompox, a town that is located in the Department of Bolívar. The quality of the furniture that is produced here is well-known because of the artisanal techniques that are used. Elías is the owner of a family business that was started by his grandfather. His father continued the business and now it has been handed over to him. He conducts both cash and credit sales. Elías is always aware of business opportunities, so he participates in trade fairs in order to create awareness of his products, attract more customers, and position himself in the marketplace.

This Kiva loan is his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Elías will use the money to buy merchandise to restock his business such as chairs, rocking chairs, bedroom sets, and other items so that he can respond to his new customers. His challenge is not having enough operating capital on the several occasions when his customer base is growing so that he can fulfill orders in a timely manner. His goal is to become the main producer of “Momposino” furniture in the city of Barranquilla. This will put him in the position to become an exporter in the future whenever he is ready.

loans.use: to restock his business with chairs, rocking chairs, bedroom sets, and other items so that he can respond to his new customers.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana de 39 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tiene dos hijos en las edades de 4 y 7 años respectivamente; ella es una diseñadora gráfica, que trabajó durante 15 años ejerciendo su profesión en una importante empresa de la ciudad  y el año pasado cuando dejó de trabajar, puso a funcionar su idea emprendedora de vender mercancías mediante guías especializadas de productos. que hoy tiene empeño en hacerla crecer y desarrollar todo su potencial, para genera estabilidad en sus ingresos y mayor bienestar para su hogar. Su principal mercado son sus vecinos, amigos, familiares y ahora cuenta con muchos referidos, que han generado un importante crecimiento de pedidos, que hacen ver su capital de trabajo insuficiente, para resolver oportunamente sus necesidades. Esta es la razón por la cual acuden a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará  accesorios femeninos, cosméticos y ropa. Su estrategia es ofrecer a su clientela descuentos del 5 y el 10% por su pago puntual y así ha logrado fidelizarlos. Su meta más adelante es abrir un local al público, para incrementar sus ventas y lograr una atención confortable y estable, para que sus clientes continúen prefiriéndola. En su negocio maneja un margen de utilidad no menor del 35% y una rotación de inventarios de 4 días, indicadores financieros desde los cuales planea su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Liliana is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children, ages 4 and 7 respectively. She is a graphic designer and worked for 15 years in this profession for a major company in the city. When she left this job last year, Liliana came up with the idea of selling merchandise through specialty catalogs. Today she is committed to growing and developing to her full potential so that she can generate a stable income in order to provide for the welfare of her household. Her main market consists of her neighbors, friends, relatives, and now the many referrals that she has accumulated. Even though Liliana has experienced significant growth in her orders, she has not built up sufficient capital necessary to respond to opportunities. For this reason she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

Liliana will use the money to buy women’s accessories, cosmetics, and clothing. Her strategy is to offer her customers discounts of 5 and 10% for paying on time and for being loyal. Going forward, her goal is to have a shop that is open to the public so that she can increase her sales and provide comfortable and stable service that will encourage her customers to continue doing business with her. Liliana maintains a profit margin of no less than 35% and a product turnover period of four days. These financial indicators signal her plans for growth.

loans.use: to buy women’s accessories, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Mady

texts.es: Mady de 30 años vive con sus dos hijos en las edades de 5 y 6 años respectivamente, los cuales son su motor para esforzarse trabajando todos los días de su vida, en su peluquería donde ofrece servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen personal y profesional a damas caballeros y niños, allí maneja las líneas de corte de cabello, tratamientos capilares, pedicure, manicures y hasta asesorías de aplicacion de productos. Mady vivió muchos años en Venezuela, país fronterizo, y desde hace 5 años regresó a Colombia y emprendió su aventura de negocio que hoy está empreñada en hacerlo crecer y es también su proyecto de vida. Su acogida en el mercado ha sido muy buena y a este negocio ha agregado dos vitrinas exhibidoras donde también vende los productos que usualmente usa y recomienda. Su creciente clientela hace que su capital de trabajo sea insuficiente para atender la demanda, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva para comprar insumos de peluquería shampoo, masajes, tintes, y demás productos capilares en volumen los cuales aplicará y también venderá a clientes que se los han encargado, siendo este el éxito de su inversión. Su meta más adelante es contratar una nueva empleada y hacer algunas reformas locativas, con el fin de lograr un lugar confortable para sus clientes y aumentar el número de ellos. Mientras esto ocurre, maneja un margen de utilidad no inferior al 70% y una rotación de inventarios de materias primas de 15 días, indicadores  desde los cuales potencializa su crecimiento
texts.en:
Mady is 30 years old and lives with her two children, ages 5 and 6 respectively.  They are the motivation behind all of her daily efforts in life.  Mady has a beauty salon where she offers personal and professional image makeover services for women, men, and children.  She provides haircuts, hair treatments, pedicures, manicures, and even product application advice.  For many years, Mady lived in the neighboring country of Venezuela but returned five years ago to Colombia to start her business venture.  Today her business has grown and has now become her life’s project.  Her reception in the marketplace has been very good.  Mady acquired two display cases for her business where she stores the products that she uses and recommends.  Even though her customer base is growing, she has insufficient operating capital to keep up with demand.  

For this reason she has requested a Kiva loan to buy beauty supplies such as shampoos, massagers, dyes, and other hair care products in bulk to use in her salon and to sell to customers who have ordered them.  Mady hopes that this will be a successful investment.  Her goal moving forward is to hire a new employee and make a few structural changes so that her salon will be a comfortable place for her customers and attract more business.  In the meantime, she manages a profit margin of no less than 70% and an inventory turnover period of 15 days.  These indicators signal her potential for growth.

loans.use: to purchase shampoos, massagers, dyes, and other hair care products in bulk.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel de 24 años, se dedica a la comercialización de repuestos para motos, negocio que inició desde hace 7 años pero desde hace 2 años está ubicado en el barrio la Arboleda del municipio de Soledad, departamento del Atlántico. Su negocio es atendido por él y un mecánico, que además presta el servicio de mantenimiento de motocicletas. Los principales productos que vende son guayas, empaquetadura, valineras, bujías, bandas para frenos, etc,. El taller de repuestos de motos es  reconocido por su atención personalizada y por eso cuenta con una acreditada clientela, que diariamente crece y aumenta sus exigencias en cuanto a inversión se refiere; en la actualidad cuenta con un volumen de ventas, pues se ajusta a las necesidades de su clientes, en cuanto a precios, repuestos y servicios requeridos; así mismo goza de una liquidez que potencializa inyecciones de capital de trabajo, para impactar su crecimiento. Abel a sus clientes otorga créditos y también vende de contado, sus cuentas por cobrar rotan rápidamente, lo mismo que sus inventarios en los que presenta un buen manejo, lo mismo que su indicador de rentabilidad presenta un buen índice. El nivel de competencia de su mercado es muy alto y este es justamente su gran desafío, pues en la zona existen varios talleres y Abel por eso debe tener un buen stock de mercancías, para responderle a los clientes oportunamente, este es justamente su gran desafío, porque el capital de trabajo, ante la exigencia del mercado, se torna insuficiente y por ello acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará repuestos para motos, logrando así la meta de tener su almacén surtido. Su sueño más adelante es tener un local propio, pero mientras esto ocurre Abel se esmera trabajando para poderlo alcanzar y con ello maneja un margen de utilidad no menor del 14%, desde el cual planea su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Abel, 24, sells motorcycle parts.  He started the business seven years ago, but for two years he has been located in the Arboleda neighborhood in the town of Soledad in the department of Atlántico.  He and a mechanic attend to the business, which also provides motorcycle maintenance service.  The main products he sells are cables, gaskets, bearings, spark plugs, brake bands, etc.

The motorcycle parts shop is recognized for its personalized attention and, because of this, it has a reputable clientele that grows daily and increases its demands with regard to investment.  At present, Abel has high sales because he adapts to the needs of his customers regarding price and required parts and services.  Also, he enjoys a liquidity that promotes investments of working capital to impact his growth.  Abel grants credit to his customers and also sells in cash.  His accounts receivable turn over quickly, as does his inventory (which he manages well), and his profitability index is good.  

The level of competition in his market is very high, and this is precisely his big challenge.  There are several shops in the area and so Abel has to have a good stock of merchandise to respond to his customers opportunely.  This is precisely his big challenge, because his working capital is insufficient with regard to the demands of the market.  Because of this he needs a Kiva loan, his first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy motorcycle parts to achieve his goal of stocking his store.

Abel's dream for the future is to have his own place.  In the meantime, he takes great pains working to be able to achieve this, and he manages a profit margin of no less than 14%, from which he is planning his growth.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials and ingredients in larger volume, to improve conditions in her kitchen and bathroom, and to purchase plastic chairs and tables

loans.name: Ana Jessenia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal PriM. de Agosto se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  10 y 8 años  de edad, ambos  estudian en escuela. Su esposo es chofer profesional.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar en los gastos que generan el hogar y la educación de sus hijos se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja de tres a cuatro días a la semana sobre todo por las mañanas cuando sus hijos están en la escuela, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada 8 días. Lleva 8  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien nos cuenta que  lo que más vende son los perfumes.
	
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y accesorios para damas. Lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal, es la fiscal de reglamentos y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para salir adelante.
 
Sus sueños son seguir creciendo en su negocio y en su vida personal.
texts.en:
The PriM. de Agosto village bank meets every 15 days in the village of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and its crafts, which are famous around Ecuador and abroad. 
Here we met Ana, a 26-year-old woman. She and her husband have two children, 10 and 8 years of age, who are both in school. Her husband works as a driver.
Ana is a housewife who sells Avon beauty products in order to have her own resources and be able to help with the family's household and educational expenses. She sells door to door three or four days a week, especially in the mornings when her children are in school. She sells her products on credit and collects payments every eight days. She's been selling these products for eight years and it's going very well. She tells us that her bestselling products are the perfumes.
Ana will use this credit to buy women's perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and accessories. She's been a member of the village bank for two years, where she is the treasurer. She likes the group because it's helped her get ahead in life.
Her dream is to keep expanding her business and growing as a person.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and accessories for women.

loans.name: Alexandra Esther

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 1 De Agosto se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Alexandra. Tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 11, 7 y 3 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad. Hace tiempo atrás  estudio belleza en una Academia en Montecristi y obtuvo el título de artesana en belleza.

Nuestra amiga tiene un salón de belleza en su casa en el cual  realiza diversos trabajos como  tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre otras cosas que realiza para satisfacción de sus cliente. También vende productos de Esika, Lebel, Yanbal y Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas)  el cual lo hace al mismo  tiempo cuando realiza sus otros trabajos. Trabaja desde las 8h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios. Lleva más de 8 años con su negocio y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, tratamientos, esmaltes  y productos de Avon y Yanbal. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un gran salón de belleza en Manta.
texts.en:
The Primero de Agosto village bank meets every 15 days in the village of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and its crafts, which are famous around Ecuador and abroad. It is the place where the famous straw Panama hats are made.
Alexandra lives here. She is 34 years old, and she and her husband have three children, 11, 7, and 3 years of age. The two older children attend school. Her husband is a security guard. A while back, she studied cosmetology in a school in Montecristi and earned her license.
Our friend has a beauty salon in her house where she performs a number of treatments, including dyes, cuts, and manicures, among others, to her clients' delight. She sells beauty products by Esika, Lebel, Yanbal, and Avon in addition to carrying out her other tasks. She works from 8 a.m. till 9 p.m. or even later if her clients need her services. She's had her business more than 8 years and it's going quite well.
Alexandra will use this loan to buy dyes, hair treatments, nail polish, and Avon and Yanbal products. She is a founding member of the village bank and she likes it because it makes it easier to obtain loans.
Her dream is to have a large beauty salon in Manta.

loans.use: to buy hair dye, hair treatments, nail polish, and Avon and Yanbal products.

loans.name: Dolores Leonor

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Primero de Agosto se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Dolores, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 15 y 8 años de edad, los dos estudian en colegio. Su esposo es chofer.

Nuestra amiga tiene una tienda general en su casa en la cual además de vender todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad también vende artículos de bazar, útiles escolares y ciertas medicinas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan cuando pueden, nos cuenta que está muy contenta con su negocio ya que este le permite ganarse la vida sin tener que descuidar el hogar ni a sus hijos, son 7 años que lleva en su negocio y le ha ido muy bien y tiene buena clientela por su barrio.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, etc. y artículos de bazar y papelería como: regalos, tarjetas, peluches y útiles escolares. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque con los créditos ha ido mejorando su negocio.
 
Sus metas son que su tienda crezca y sea la mejor de su barrio y de su ciudad.
texts.en:
The Primero de Agosto village bank meets every 15 days in the village of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and its crafts, which are famous around Ecuador and abroad. It is the place where the famous straw Panama hats are made.
Here we met Dolores, a 33-year-old woman. She and her husband have two children, 15 and 8 years of age, who are both in high school. Her husband is a driver.
Our friend has a general store in her house, where she sells not only stapes but also trinkets, school supplies, and some medicines. She works every day from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. or even later. Her children and her husband help her whenever they can. She tells us that she's very happy with her business since it allows her to make a living without forcing her to neglect her home or her children. She's had the business for 7 years and it's gone very well. She has a good customer base in her neighborhood.
She will use this loans to stock her store, buying staple goods like rice, sugar, oil, detergents, etc., and trinkets and paper goods like gifts, cards, stuffed animals, and school supplies. She's been a member of the village bank from the beginning and she likes it because the loans have allowed her to improve her business.
Her goals are to see her store grow and become the best store in the neighborhood and even in the city.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergents, gifts, cards, stuffed animals, school supplies, etc.

loans.name: Paula Eleodora

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Primero de Agosto se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Paula. Tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres  hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes, solo uno de ellos aún viven en su casa. Su esposo trabaja en el Municipio de Montecristi.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que se dedica a preparar y vender bocadillos y comida rápida como: empanadas, hornado (plato típico), corviches, jugos de frutas, sodas entre otras cosas. Además a veces también prepara almuerzos y meriendas pero solo para entregar. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 15h00. Nos cuenta que los días que más vende son los sábados y domingos. Lleva más de 7 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va bien.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar aceite, plátano, maní y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
The Primero de Agosto village bank meets every 15 days in the village of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and its crafts, which are famous around Ecuador and abroad. It is the place where the famous straw Panama hats are made.

Paula lives here. She is 62 years old, and she and her husband have three adult children. Only one of the children still lives with them. Her husband works for the town government of Montecristi.

She is a very good housewife who also prepares and sells sandwiches and fast food, including empanadas, hornado (a regional roasted pork dish), corviche (whitefish wrapped in dough and fried), fruit juices, sodas, and so on. She also prepares lunches and snacks and delivers them to customers. She works every day from 8 a.m. till 3 p.m. She tells us she sells the most on Saturdays and Sundays. She's been selling food for more than 7 years and it's going well.

She will use this loan to purchase oil, bananas, peanuts, and other ingredients for her meals. She's been a member of the village bank from the beginning and she likes it because of the help the loans have given her.

Her dream is to own a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, oil, peanuts, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan de 42 años de edad, está casado con delia  de 47 años con quien tiene 2 hijos. Viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Pichari.Juan  desde muy adolescente incursionó en el negocio de venta de videos, porque sus padres son siempre fueron comerciantes y le enseñaron a ganarse la vida honradamente.
Al principio Juan tenía un poco de temor porque no le iba tan bien en el negocio, pero supo como ponerle fin a esto, gracias a una buena técnica de atención al cliente. Actualmente, Juan cuenta con una buena cartera de clientes.Para realizar su trabajo cuenta con el apoyo de su querida esposa. Juan posee un buen lugar entre sus competidores por ser su negocio uno de los más concurridos por los clientes, todo esto fue un premio a su iniciativa, perseverancia y creatividad.Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el que Juan se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.Juan esta contento con su banco comunal por que todos son perseverantes y solidarios.Con los 1.000 Juan comprara más videos para las venta en su tienda.
texts.en:
Juan is 42 years old.  He is married to Delia, aged 47, with whom he has two children.  They live in their own home, located in the district of Pichari.  

Juan has had a business selling videos since he was a teenager, because his parents have always been business people, and they taught him to earn an honest living.

At first, Juan was somewhat concerned because the business wasn't going too well, but he knew how to put an end to that thanks to a good customer service approach.  Today, Juan has a good customer base.  He relies on the help of his beloved wife to make the business work.

Juan has a good position among his competitors, as his business is one of the most popular with the customers.  All of this came about due to his initiative, perseverance and creativity.

This is his first loan with MFP, and Juan promises to be punctual in his repayments.  Juan is pleased with the Communal Bank, as everyone is hard-working and supportive.  With the 1,000 PEN, Juan will buy more videos to sell in his store.

loans.use: to buy more videos to sell in his store.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis de 48 años de edad, viudo quien tiene 3 hijos. Viven en su casa alquilada, ubicada en el distrito de Pichari.Luis es el padre más sacrificado en su barrio, quien día a día  se esmera en el campo para poder darles una buena educación a sus queridos hijos. El se dedica a la producción de piña en la localidad de Tarancato donde tiene una parcela apropiada para esta fruta que es tan cotizado en la actualidad.Luis está contento con este oficio que tiene, pues le genera buenas ganancias. En el futuro el desea comprarse una  camioneta para poder trasladar su producto  hacia otras provincias y poder expenderlas a un mejor precio.En el trabajo siempre cuenta con el apoyo de sus personales quienes lo facilitan en la limpieza del terreno y la extracción de sus frutos.Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que el una vez mas ratifica su compromiso de pagar muy puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.Luis esta feliz con los integrantes de su banco comunal por que son respetuosos. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles Luis invertirá en la limpieza de las malezas de su parcela de piña.
texts.en: Luis is 48 years old. He is a widower who has 3 children. They live in a rented house located in the district of Pichari. Luis is the most sacrificing father in his neighborhood; every day he does his very best in the fields to be able to give his beloved children a good education. He produces pineapples in Tarancato, where he has a plot of land that is suitable for this fruit, which is so sought after now. Luis is happy with this work, since it generates good earnings for him. In the future, he wants to buy a truck so that he can transport his products to other provinces and sell them at a better price. In his work, he always relies on the support of the people who facilitate the cleaning of the land and the harvesting of his fruits. This is his second loan with MFP, and he has once more made his promise to make his payments very punctually. Luis is happy with the members of his communal bank because they are respectful. With the 2500 PEN, Luis will invest in cleaning the weeds from his plot of pineapple.

loans.use: to invest in cleaning the weeds from his plot of pineapple.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy meat and eggs to supplement his business.

loans.name: Stephany

texts.es: Stefhany de 19 años tiene un negocio de producción de bloques, persianas y calados en cemento, actividad que por tradición  ha pasado de su abuelo a su padre y ahora a ella, quien está empeñada en hacerla crecer, pues ha sido importante para el sostenimiento de toda su familia. Sus principales clientes son las ferreterías del sector y las construcciones que se encuentran alrededor de su barrio a quienes les vende a crédito a corto plazo  y también de contado. Su meta es la de llegar a ser la Numero 1 del sector, pero su capital de trabajo es su mayor desafío, y también  la razón para acceder a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos para hacer mejoras a la cubierta de la fábrica, la cual se encuentra en mal estado y necesita proteger su producción de la lluvia y en general de la humedad, e iniciar su camino hacia el desarrollo empresarial de su negocio.
texts.en: Stephany is 19 years old and has a business that makes cement blocks and also cement blinds and screens, which by tradition has passed from her grandfather, to her father, and now to her. She is determined to make it grow because it has been important for providing for the whole family. Her main clients are the hardware stores in the area and the construction sites around her neighborhood, who she sells to on short-term credit and also for cash. Her goal is to become number one in the sector, but working capital is her biggest challenge. It is also her reason for applying for a loan in cooperation with Kiva, which is her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy raw materials and inputs for making improvements to the roof of the workshop, which is in bad condition. She needs to protect her production from the rain and the humidity in general and start down the road toward development of her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and inputs for making improvements to the roof of her workshop

loans.name: Waldo

texts.es: Waldo  es un hombre de 42 años casado y padre de un niño de 7 años, con quienes vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia muy cerca al mar. Allí tiene en su propia casa  un estadero en el cual vende cervezas, jugos y refrescos en general. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos, que se acercan a la terraza de Waldo para conversar, jugar dominó mientras degustan las frías cervezas o refrescos en un clima cálido que así lo amerita. Como su clientela ha aumentado tiene un gran desafío,  que es el de tener suficientemente surtido su enfriador para complacerlos y su creciente clientela hace que su capital de trabajo sea insuficiente para lograrlo; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará cervezas y gaseosas al por mayor, e irse convirtiendo poco a poco en un distribuidor de negocios a su alrededor de la playa, para que cuando estos se queden sin refrescos por efectos del consumo masivo que hay en este puerto los fines de semana, él pueda ayudarle a superar sus necesidades. Su meta más adelante es remodelar la terraza de su casa, para hacer más agradable su negocio y seguir disfrutando de la buena conversación con sus clientes mientras genera los ingresos suficientes para su hogar. Mientras esto ocurre se esfuerza en su negocio, manejando un margen de utilidad no inferior del 40% y una rotación de inventario de 6 días, desde la cual partimos para augurarle un potencial crecimiento empresarial.
texts.en:
Waldo is a 42-year-old married man and the father of a 7-year-old son living together in the town of Puerto Colombia very near the ocean.  He has a snack bar at his house where he sells beer, juice and beverages in general.  His main customers are his neighbors, relatives and friends who come by Waldo’s terrace to chat and play dominoes while they enjoy cold beers or beverages in the hot climate that encourages this.  

Since his clientele has increased, Waldo has quite a challenge which is to have enough cold merchandise available to please them and his growing clientele leads to his working capital being insufficient to do so.  This is why he’s calling on a Kiva loan to buy beer and soft-drinks at wholesale so that he can gradually become a distributor to businesses at the beach near him so that when they run out of beverages due to the heavy consumption that takes place in this port on weekends, he will be able to help them meet their needs.

His goal for later on is to remodel the terrace to make his business more pleasant and continue to enjoy pleasant conversations with his customers while generating enough income for his home.  While this occurs he works hard at his business maintaining a profit margin of no less than 40% and an inventory turnover rate of six days which we use as the basis to predict potential business growth for him.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks at wholesale.

loans.name: Humbert

texts.es:
Humberto está planeando recibir su segundo credikiva para continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, porque con el primero logró invertirlo en la compra de mercancías y en la reparación de 2 lavadoras y la compra de dos nuevas máquinas, con todo esto logró incrementar sus ingresos y respondió con ello a su clientela. En la actualidad comprará dos lavadoras más, reparará la vitrina para la exhibición de mercancía y el mantenimiento de dos máquinas que se encuentran dañadas. Su mensaje a los financiadores es el siguiente: “Estoy muy agradecido por el crédito que me han dado, ya que he podido seguir trabajando y todo me ha salido muy bien.”


Si usted quiere leer la historia de Humberto, ingrese al siguiente enlace:http://kiva.org/lend/214206
texts.en:
Humberto is planning on receiving his second Kiva loan to continue increasing working capital because he used the first one to buy merchandise and to repair two washing machines and to buy two new machines.  With all this he succeeded in increasing income and was able to respond to his clientele.  

Currently, he will buy two more washing machines, will repair the merchandise display case and will repair two machines that are broken.  His message for lenders is: “I am very grateful for the loan I’ve been given because I’ve been able to continue working and everything has turned out very well.” 

If you’d like to read Humberto’s story, please click on the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/214206

loans.use: to buy two washing machines, to repair the display case and to repair two broken machines.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 50 years old, married and has two children who are 19 and 20 years old. She earns a living as a farmer, helping her husband grow rice on their land. She also raises pigs in their backyard and sells them in her town's market. Josephine works hard to support her family, and is determined to pay for her children’s education. She is applying for this loan to buy buy seeds, fertilizer and pig feed. Her goal for the future is to set aside more money as savings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pig feed.

loans.name: Lyroche

texts.en:
Lyroche is 45 years old and married. She has a 25-year-old child. Lyroche’s husband works as a carpenter.

Lyroche owns a business raising hogs. She has a small backyard piggery where she raises her pigs. She plans to use her loan to buy more piglets, feed, and vitamins.

In the future, Lyroche hopes to have a stable business. She also wants to be able to help her relatives financially.

loans.use: to buy more piglets, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Rezyl

texts.en:
Rezyl is 25 years old and married. She has three children, ages 6, 4 and 2.

Rezyl is a farmer. She and her husband own a rice farm located in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Rezyl helps grow rice and sell their harvest. She does her best to support her family.

Rezyl has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a married woman who lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with her family. She is 42 years old and has a 10-year-old child.

Arlene has been engaged in farming for 11 years. She grows rice crops to sell. Arlene works hard to support her family. She applied for a loan to fund her farm and continue generating income from it. She plans to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

In the future, Arlene hopes to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ernie

texts.en:
Ernie is 39 years old and single. He is a farmer working in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Ernie spends his time tilling his land and growing rice crops. He works hard to keep his farm productive.

Ernie has requested a loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes that through his business he will be able to improve his family’s living situation.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Gellie

texts.en:
Gellie is a 55-year-old married woman residing in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has been engaged in farming for 30 years. She grows and sells rice crops to her community. Gellie is able to sustain her family through her business.

Gellie is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes to have a better living situation.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Munkhtuya

texts.en:
Munkhtuya is 30 years old, married to Erdene-Ochir. Their marriage has been blessed with two children.  One of their daughters, Anujin, is 10 years old and attends secondary school, the other 3-year-old Tanan is attending kindergarten. 
She obtained her Bachelors degree in Bank Accounting in 2006. Today, she works as an accountant at a local company while her spouse is employed by a local drilling company.  
Her family lives in a small apartment in Ulaanbaatar and she has decided to renovate its interior structure.  She is requesting a 3.500.000 MNT /Mongolian Tugriks/ loan to buy all the necessary renovation materials for the apartment.   
Munkhtuya is a hard working woman who believes that the renovation of her apartment will improve her children’s living condition significantly.

loans.use: to purchase some construction materials for renovation work

loans.name: Uth

texts.en:
Uth is a resident of the Baray District in Kompong Thom Province. Agriculture is the main business activity that occurs in this area. Most of the residents of this region are both rice growers and livestock breeders. Now, Uth is a farmer. She is married to Yim and has two kids who are living under her profits. From the farming business, she earns about $2 per day. 

Since this is the season for farming, Uth has decided to purchase a plowing machine but she lacks enough money, so she wishes for help through HKL, a Kiva partner. She hopes that she will earn more profit through this funding. In the future, she will send her children to study at high levels, and widen her house.

loans.use: to purchase a plowing machine.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Sophea, 46, (pictured on the right), resides with her husband and three children in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. Sophea is a housewife while her husband produces wooden furniture to sell, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 67 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. Sophea is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more wood and furniture supplements to expand her husband’s business. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase more wood and furniture supplements for her husband's business

loans.name: Tumenbayar

texts.en:
Borrower Tumenbayar is a 43-year-old widow who has two daughters and lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She has double higher education in accounting and the nutrition technology field.
 
Regardless of her profession, she had six years of experience in her own grocery and home furnishings store until she went to South Korea for a higher paying job for five years. After she came back from S. Korea in 2010, she continued her small grocery store business. 

Tumenbayar is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to buy more merchandise for the grocery store. Her goal is to improve her business with this loan and live with her two daughters happily.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam is 30 and the mother of four kid and currently they live in the Siem Reap Province. All of her children still live under her care and her income. Mrs. Sam is a local farmer who has been planting a variety of crops for over ten years. She also relies on income from her husband’s work, a fisherman as well as a foreman construction worker. This couple makes an income in average of $7USD each day to cover their family’ needs.
Presently, her husband meets a problem with fishing activity as his boat is broken now. It may affect with his fishing process as well as his daily revenue.  So, Mrs. Sam requested a loan of $400 to buy a new boat for her husband going his fishing business. With the rest, it will use to purchase some nets.

loans.use: to to buy a new boat and some nets.

loans.name: Khandsuren

texts.en:
Khandsuren is a 29-year-old lady who has one daughter and lives with her younger sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She operates a clothing business in the largest outdoor market in Mongolia.
