She started her business with one small stall at the market in 2002, from which she sells men’s business suits and women's coats. She imports her products from Ereen, a border city between China and Mongolia. Today, she has two stalls at the market and her working capital is currently three million MNT (Mongolian Tugriks). 

Borrower Khandsuren is requesting a 1,000,000 Tugriks loan to purchase more clothes for the upcoming season in order to increase her working capital. She is planning to improve her living standards with this loan and live with her daughter prosperously.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Tsedenjargal

texts.en:
Tsedenjargal is a 46-year-old married business man who has a daughter and a son, and lives in the capital city of Ulaanbaatar in Mongolia. His family lives in a ger (a Mongolian felt yurt) on his sister’s land.  Both of his children attend local universities and his spouse helps him operate the small family business.  

He has been operating a clothing business since 1995, in Mongolia's largest outdoor market. Currently, he rents one small stall where he sells men’s suits, women’s coats and jackets. His working capital is approximately three million MNT (Mongolian Tugriks).  
  
Tsedenjargal is requesting a 1,000,000 Tugriks loan to purchase more clothes to sell for the autumn season and to increase sales. With his business profits, he was able to buy a new car; now his aim is to have his family's own plot of land and build a new house.  This will allow his family to enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell for the autumn season.

loans.name: Otgontsetseg

texts.en:
Otgontsetseg is a 43-year-old woman who lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. She operates a small clothing sales business, and her spouse works as a manager at a local company. Her daughter and son attend high school and kindergarten. During the summer months, grandparents babysit her children, allowing her to work at her small business. 

She graduated as a pharmacist from a local university. However, she started to operate her clothing business in 2008 to support her family.  She rents a small stall at the largest indoor market in the city.  Her long term goal is to have her own clothing store.

Otgontsetseg is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase more clothes for this fall and increase her product range and selection.  She is a Transcapital repeat client and is thankful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for this fall and increase her product range and selection.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca de 61 años de edad, es viuda, tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 30 a 33 años y  vive al sur de la ciudad,  donde se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir y también tiene un negocio de comidas rápidas. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la confección de conjuntos infantiles  y multiusos que fabrica con telas, hilos, en dos máquinas sencillas y con herramientas manuales. El arte de la costura lo aprendió por sí sola, pero logró perfeccionarlo con capacitaciones que le posibilitaron el montaje de su negocio, actividad de la cual sus hijos, personas trabajadoras y de bien, se sienten muy orgullosos de ella. Blanca también desarrolla otra actividad complementaria y es la venta de comidas rápidas, negocio que funciona en las horas de la mañana  y en el que emplea solo dos horas diarias. Sus negocios la ayudaron a elaborar su duelo una vez falleció su esposo, situación que ha sido el desafío más grande en su vida.  Su credikiva es el tercer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará materiales para la confección de ropa encargada y harina, queso, embutidos para la preparación de picadas que también vende a crédito y de contado. Con sus créditos anteriores ha logrado mejorar su infraestructura y tener un capital de trabajo disponible para realizar sus compras de contado, con las cuales ha obtenido descuentos e incrementado sus utilidades. Su meta es terminar de arreglar su casa y continuar apoyando siempre a sus hijos y nietos que son su mayor felicidad. El negocio de Blanca maneja un margen de contribución del 35%, una liquidez de 3 a 1, una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 18 días y una capacidad de pago del 100%, indicadores financieros desde los cuales auguramos un mayor crecimiento.
texts.en:
Blanca, 61, is a widow and has three children whose ages range from 30 to 33 years.  She lives in the south part of the city where she makes clothes and also has a fast food business.  She’s been making children’s outfits and multiple-use garments for the last 10 years with fabric and thread on two simple machines and with hand tools.  She learned the art of sewing on her own but managed to perfect it through courses that allowed her to set up her own business, work that her children who are upstanding, working people, feel very proud of her for.  Blanca also carries out another activity which is the sale of fast food, a business that operates in the morning and that only takes up two hours a day.  Her businesses helped her get through the mourning period when her husband died which was the greatest challenge she’s had to face in life.

Her Kiva loan is the third loan she’s had with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy materials to make the clothing she has on order and to buy flour, cheese and cured meats to prepare the snacks which she sells both for cash and on credit.

Previous loans have made it possible for her to improve her infrastructure and to have working capital available to pay cash for her purchases which led to discounts that increased her profits.  Her goal is to finish fixing up her house and to continue to support her children and grandchildren who are her greatest source of happiness.  

Blanca’s business operates with a gross income of 35%, a 3 to 1 liquidity ratio; an 18 day accounts receivable rotation and a 100% capacity to pay – all financial indicators that we can use to predict greater growth.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothes and flour, cheese and cured meats to make snacks.

loans.name: Liliana Isabel

texts.es: Liliana de 44 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 12 a 20 años respectivamente. Allí se dedica a la venta de productos medicinales y naturales de diversos laboratorios. Su negocio empezó por su inquietud en la actividad de ventas, pero como tuvo tan buena acogida se entusiasmó y ahora sueña con aumentar su crecimiento y más adelante tener un local con la normatividad de la ley, para que sus hijos tengan una empresa de donde generar ingresos para terminar sus carreras universitarias. Su mayor desafío es la falta de capital de trabajo, para lograr el incremento en las ventas a la que ella aspira, pues con la creciente clientela se queda corta para comprar lo que sus clientes requieren. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará medicina natural al por mayor para que le hagan buenos descuentos y ofrecer precios mucho más competitivos, que le ayuden a su sostenibilidad en el mercado.
texts.en:
Liliana, 44, lives in the city of Barranquilla with her spouse and three children whose ages range from 12 to 20.  She sells natural and medicinal products from various laboratories.  Her business began because of her interest in sales and when she saw that she received a warm welcome she became excited and now dreams with increasing her growth and later on to have a store with all the legal requirements so that her children will have a firm where they can generate income to finish their university careers.  

Her greatest challenge is the lack of working capital to increase sales like she’d like to because she falls short of having sufficient funds to buy enough to meet demands of her growing clientele.  Her Kiva loan will be her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she’ll use it to buy natural medicine at wholesale so that she can qualify for good discounts and be able to offer much more competitive prices that will help her sustainability in the marketplace.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines at wholesale.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto  de 74 años vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia muy cerca al mar vive con su cónyuge y tiene 6 hijos en las edades de 30 a 42 años de edad. Allí en esta población tiene una tienda donde vende ranchos, víveres y artículos de la canasta familiar, principalmente a mujeres que compran en  pequeñas cantidades diarias y en la modalidad a crédito y también de contado. Roberto siempre está atento a las promociones de los productos de grandes superficies  comerciales, para comprarlos y ofrecerle a sus clientes artículos, a precios competitivos. El en compañía de su esposa también comercializan, mediante guías especializadas de productos, mercancías variadas, como perfumes, cosméticos y también fabrican bollos de maíz con queso, que venden en los negocios de Puerto Colombia y es él mismo quien sale en su bicicleta y los reparte entre sus clientes, mientras su esposa atiende su punto comercial, cuando él, en esto se ocupa. Su meta es ampliar el surtido para lograr incremento en las ventas y así mismo mayores utilidades. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará mercancía variada en mayor volumen, como rancho, víveres, abarrotes, refrescos y cosméticos. Con su inversión responderá a la gran demanda de sus clientes, que esperan un surtido bueno, bonito y barato. En su negocio actualmente maneja un margen de rentabilidad no inferior al 20% y una rotación de inventarios no mayor a 20 días y desde allí potencializa su crecimiento empresarial.
texts.en:
Roberto, 74, lives in the town of Puerto Colombia very near the ocean with his spouse.  He has six children whose ages range from 30 to 42 years.  He has a store in that town selling snacks, foodstuffs and other basic family need items primarily to women who buy small daily amounts on credit and for cash.  

Roberto is always watching out for promotional sales at large commercial firms to buy and offer his customers a variety of items at competitive prices.  He and his wife also sell, via specialized catalogues, assorted merchandise like perfume and cosmetics.  They also manufacture bread rolls stuffed with corn and cheese that they sell to various businesses in Puerto Colombia and it’s he, himself, who goes out on his bicycle to deliver them among his customers while his wife watches the store when he’s occupied doing this.  His goal is to increase stock variety to attain increased sales and higher profits.

His Kiva loan is his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he’ll use it to buy larger volumes of snacks, foodstuffs, groceries, soft-drinks and cosmetics.  With this investment he will be able to respond to the great demand from customers who expect a good assortment of good, pretty and inexpensive wares.  His business currently operates with a profit margin of no less than 20% and an inventory turnover rate of no more than 20 days and from this data his potential business growth is based.

loans.use: to buy assorted merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en: Chanthorn, 31, resides with her husband and children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia – an area known for rubber plantations. Chanthorn sells food from home, earning $10 US per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and a chef, earning $3 US per day. Each month, the family has to spend $61 US on food and $40 US on other expenses. Chanthorn is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase yams from local farmers as stock to resell. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase yams from local farmers for resale.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.en:
Being a father, Leoncio Jr. is responsible to provide for all his family's needs and prepare for the future of his children. Likewise, Leoncio Jr. is responsible for feeding his family and sending his children to school. He is now 51 years old and has three children. One of them is still in college while the rest are already married. They own and manage a small eatery inside the public market cooking and selling food for meals and snacks. Together with his wife, they continuously manage the business for almost 10 years now earning profits of 8,000 PHP a month which they utilize for their food and allowances for their children.

They plan to improve the business to satisfy their customers' needs and to also increase their income, but due to inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients, pork, fish, vegetables and spices to cook and sell in the market. He hopes that the loan will help to improve the business, as they work hard for improvement.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients (pork, fish, vegetables and spices) to cook and sell in the market.

location.town: Sto.Domingo St. DMP, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Saveoun

texts.en: Saveoun, 39, resides with her husband and children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Saveoun and her husband buy rubber to resell, earning an income of 5 USD each day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 207 USD on food and 34 USD on other necessary expenses. Saveoun is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase rubber from the local farmers to resell. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase rubber from local farmers to resell

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Ven, 58, resides with his wife and children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Ven grows yams, earning an income of 5.56 USD per day. The family is also assisted by his three children who are all employed at the rubber plantation. Each month, the family has to spend 70 USD on food and 40 USD on other necessary expenses. Ven is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to hire workers to cut grasses at his yam plantation. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To hire workers to cut grasses at his yam plantation

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap, 34, resides with her husband and children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Sopheap sells groceries, earning an income of 5 USD per day. Sopheap also grows yams on her own plot of land to generate more income for her family. Each month, the family has to spend 80 USD on food and 40 USD on other necessary expenses. Sopheap is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase a motorbike to commute to her yam plantation. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to commute to her yam plantation

loans.name: Romel

texts.en:
Romel is 35, married and has five school-age children. He aimed to uplift their status of living to continue sending their children to school. Despite the hardships of life, he and his wife are continuously striving to feed their family. Rice farming and hog-raising are the main sources of their income. They have been in this business for almost 13 years, earning profits of 15,000 Philippines pesos (P) from rice farming in every harvest season and P8,000 from hog-raising. Their income went to their food, clothing and allowances for their children.

In this regard, they aimed to improve their hog-raising business to increase their income. But due to financial difficulties, they are requesting a loan of P20,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and materials needed to renovate the pig pen. He hopes that through his patience and hard work, he can make the business viable and profitable in the future, as he believes that nothing is impossible to a person who has strong faith and determination to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and materials needed to improve the pig pen.

loans.name: Kanya

texts.en: Kanya, 61, resides with her husband and children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for the rubber plantations. Kanya sells coconuts, coffee, and gasoline, earning an income of USD $8.30 per day. Her husband is employed at a cashew plantation, earning an income of USD $5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD $83 on food and USD $40 on the other necessary expenses. Kanya is requesting a loan of USD $1200 to purchase more groceries to resell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to resell

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en: Vuthy, 35, resides with her husband and children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia – an area known for rubber plantations. Vuthy sells groceries, earning $10 US per day. Her husband sells lottery tickets, earning $5 US per day. Each month, the family has to spend $83 US on food and $40 US on other expenses. Vuthy is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase a plot of farmland to grow yams. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland to grow yams.

loans.name: Huot

texts.en:
Huot is a resident of the Siem Riep Province. Agriculture is the main business activity that occurs in this area. Most of the residents of this region are both rice growers and livestock breeders. Huot is a pig raiser. She has been in this business for three years. From this business, she earns about $7 each day. She is married and has four children, three of them living with her and another child who has already married and lives in a separate house. 

To earn a living, Huot would like to request a loan through HKL, a Kiva partner. She will use this loan to purchase piglets and feed. She said that this loan is very useful for her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets.

loans.name: Channa

texts.en: Channa, 27, resides with her husband and children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia – an area known for rubber plantations. Channa sells fish, earning $8 US per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning $5 US per day. Each month, the family has to spend $80 US on food and $20 US on other expenses. Channa is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase fermented fish stock to resell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase fermented fish stock to resell.

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
As is known, fish is the main vital fresh food to everyone, in particular the families who depend on fishing and fish selling. Mrs. Toch is one among those people who currently depends on selling fish at the busy local market. She sells fish that she either gets from her husband’s fishing or buys from her wholesale supplier. Toch is a humble mother who has been blessed with ten lovely children. Five of her children are married and live independently, and the other five are living with her. From this business, Toch gains approximately $2 per day. 

To upgrade their living, Toch and her husband would like to purchase fishing equipment but they lack the cash, so she has decided with her husband to request some funds through HKL, a partner with Kiva. She expects that this funding will improve her revenue. She and her husband are very thankful to all kind lenders that always help her family. This is the second cycle of her loans with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
As a responsible father, John engages in a hog-raising business to earn additional income to satisfy his family needs. He is a farmer who has been raising his family in a village for almost 20 years, earning profits of only P15,000 for every harvest season. He aimed to improve his hog-raising business to increase his income in order to finance the education of his son who is now in college. 

He is asking for P10,000 in additional capital to buy feeds, vitamins, and materials needed to improve their pig pen. He believes that he will be able to improve their business and make it viable as he continues to work hard and strives harder despite the hardships and difficulties of life.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and materials needed to improve the pig pen

loans.name: Chann

texts.en: Chann is 24 years old and lives with two children who are living under her revenue. She now generates her income by operating a grocery store. She has been running this business for years with her husband.  She sells different products such as beauty products, sugar, candy, beers, noodles, snacks, etc., which is her main source of income. At the moment, the business has done well as it gives her family enough income to survive. But Chann doesn’t want to remain the same; her dream is to see her business grow where customers can find anything they need. This is why she has asked for the loan, to invest in her expanding business. Chan has placed her faith in God that she will be able to achieve her goals and that she will be able to have a better life. The loan will be used to buy beauty products, beers and grocery goods. Chann hopes to be able to achieve everything she sets out to do and to be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, beers and grocery goods.

loans.name: Tsetsegee

texts.en: Mrs.Tsetsegee is a 62-year-old transport driver. She lives with her husband, daughter and her niece in Ulaanbaatar – the capital city of Mongolia. This year, her niece is going to enter college. Tsetsegee’s profession is an auto mechanic and she has worked in her profession for 20 years in a transportation bureau. Currently she runs a transportation business with a minivan in a transportation company named Shine Uul LLC. She started in 2001. Her minivan is becoming very old and is running badly. It is in a dangerous condition to transport passengers. Therefore, she needs to repair her minivan immediately. She is requesting a loan to purchase some spare parts to renovate her transportation minivan.

loans.use: to purchase some spare parts to renovate her transportation minivan.

loans.name: Turbat

texts.en:
Turbat is 35-year-old married man who lives with his spouse and son in an outer ger district (a district without a basic infrastructure) of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. He is an electrician and previously had worked at the local university. 

Today, he supports his family by operating a small grocery store business in the ger district.  Mostly, his spouse helps him with the business, while their son attends secondary school. 

Turbat is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to buy a wider range of merchandise to sell in his grocery store.  His long-term aim is to buy a car to supplement his business transportation and to renovate his family home.

loans.use: to buy a wider range of merchandise to sell in his small grocery store.

loans.name: Ariunbold

texts.en:
Ariunbold is 30 years old and lives with his wife and son in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. The family lives in a rented house. Ariunbold works in a power plant in Darkhan city along with his wife. They both have been working there since 2006 and their incomes are often not enough to live on.
 
In 2009, Ariunbold bought a small-sized plot of land in suburbia to improve his living conditions. He has been planning to build a house on his purchased land but he needs some additional funding to do it. Therefore, he is taking a loan to purchase building materials to build his house. By the way, he and his wife are very hard-working and honorable people.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to build a house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Unurtsetseg

texts.en: Unurtsetseg is a 51-year-old married woman who lives with her husband, daughter and son in a local ger district (felt tent district without basic infrastructure) of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her profession is teacher and her spouse is a driver for the largest local trade company. While Unrtsetseg's children are attending state university and secondary school, she is supporting her family by operating a stationary business she started in 2009. Now she has a stall at the local outer market and she sells pens, school bags, books and notebooks. She usually buys her products from wholesale suppliers and other local markets. Sometimes she imports from Ereen, a border city of China and Mongolia. Unurtsetseg is requesting a 1,900,000 Mongolian tugrik (MNT) loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more school stationary and other related products to meet the demand of upcoming preschool shopping. She is a responsible client of Transcapital who has repaid her previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to purchase more school stationary for upcoming preschool shopping

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos de 47  años vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, muy cerca al mar, con su esposa y sus tres hijos en las edades de 11 a 15 años de edad. Allí en esta población tiene una tienda , donde vende ranchos, víveres, cárnicos, abarrotes, refrescos y en general artículos de la canasta familia. Sus clientes principales son sus vecinos del barrio donde está ubicado y de los barrios aledaños que compran de contado y algunos a crédito. Carlos durante varios años fue empleado de varias  empresas en la ciudad de Barranquilla y cuando quedó desempleado decidió con su esposa emprender un negocio y así fue cómo surgió la idea de tienda, la cual ubicó en la casa de su suegra y esto hace ya 3 años, en los cuales le ha ido muy bien y ha logrado una clientela fija, que gradualmente ha ido incrementándose. Su meta es lograr ampliarla hasta convertirla en un autoservicio, aunque su capital ante su creciente clientela le resulta insuficiente y este es su gran desafío y la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará mercancía para mejorar el surtido y con ellos aumentar sus ventas. En la actualidad su margen de contribución es de 20% y maneja una rotación de inventarios de 25 días, indicadores financieros con los cuales iniciará el desarrollo de su potencial de crecimiento.
texts.en: Carlos is 47 years old. He lives in the town of Puerto Colombia, very close to the ocean. He lives with his wife and three children, aged 11 and 15. He has a store in town where he sells groceries, meats, vegetables and beverages as well as general basic items. His main customers are his neighbors and people from the nearby neighborhoods. They pay up front and some buy in credit. For years, Carlos worked in various businesses in the city of Barranquilla. When he became unemployed, he decided to open a business with his wife and that's how he got the idea of opening a store. It is located in his mother in law's house and he has had it for 3 years. It has gone very well for him. He has a stead customer that has gradually grown. His goal is to expand it until it becomes a self serve, although his capital compared with his growing clientele is not enough, and that is why he has asked for a Kiva loan. With it, he will buy merchandise to improve his inventory and increase his sales. At present, his margin of contribution is 20% and he has an inventory turnover every 25 days. With these financial indicators he will start the development of his potential for growth.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to improve his inventory and increase his sales.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Every individual has the strong desire to become successful to enjoy happiness in life. Likewise, Carmelita wants to become successful to lift her living status and give her children a bright future. She is 31 years old, married and has one infant child. Due to lack of job opportunities, she engages in hog raising to supplement her husband's income. She has been in this business for almost 5 years and usually earns a profit of 8,000 PHP for every 2 live pigs sold on a weight basis.

She wants to ask for additional capital of 7,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. She believes that the loan will help a lot to make her business grow. She mentioned that she needs to work hard and strive harder to make her dream into a reality.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a display case to show merchandise that she will also buy.

loans.name: Julieth Alcira

texts.es: Julieth  de 22 años de edad vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia muy cerca al mar,  con su pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad, motor de su vida, con el que sueña ver convertido en un profesional exitoso. Allí en esta población, se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada, mediante guías especializadas de productos, logrando consolidar una clientela entre amigos, vecinos, referidos a quienes otorga un plazo de 20 a 25 días para pagar la mercancía que les acredita; con estos plazos cortos su clientela permanentemente solicita ampliarlos, pero su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para complacerlos. Este es el motivo por el cual acude a su credikiva con el cual comprará cosméticos, accesorios, artículos para el hogar, que se encuentran en descuentos y con ello ofrece a sus clientes  las mejores opciones del mercado para compensar sus solicitudes de ampliación de plazos. Su meta es incrementar sus ventas y abrir un local al público donde pueda exponer sus artículos. Mientras esto ocurre maneja un margen de contribución no menor del 30,25 y una rotación de inventarios de mercancías de 10 días, indicadores desde los cuales auguramos su crecimiento empresarial.
texts.en: Julieth is 22 years old and lives in the municipality of Puerto Colombia, very near the ocean. She lives with her little 3 year old daughter, who is her motivation in life and who she hopes will be a successful professional. There in this town, she works at selling a variety of merchandise through specialized product guides. She has a client base made up of friends, neighbors, and people that have been referred to her. She gives them 20 to 25 days to pay for merchandise on credit. With these short loan periods, her clients are always asking for extensions, but her working capital isn’t sufficient for her to do this. This is the reason why she is applying for a loan with the cooperation of Kiva. She will use it to buy cosmetics, accessories, and items for the home. She can get them with discounts, which allows her to offer her clients the best market options so she accept requests to make loan periods longer. Her goal is to increase her sales and to open a store where she can show her merchandise. Until that can happen, she is managing a profit margin not less than 30, 25 and has an inventory rotation of 10 days, indicators which lead us to predict growth for her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, accessories, and items for the home

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Otgonbayar is 49 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. One of her two sons is a student and the other one is a pupil in secondary school. Otgonbayar is a pharmacist and has been managing a pharmacy since 2009. She employs two druggists who work in shifts. At first, she has opened her pharmacy with the money from purchasing her house, which was very difficult for her. She has a plan to expand her business by opening a pharmacy branch near the downtown area. It is very beneficial and important to her business.

Recently, her short-term plan is to increase her pharmacy assets. Therefore, she is taking a loan to purchase and resell drugs in her pharmacy from registered suppliers to raise her current assets.

loans.use: To purchase and resell drugs in her pharmacy from registered suppliers to raise her business output.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a farmer who owns and tills land in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She is 50 years old and is a married woman with 8 children. Jocelyn’s husband is also a farmer. They grow rice crops on their land and sell their harvest at the market.

Jocelyn has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies. She hopes that her family will have a better quality of life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lkhagva

texts.en:
Mr. Lkhagva is 41 years old and lives with his wife and children in their own house in Darkhan – the second largest city in Mongolia. He runs a transportation business with his minivan and has been in this business since 2006. That year, he bought his second minivan to expand his business. Also, recently, he has purchased a small parcel of land and an old house near the suburbs. 

Lkhagva has requested a loan to make repairs to his fence and house because there is too much damage and destruction in it. As is known, it makes for uncomfortable and dangerous conditions to live. Therefore, he needs additional funding to buy some building materials to make repairs to his home.

loans.use: to buy some building materials to make repairs to his home.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is a 46-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She and her husband are both farmers. They grow rice and vegetables to sell to their community. Leonor’s husband mainly manages their rice farm. Leonor, on the other hand, raises chickens and sells prepaid mobile-phone credits to the people in her community.

Leonor requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, feeds and prepaid load credits. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, feeds and prepaid mobile-phone credits.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She is married and has children. Margarita has been growing rice for a long time now. She is able to provide for her family through her business. Margarita is requesting a loan to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to have a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Noli

texts.en:
Noli is 42 years old and single. He is a farmer who tills land in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Noli primarily grows rice crops to sell. With his income, he is able to help his family financially.

Noli has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to continue earning and save for his future family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is 34 years old and is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 15 years old. Bella’s husband is a farmer.

Bella has been in the business of raising hogs for three years. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market. She also helps her husband manage their fishpond and rice farm. Bella plans to use her loan to purchase pig feeds, fertilizers and other inputs for their rice farm. Bella hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds, fertilizers and other inputs for their rice farm.

loans.name: Seum

texts.en:
Seum is 29 years old.  She is married to Heng and they have three children. They are all in school. Seum has been generating her income by raising pigs. From this business, she earns approximately $5 USD each day. Seum would like to purchase feed but lacks capital so she wishes to request some funds so she can buy concentrated feed for fattening her pigs. She wants to increase her business so that her micro-enterprise will grow more each day through this loan. This will allow her to provide her customers with the best product whenever her pigs are ready to be sold. 

Seum’s business was started as a new source of revenue so she could improve the quality of life for her family and provide the best education for her children. Her final goal is to meet the expectation that all of her projects will be larger in the future. This is the first loan with Kiva and the fourth loan with HKL. She says that becoming a member of this micro-finance was an excellent decision because obtaining a loan is an easier, faster process and the interest rate is low. She is very grateful to all the lenders who always help her family. She hopes that this loan will improve her income per day.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
Eddie is a 31-year-old married man with three children. The oldest child is 10 years old.

Eddie is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Eddie also manages a seedling nursery. He works hard to provide for his family and send his children to school.

Eddie requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. He hopes for his businesses to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Linda Vista Group

texts.es:
Esta unidad de desarrollo (UDE) se llama Linda Vista  porque asi se llama la colonia donde viven los integrantes de este grupo, ademas por que es muy llamativo el nombre. Este grupo está conformado por 15 integrantes.

El representante D. grupo se llama susana tiene la edad de 33 años, estudio la preparatoria, es madre soltera y tiene una niña de 6 años de edad que estudia la primaria, ella y su familia viven en una zona cañera, ya que alli se encuentra el Ingenio de Constancias. Ella nos platica que desde poco mas de 5 años decidio iniciar su propio negocio de tienda de Abarrotes ya que como su hija era pequeña y tenia que darle mas atencion y asi poder pagar  los gastos de su hogar y ofrecerle a sus hija una mejor calidad de vida.

Doña susana realiza  sus ventas desde su casa, ella ha habierto un pequeño local en un esacio de su casa  y alli pone sus productos que tiene a la venta para que sus clientes hagan sus compras, tambien nos cuenta que trata de tener bien surtido su negocio para que sus  clientes encuentren todo lo que buscan y asi queden  satisfecho y dia a dia pueda tener mas clientes.
Ella necesita este credito para la compra de jabon en polvo, jabon de baño, cloro, detergente, arroz, frijol, galletas, dulces, refrescos, cereales, leche, aceite, jabon de bañarse y jugos para surtir su tienda y posteriormente realizar sus ventas.

Doña susana espera que con este credito su negocio prospere y cresca para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, ademas de que se encuentra muy contenta por la oportunidad que le a ofrecido Fundación Realidad.

Los demas integrantes se llaman:

Irma-zapatos
Adela-abarrotes
Lucia-ropa
Ofelia-abarrotes
Soledad-ropa
Juan Manuel-cultivo de maiz
lina-zapatos
Nancy-joyeria
Abigal-cosmeticos
Norma-calzado
Maria Julia-abarrotes
Nidia-antojitos
Gemma-molino
Alejandra-ropa
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Linda Vista," because this is the name of the neighborhood where the members of the group live, and also it is a very attractive name.  This communal bank contains 15 members.

Susana is the representative of this group, and she is 33 years old.  She has a high school education, and is the single mother of a 6 year-old daughter who is in elementary school.  She and her family live in an area known for growing sugar cane, near the Ingenio de Costancias sugar refinery.  She tells us that a little more than 5 years ago she decided to start her own business, a grocery store, because her daughter was young and she needed to give her more attention, and also because in this way she could pay the household bills and offer her daughter a better quality of life.

Susana makes her sales from her house. She has a small store that she set up in a part of her house where she puts her products for sale and where her customers can make their purchases.  In addition, she tells us that she tries to keep the business well-stocked so that her customers will find everything they are looking for.  This way her customers will leave satisfied, and each day she will have more customers

She needs this loan to buy powdered soap, bath soap, bleach, detergent, rice, beans, cookies, sweets, soft drinks, cereals, milk, cooking oil, and juices to stock her store so that later she can make her sales.

Susana hopes that with this loan her business will prosper and grow so that she can provide a better quality of life for her family.   She is very happy with the opportunity that being provided to her by Fundación Realidad.  

The other members of the communal bank are:

Irma- who sells shoes
Adela- who sells groceries
Lucia-who sells clothing
Ofelia-who sells groceries
Soledad- who sells clothing
Juan Manuel-who cultivates corn
lina- who sells shoes
Nancy-who sells jewelry
Abigal-who sells cosmetics
Norma-who sells shoes
Maria Julia-who sells groceries
Nidia-who sells snacks
Gemma - who has a mill
Alejandra-who sells clothing

loans.use: to sell groceries

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Фуркат проживает в районе Рудаки. Ему 31 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Более 5 лет занимается животноводством. В основном он занимается купле - продажей скота. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Furkat lives in the Rudaki district.  He is 31 years old, married and has three children.  He has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry for over five years.  He primarily buys and sells livestock.  Furkat is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle in order to increase its quantity.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees is 51 years old, married and has seven children. All of them are young and do different kinds of work to financially contribute to the family. Bilqees supports her family by stitching clothes for her nearby clients.  She is very skillful and receives regular orders every month. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her son’s busienss. Her son runs a barber shop in the market. His clients come from long distances because he is very popular among them for his good services. With the loan, he will buy scissors for cutting hair and shaving material to provide even better services to his customers. He will also increase the seating arrangements for his customers by purchasing some chairs. 
He has been operating his business for the past 10 years and Bilqees is hopeful that after the loan investment his business will expand.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bilqees.

loans.use: To buy scissors, shaving material & some chairs

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en: Genelyn is 29 years old and married. She has a 13-year-old child. Genelyn and her family live in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. Genelyn earns a living through farming. She grows rice and corn crops to sell to her community. She plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Genelyn hopes for this loan to help increase her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.ru:
Махмуд добрый и целеустремленный человек. Более 10 лет он предоставляет услуги ремонта автомашин. В данном бизнесе помогает ему его брат и они вместе работает и предоставляет по месту жительству. В основном ремонтирует мягких автомобилей. Он имеет много клиентов, а также хорошую репутацию среди людей. Прибыль, который он планирует он хочет вложит в бизнес для расширения бизнеса. Махмуд запрашивает займ для покупки автозапчастей для ремонта автомашин своих клиентов. Он заранее благодарит всех вас за вашу помощь и поощрение. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Mahmud is a kind and goal-oriented person.  He has been providing an auto repair service for over ten years.  His brother helps him in this business, and they work together and provide this service in their locale.  Mahmud primarily repairs soft cars.  He has many customers and has a good reputation among people.  He intends to invest the planned profit into the business in order to expand it.  Mahmud is requesting this loan for the purchase of auto parts to repair client cars.  He thanks all of you in advance for your help and support.

loans.use: to buy auto parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is still very active at the age of 50 and performs her household duties very well. Her husband is a cobbler by profession and makes shoes on order. He has a good number of business contacts and he supplies shoes to different shoe-selling shops and factories. Asia has given birth to a son and a daughter. Her son left his education after 10th and started working with his father in his shoe-making business. Her daughter is an embroidery expert. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy leather, shoe polish, laces and nails in a larger quantity that will allow him to fulfill the orders on time and earn more profits. He has been operating his business for the past 10 years and Asia is hopeful that an investment will help him expand his business. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Asia.

loans.use: To buy leather, shoe polish, laces and nails for making shoes

loans.name: Eclipse Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Angelica es miembro del grupo eclipse , ella  tiene la edad de 34 años, estudio la preparatoria, es divorsiada y tiene 4 hijos dos de ellos asisten a la primaria y dos a la secundaria.
ella vive en una region que se caracteriza por ser una zona cañera y dosde mas se produce el azucar.
Ella nos platica que decidio iniciar su negocio de venta de abarrotes ya que es madre soltera y  quiere ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y en un futuro darles una profesion.

Doña Maria Angelica realiza sus ventas de abarrotes desde su casa todos los dias se levanta muy temprano a limpiar y abrir su tiendita, nos dice que su secreto para atraer mas clientes es ser amable y tener aunque sea un poco de todo para que sus clientes siempre se vallan satisfechos y vuelvan con gusto a comprar.

Ella necesita este credito para la compra de frijol, chiles enlatados, arroz, productos enlatados, dulces, refrescos, jugos, galletas, sopa en pasta, sabritas, jabon de polvo, jabon de baño, cloro y mayonesas para su posterior venta.

Ella espera que con este credito su negocio prospere dia a dia y pueda brindarles un bienestar a sus hijos, Tambien nos platica que desea que su negocio se emplie y poder vender a futuro un poco de papeleria.

los demas integrantes del grupo son:

Patricia- farmacia
Patricia L- zapatos
Maria Margarita-cosmeticos
Lilia- refrescos
Sonia-antojitos mexicanos
Ana Karen- Lenceria
Maria- Pan
Guadalupe-ropa
Maria Cruz- joyeria
texts.en:
Maria Angelica is a member of the group “Eclipse.” She is 34 years old, studied through high school, is divorced, and has 4 children. Two of them are in primary school and two are in middle school. She lives in a region that is known for sugar cane and sugar production.

She tells us that she decided to start her small grocery store business because she is a single mother and she wants to offer a better quality of life to her children and to provide them with a profession in the future. 

Maria Angelica sells her groceries from her house ever day. She gets up very early to clean and to open her store. She tells us that the secret for attracting more customers is to be friendly and have at least a little bit of everything so that her clients always leave satisfied so they will happily return to buy again. 

She needs this loan to buy beans, canned chiles, rice, canned foods, sweets, soft drinks, juices, cookies, pasta soups, chips, powdered soap, bath soap, chlorine, and mayonnaise for re-sale. 

She expects that with this loan her business will prosper from day to day and she will be able to provide for the wellbeing of her children. She also tells us that she would like to expand her business in the future and sell some stationary items. 

The other members of the group are:
Patricia—pharmacy
Patricia L.—shoes
Maria Margarita—cosmetics
Lilia—soft drinks
Sonia—Mexican snacks
Ana Karen—ladies’ underwear
Maria—bread
Guadelupe—clothing
Maria Cruz—jewelry

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her small grocery store

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is married and her husband is a driver by profession. He drives a vehicle called a pickup and provides loading services to his clients and pick and drop off facilities to different school children.
 
Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will repair his vehicle's engine, which will allow him to provide better quality transport services to his customers and earn good profits. He has been in this profession for many years and Robina is very hopeful that an investment will help him save his business assets and increase his profits
.  
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Robina.

loans.use: To repair his pickup truck

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng is 26 years old, married, and lives with her husband and her one lovely child. Seng is a farmer who grows a rice crop. From this business, she earns a low income per day. To assist her revenue, her husband runs a business as a motor taxi driver and he earns approximately $3 per day. 

Since her husband’s motorbike is broken, she would like to purchase a motorbike but lacks money so she has decided with her husband to request some funds through HKL's partner Kiva to buy a new motorbike for servicing clients. She hopes that this fund will change her family’s situation.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike .

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a rickshaw driver by profession. He provides transport facilities to the passengers and generates income for the family. With the loan, he will repair the rickshaw’s engine because now it is creating problems and doesn’t allow him to drive it for long hours. 

Kalsoom is the mother of three children. Two of the children are enrolled in a local school getting their education. She is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. Kalsoom is very hopeful that a fully repaired rickshaw will enable her husband to drive it for longer hours and facilitate many more passengers in a day.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kalsoom.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: As it is known, fish is the main vital fresh food to many, in particular to the families who depend on fishing and fish selling. Mrs. Touch, one of these people, currently depends on selling fish at the local busy market. She sells fish that she either gets from her husband’s fishing or buys from her wholesale supplier. Touch is a humble mother who has been blessed with three lovely children. All of them have already married and live separately. From this business, Touch earns approximately $3 per day. To earn a living, Touch and her husband would like to purchase fishing materials but they lack the money, so Touch, together with her husband, has decided to request some funds through Kiva partner HKL. She expects that these funds will improve her revenue. She and her husband are very thankful to all kind lenders that always help her family. This is the first cycle of her loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Alexander did not pursue his studies in college. He kept helping his parents in cultivating their farm until he decided to get married. He is now 49 years old and has two school-aged children. Together with his wife, they are striving hard to manage their rice farming business to earn income and satisfy their basic necessities. 

Despite the hardships of life, they planned to improve the business and increase their income to continue sending their children to school. He wants to ask for additional capital of 20,000 Philippines pesos to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay for labor required in rice farming. He believes that the loan will help a lot to increase their crop yields this coming harvest season.

In the future, Alexander hopes that their business will grow and their children will finish their studies. He mentioned that he needs to endure hardships and pursue the business to make his dream come true.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides and pay for labor required in rice farming.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is married and has two children: a son and a daughter. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession and provides transport services to the passengers. He is very much an expert in driving and people trust his safe driving. Kosar herself is a very caring lady. She spends most of her time at home taking care of her family and doing household works. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs.
  
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will repair his rickshaw because the engine is creating problems. Kosar is hopeful that a fully repaired rickshaw will enable her husband to continue providing his transport services to the passengers and earning more income. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kosar.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
A. rakhi is a mother of two sons. Both of her sons are very young and are not of school-going age yet. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. He uses his rickshaw to provide pick up and drop off services to schoolchildren and to passengers. Currently, his rickshaw is creating problems and needs repair work. That’s why A. rakhi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. With the loan, her husband will buy new spare parts for his rickshaw, which will help his rickshaw run more smoothly. He has been operating his transport business for the past 15 years and A. rakhi is very confident that an investment will help him make his business better and increase his profits.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is A. rakhi.

loans.use: To buy new spare parts for a rickshaw

loans.name: Chamolidin

texts.ru:
Чамолидин женат и у них 3 детей. Он добрый, умный и честный человек. Чамолидин занимается предоставлением транспортными услугами. Он перевозить грузов в местных районах и более 20 лет занимается этим и у него очень богатый опыт. Чамолиддин хочет содержать свою семью в хороших условиях жизни и устроит своих детей в хороших школах и университетах. Для осуществления своей мечты он усердно работает и днем и ночью. Чамолидин хочет отремонтировать своего грузовика и с этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 2000$ США. Он надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать его. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Chamolidin is married and has three children.  He is a kind and honest person.  Chamolidin is involved in providing transportation services.  He transports loads in the local districts and has a rich experience in this business because he has been involved in it for over 20 years.  Chamolidin wants to provide his family with a good quality of life and place his children into good schools and universities.  To make this dream a reality, he works diligently days and nights.  Chamolidin wants to repair his truck and is requesting a loan in the sum of $2000 for this purpose.  He hopes that the creditors will support him.

loans.use: to repair his truck

loans.name: Siddiqan's Group

texts.en:
Siddiqan is very supportive in nature. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients to earn an income for the family. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. 

Her husband is a daily wage labor, and his income is not enough to meet the household expenses. That’s why Siddiqan operates her business to help support the family financially. 

She is the mother of 7 children. Her eldest son is an auto mechanic while the others are enrolled in school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her clothes-sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to finish the orders on time and earn more income. 

She is very confident that she will be able to put her business in a profitable position after the loan investment. 

In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Siddiqan.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria se caracteriza por ser una mujer sorprendente, a pesar que a su corta edad vivió toda esa transformación que sus padres pasaron en la época del terrorismo, desde muy joven empezó a tener su pequeña parcela de terreno ( que sus padres lo habían obsequiado), donde le sacó mucho provecho, donde ahora cultiva cacao. En la actualidad ella cuenta con una  cantidad considerable de tierras que aun no cuenta con ningún plantas que puedan generarle ingresos es por esta razón que recurre ala entidad de MFP. Por un crédito nuevo, para poder incrementar su parcela de producción de cacao, con la finalidad de mejorar la calidad de vida su familia. Para victoria sus hijos son la razón de existir, ya que le dan muchas fuerzas de seguir adelante por más que en el camino esté lleno de obstáculos. Generalmente sus productos los vende en los centros de acopio de su localidad, por lo que sus ventas están mejorando con respecto al mes anterior y normalmente recibe la ayuda de sus familiares. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP por el que se compromete a ser puntual el pago de sus cuotas.Ella esta feliz con su banco comunal por que son puntuales y solidarios.Con los 2.000 nuevos soles marino realizara la limpieza de las malezas para poder incrementar su cultivo de cacao.
texts.en: Victoria characterizes herself as a surprising woman. In spite of her small size, she lived through all that transformation that her parents went through in the epoch of terrorism. When she was very young, she began to have her little parcel of land (which her parents had given her), where she had much success and where she now cultivates cacao. At the present time she has a considerable quantity of land that still doesn't have any plants that can generate income for her. It is for this reason that she has come to the MFP institution for a new loan, so that she can increase her cacao plot with the goal of improving the quality of life of her family. For Victoria, her children are the reason to exist, since they give her much strength to press on, however much the road is full of obstacles. She generally sells her products in the wholesale centers in her area, and for this reason her sales are improving with respect to the past month, and she normally receives help from her relatives. This is her second loan from MFP, and she promises to be punctual in her payments. She is happy with her communal bank because the members are punctual and united. With the 2000 PEN she has applied for, she will clean her land of weeds so that she can increase her cacao plantings.

loans.use: to clean her land of weeds so that she can increase her cacao plantings.

loans.name: Chamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед проживает в районе Хуросон. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он живет вместе с родителями. Его отец и брат находятся в Российской Федерации. Сам Чамшед имеет высшее образование. По специальности  он биолог. В этой области проработал два года. Сейчас Чамшед предоставляет услугу, такси. Он берет кредит для установки нового оборудования и ремонта автомашины. Чамшед хочет установить оборудование для природного газа.
texts.en: Chamshed lives in the Khuroson district.  He is 26 years old, married and has three children.  He lives together with his parents.  His father and brother are in the Russian Federation.  Chamshed has a higher education and is a biologist.  He spent two years working in that field.  Currently, he provides a taxi service.  He is requesting this loan for the installation of new equipment and repairs of his car.  Chamshed wants to install equipment for natural gas.

loans.use: to install new equipment and repair his car

loans.name: Rone

texts.en:
Due to lack of job opportunities, Rone engages in rice farming to provides his family needs. He is 38 years old and has four school-age children. They live happily in a village, planting and harvesting rice for sale. They have been in this business for almost 15 years and usually earn a profits of 18,000 Philippines pesos (P) in every harvest season. 

They aim to increase their yields and income to support the education of their children and acquire their daily basic needs. But due to inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay for labor required in rice farming. They hope that the loan will help a lot to increase their crop yields this coming harvest season. He believes that patience and hard work will make it possible to achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay for labor required in rice farming.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida is married. Her husband operates a puncture shop where he offers his customers puncture facilities. He also sells motorbike tubes and tires to his customers on demand. He is very experienced in his business and has been doing it for the past 20 years.

Sajida herself is a housewife, staying at home and carrying out her household responsibilities. She is a very good administrator and manages her household expenses very well. She has given birth to four daughters. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.

Sajida has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her husband who wants to improve his business. With the loan, he will buy tires and tubes to put in his shop to provide enhanced services to his clients and increase his profits. Sajida is very confident that her husband’s business will grow further after investing the loan in it. 

In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Sajida.

loans.use: to buy tires and tubes for a puncture shop.

loans.name: Ashrafkhon

texts.ru:
Ашрафхон добросовестный и честный человек. Он мясник, а также занимается купля продажей скота.  Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Более 12 лет Ашрафхон занимается купля продажей скота и мясо. Соличон старается, содержит свою семью в хороших условиях жизни и устроит своих детей в хороших школах и университетах. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить желаемой прибыли. Он хотел бы получит займ в размере 2000$ США для покупки скота. Соличон заранее благодарен всем кредиторам за поддержку и поощрение.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Ashrafkhon is a conscientious and honest person.  He is a butcher and is also involved in buying and selling livestock.  He is married and is a loving father of three children.  Ashrafkhon has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over 12 years.  He tries to provide good living conditions for his family and wants to place his children into good schools and universities.  He wants to expand his business and receive a desired profit.  Ashrafkhon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2000 for the purchase of livestock.  He is grateful to all creditors in advance for the support and help.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Tagayaly

texts.ru: Тагайали житель района Хуросон. Ему 30 лет. Он женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он более пяти лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Tagayaly lives in the Khuroson district.  He is 30 years old, married and has one child.  His wife is a homemaker.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for over five years and breeds livestock at home.  Tagayaly primarily breeds livestock for future sale.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Romalda

texts.es: Romalda de 37 años de edad, casado con Richard de 37 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos.Viven en su casa propia, ubicado en el distrito de Pichari.Romalda  sabe lo difícil que es para una familia de pocos recursos, empezar con un negocio que nunaca estuvo insertado ni tenia la idea de cómo podía realizarlo.Ella a los inicios lo único que hacia es indagar los pasos a seguir para emprender un negocio, el de instalar un vivero agrícola, ya cuando empezó a remover el suelo y prepararlo para insertar las semillas, ella lo hizo con una cautela y dedicación.Luego de trabajar durante casi un año en esta actividad, encontró algo que lo apasionaba, que es la producción de plantones de cacao café y cítrico e incluso ya injertados. Al pasar los años obtuvo buenas ganancias  de lo cual no se arrepiente por haber incursionado en esta actividad, ya que le ocasiona buenas ganancias y se siente con ansias de seguir trabajando por el bienestar de su familia. En un futuro próximo piensa adquirir un terreno para luego construir su casa propia que tanto ella anhela.Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo ella se compromete por segunda vez, el de cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.Ella es la secretaria de su banco comunal por lo que todos están contentos.Con los 1,000 nuevos soles ella invertira mas en las plantas de cacao.
texts.en: Romalda, 37 years old, is married to Richard, 37 years old, with whom she has 2 children. They live in their own house located in the district of Pichari. Romalda knows how difficult it is for a family with few resources to start a business that had never been established and without have any idea how to make it a reality. In the beginning the only thing that she had done was to find out the steps to follow to start a business, that of installing an agricultural greenhouse. When she began to remove the soil and prepare the seeds for planting, she did it with care and dedication. Since working hard for almost a year in that business, she found something she was passionate about, which is growing cacao, coffee, and citrus plants including grafted plants. Over the years she's made good profits so she doesn't regret having ventured into this business since it brings good profits, and she feels a yearning to continue working for the good of her family. In the near future, she plans to purchase land to build her own house which she very much longs for. This is her second loan with MFP, so she commits herself a second time to paying off the terms of the loan on time. She is the secretary of the communal bank, and so everyone is happy.With the 1,000 nuevos soles she will further invest in the cacoa plants.

loans.use: to invest further in cacao plants.

loans.name: Abdilaziz

texts.ru:
Абдилазиз женат и любящий отец двух совершеннолетних детей. Он добрый и целеустремленный человек.  Он занимается купля продажей и установкой национальной печки (тандур). Он начал свой бизнес собственными капиталами и вложил все свои силы в нем. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить максимум прибыль для содержания соей семьи. Абдулазиз хочет отремонтировать своего автомобиля, который поможет ему для перевозки тандуров. С этой целью Абдилазиз запрашивает займ на сумму 1000$ США.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Abdilaziz is married and is a loving father of two adult children.  He is a kind and goal-oriented person.  He is involved in buying, selling and installing of national ovens (tandoor).  He started his business with his own funds and invested all his efforts into it.  He wants to expand his business and maximize his profits in order to support his family.  Abdilaziz wants to repair his vehicle, which will help him to deliver tandoor ovens.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $1000 for this purpose.

loans.use: to repair his delivery vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereals, sugar, flour (unga) and other items.

loans.name: Gulzaran's Group

texts.en:
Gulzaran is involved in sewing clothes. She is an expert in her work which helps her to get regular orders from her community clients. She does this work to share the financial burden of her family. She has three sons and two daughters. Her two eldest sons work while the others are getting their education.

Gulzaran has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her eldest son, who operates a grocery store in the market. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk quantity to enable his store to fulfill the demands of his customers and increase his profits. He started his business almost six months ago, and Gulzaran is confident that after the loan investment he will successfully be able to improve the financial condition of his business.

loans.use: to buy groceries for a grocery store business

loans.name: Djuraboy

texts.ru: Джурабой проживает в районе Хуросон. Он женат. Ему 56 лет. У него пятеро детей. Его сын занимается перевозками. Сам Джурабой занимается торговлей на рынке. У него имеется магазин, где он продает продукты питания. Этим видом деятельности занимается 6 лет. Кроме того он занимается животноводством. Он берет кредит для покупки продуктов, чтобы увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Djuraboy lives in the Khuroson district.  He is 56 years old, married and has five children.  His son is involved in transportation.  Djuraboy is involved in sales at the market.  He has a store, where he sells food products.  He has been in this business for six years.  Besides this, he is also involved in animal husbandry.  Djuraboy is requesting this loan for the purchase of products in order to expand the assortment of his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 44 years old, and an enterprising business man. He is married to Magdalene who is a farmer. They are blessed with four children. He has been offering motorcycle transport as the primary business and quarry mining as the secondary business for three years. He has a monthly income of KES 25,000 (Kenyan shillings) which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Joseph will use the loan to service the motorbike and employ labor in the quarry business. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, he will educate his children up to university level. He hopes to purchase another quarry which will increase his income.

loans.use: To service the motorbike and employ labor in the quarry business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma de 30 años de edad, casado con Antonio de 34 años con quien tiene 2 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada  en el distrito de Pichari. Norma desde ya un par de años viene  dedicándose  a la venta de golosinas en el cafetín del centro educativo la victoria del distrito de Pichari. en un comienzo no sabia nada, pero gracias a la enseñanza de sus padres supo sacar ese don que tenia dentro de ella, es por ello que sus clientes se siente satisfechos, pero no todo fue alegría en su vida, ya que tuvo momentos en que no tenia clientes, cuando incursionó en abrir su primer centro de trabajo, su primera herramienta un triciclo donde trasladaba sus golosinas y los expendía, ella sabe que a los inicios fue tan duro pero ese esfuerzo que hizo valió la pena, gracias ala perseverancia que tuvo, ahora norma esta feliz con este negocio que tiene, a la ves agradece a MFP. Por darles el crédito que gracias a ello supo incrementar su capital de negocio, ahora lo único que ella realiza es ofrecer buenos productos y aun precio cómodo y lo que mas interesa es ese trato especial que norma ofrece a todos sus clientes.Este es su primer crédito con MFP,  por lo que ella se compromete a ser efectivo  el pago de sus cuotas.Ella esta feliz  y agradecida a los de su banco comunal por que la recibieron con los brazos abiertos.Con los 1.000 nuevos soles ella invertirá en la compra de nuevos productos para su cafetín.
texts.en: Norma is 30 years old and married to Antonio, 34, with whom she has two children. They live together in a home they own in the district of Pichari, Peru. For the past couple years Norma has made a living selling snacks at a cafe in La Victoria education center in Pichari. At first she didn't know anything, but thanks to the lessons of her parents she knew how to find the gift she had inside herself. It's for this reason her customers feel satisfied. However, her life wasn't always filled with joy because there were times when she didn't have customers. When she started working, her primary tool was a tricycle she used to transport and sell her snacks. Norma knows that her humble beginnings were rather difficult, but she worked hard to make it worth the trouble.
