Junior is the chairman of the Community Bank “Winner Plus”, which is composed of 14 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Junior runs a game room for children in his area, located mid-east of Kinshasa. He began his business in 2000. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. Junior is now well known and liked in this area. He has already received MFI HOPE DRC loans six times and fully repaid them.  The loans he has received have helped him rent a well-located business place. He makes about $70 profit each week. Junior intends to purchase a generator for permanent power in order to generate additional profits. His ambition is to open another game room in another area. He is single, with a five year-old child.

loans.use: to buy a generator to keep the power permanent for his business.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Zoljargal

texts.en:
Borrower Zoljargal is a 28 year-old married woman who lives with her family in an outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.  She got a specialized Bachelors degree as a designer in 2010. Her sons attend a local secondary school and kindergarten. 

Her factory served as a workshop since 2006 and then become a company in 2010.   Today she is an owner of “Rose Fashion” company. Zoloo’s spouse helps to her by working as a manager of her company. 

Zoloo is requesting a 1,500,000 Mongolian Tugriks loan from Kiva lenders for raw materials.  She intends to increase production before the end of this summer since large numbers of tourists are interested in Mongolian national clothes.

loans.use: to buy raw materials with the intention of increasing production

loans.name: Siengneang

texts.en:
Siengneang, 45 years old, sells groceries, with $4 per day as her income. Her husband is a motor taxi driver whose income is $5 per day.  Siengneang has 5 children, two of whom are studying.  Two others are working in the factory and one more is a hairdresser at home. Every month, she has to spend $90 on food, $12 on electricity, $100 on rent house fee, $45 on school fees, and $5 on other expenses. 

Siengneang is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy hairdressing equipment for her daughter's business.  In the future, she hopes to have more money to extend her grocery store to sell more goods. She wants to support her children to the university level.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing equipment for her daughter

loans.name: Mashauri Group

texts.fr: La cliente Zainabo, leader du groupe d’affaire «Mashauri», est jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 37  ans, mère de 10 enfants  qui étudient tous. Elle est  vendeuse d’habits (friperies).  Son mari est un petit commerçant de divers. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché central Virunga. Il y a 9 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  11 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  3 ballons de friperies à marchander.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et agrandir son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
This client named Zainabo, leader of the business group called «Mashauri», is a young entrepreneur of 37, the mother of 10 children who all go to school. She sells used clothing. Her husband is a small-scale retailer. She displays her merchandise at the central market of  Virunga. She has been earning money through small businesses of this type for nine years, but she has completed eleven loan cycles with Hekima. 

This new loan will serve to buy three bales of used clothes for resale. Beyond that, she hopes to see her children grow up comfortably and to expand her business. This client thanks Hekima for its work to help poor women who are excluded from traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy three bales of used clothing.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mort

texts.en:
Mort, 53 years old, is a policeman and earns $10 per day. He is living with one son who is a goldsmith, with $3 per day for his income.  Every month, he has to spend $150 on food, $30 on electricity and $10 on other expenses.

He would like to request a loan of $750 to buy baby pigs and pig feed.  In the future, he hopes to be able to help his son to get more skill as a goldsmith so that he can do well and support himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy baby pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Isidore

texts.fr:
Client de 35 ans, marie et père de 2 enfants dont l’age varie entre 6 et 13 ans.Il arrête ses études en classe de 4 eme au collège , quand il perd son père très jeune.Son oncle le place  dans un atelier d'apprentissage de cordonnerie .
En 2002 avec la somme de 45.000 frs , il ouvre son propre atelier  de cordonnerie, ou il fabrique des sandales pour hommes, dames et enfants.Ses recettes sont de 9000 a 18.000 frs par jour.
A l'octroi de son nouveau prêt il va acheter des boucles a sandales, du cuir, de la simili , du raphia , des rouleaux des fils en nylon, et ajout d'une nouvelle machine a coudre. 
Il a des stratégies pour faire accroitre son affaire, un travail rapide et soigne , offrir un bon accueil auprès de ses clients, réduction des prix auprès des meilleurs clients.
Tres entreprenant , il pense ouvrir un grand atelier dans le futur pour continuer a prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
This client is 35, married and the father of two children of 6 and 13. He stopped his schooling in middle school when he lost his father at that young age. His uncle apprenticed him to a shoemaker. 

In 2002, with the sum of 45,000 francs, he opened his own shoe-making workshop where he makes men's, women's, and children's sandals. He takes in from 9,000 to 18,000 francs a day. 

On receiving this loan he is going to buy buckles for sandals, leather, fake leather, raffia, spools of nylon thread, and add a new sewing machine. He has strategies for making his business grow: working rapidly and carefully, welcoming his customers, and reducing prices for the best customers. 

Very enterprising, he dreams of opening a big workshop in the future so he can continue to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy shoe-making supplies: leather, buckles, glue, raffia, nylon thread, and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Wanguke Shg Group

texts.en:
Richard is the facilitator for the Wanguke Self Help Group in Cwele District.  He leads a group of 10 small-holder farmers who have been members of the One Acre Fund since Long Rains 2010.  Within the group, there are four women and six men.  Richard notes that his main reasons for seeking a loan from One Acre Fund are to access the best input prices, access quality inputs, access reliable input delivery, to grow enough to feed his family, and to have profits to invest in his childrens' education.  

Before joining One Acre Fund, Richard harvested 3.5 bags of maize on 1 acre of planted land. However, after joining One Acre Fund, Richard has been able to harvest 10 bags on 1/2 acre of land  thanks to the inputs and agricultural training he received as part of the loan program.  Richard and his group will re-enroll for the 2012 planting season.  In all, the Wanguke Self Help Group will receive input loans totaling 6.5 acres worth of inputs, with each farmer planting between 1/2 and 1 acre of land.  Richard and his group plan on spending the profits of their harvests on school fees, home repairs, assisting neighbors through difficult times, home goods, livestock purchases, and possibly further business investments. 
.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Handsuren

texts.en:
Handsuren is 38 years old and lives with her chidren and husband in a ger in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband works as a plumber at the local power station during the winter and does other jobs during the summer. His monthly income is 170,000 MNT.  Handsuren moved to the current city in 2001 from the countryside. She started to sell meat with 100,000 MNT in starting capital in 2006. Since then she has been in the business. In the future, she plans to expand her business operation. She is a diligent and calm woman who says "I want to expand my business and increase my profit. My dream is to open a shop that sells vegetables and meat."  

Handsuren is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase meat from herders.

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah is 29 years old and married to Magdaline. They have two children. Jeremiah has a business selling paraffin, which he has been doing for the last five years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more paraffin to add to his inventory. He hopes to build a family home in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more paraffin

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en: Sreymom, 23 year old, is feeding pigs to sell. Her income is $4 per day. Her husband is a worker in a furniture shop and makes $6 per day. She has not yet had any children. Every month, she has to spend $76 on food, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 for repairing her house. Sreymom has very good experience in feeding pigs because she has been doing this career for a long time. She wants to feed more pigs and chickens when she has enough money to buy them.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase another quarry site

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, a 30-year-old fishmonger, is married to Sandra who is 27 years old. They have a daughter, Deja, who is 2 years old. Charles has been a fishmonger for six years. The income generated from the business is spent on their daily needs. 

To generate more income, Charles is planning to run another business to sell grilled fish. He would like to buy more fish for his new business. Unfortunately, he does not have enough business capital to do so. Charles is seeking a loan amounting of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. In addition to buying fish, Charles also wants to buy other equipment such as: refrigerator, nipper, tent, a simple fish roaster and table.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other equipment such as: refrigerator, nipper, tent, a simple fish roaster and table.

loans.name: Jovel

texts.en:
Jovel is 42 years old and married. He doesn’t have a child yet, but hopes to have one soon.

Jovel is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. He has been growing rice and corn crops for eight years. He earns about 10,000 PHP per month selling his harvest to his community.

Jovel has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. He hopes for his business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more paraffin to add to his stock.

loans.name: Joven

texts.en:
Joven is 34 years old and married. He has a 9-year-old child.

Joven is a farmer who owns and tills land in Banga, South Cotabato. He plants rice, corn and calamansi trees on his land. Joven sells his harvest to traders. He works hard to improve his business and continue providing for his family.

Joven is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes for his business to grow in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is 24 years old and married to Esther. They have two children who are in school.

Jared has a barber shop and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD  to  buy a shaving machine to enable him serve his clients better. The profits made from the business will enable him to pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to open up another barber shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy another shaving machine.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 61 years old and is a married woman with eight children. Her younger children still go to school.

Marina is engaged in raising hogs and rice farming. Her husband, who is also a farmer, mainly manages their farm. She focuses on raising pigs and helps work at the farm when she can.

Marina requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and pig feeds. Marina wishes to have a good business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pig feeds

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 39 years old and is a married woman with two children, ages 7 and 8 years old. Myrna and her husband are both farmers. They primarily grow rice crops to sell. Myrna’s husband also manages a fishpond. To help augment their income, Myrna decided to put up a small sari-sari store. She sells items like canned goods, noodles, coffee and sugar. She said she could do household chores while managing their store.

Myrna has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to sustain her children’s education through their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Novy

texts.en:
Novy is a 35-year-old married man from the town of Banga, South Cotabato. He is a father of two children, who are 7 and 3 years old.

Novy is a farmer. He grows rice crops to sell. He also raises pigs in his backyard. He sells his pigs at the market. He plans to use his loan to purchase 2 sacks of feeds, 3 sacks of fertilizers and 1 quart of herbicides. Novy hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of feeds, 3 sacks of fertilizers and 1 quart of herbicides

loans.name: Pablito

texts.en:
Pablito is a married man with two children who are 15 and 16 years old. He has been a farmer for 30 years now. Pablito plants rice, corn and cassava on his land. He sells his harvest at his town’s market.

Pablito requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Pablito hopes to grow his business. He also wishes for his family to be happy and healthy always.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Ramie

texts.en:
Ramie is 32 years old and married. He has two children aged 7 and 10.

Ramie is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. He grows rice and coconuts to sell. Ramie works hard to provide for his family and send his children to school. He plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Ramie hopes for his business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Bien Fait Plus Group

texts.en:
Patrick is the chairman of the Community Bank “Bien Fait Plus”, which is composed of 12 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Patrick sells phone accessories in his area located west of Kinshasa. He began his business in 2005. His beginning capital was $100. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. Patrick is now well known and liked in this area. He has already received five loans from MFI HOPE DRC  and fully repaid them. Since that time his business has prospered, and the loans he has received have helped him rent a well located business place. He makes $100 profit each week. 

Patrick intends with the next loan to purchase more phone accessories to meet customer demand and generate additional profits. His ambition is to open a cellular phone shop in his area. He is 33 years old and married. He also takes care of a younger brother and a niece.

loans.use: to buy more phone accessories for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey is a 32-year-old married man with one child. He is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. Rey grows rice and corn crops to sell. He earns about 10,000 PHP per month doing this farming business.

Rey has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 37 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. She has had a sari-sari store business for 3 years. She sells eggs, coffee, spices and other various products. Rosalie also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market.

Rosalie requested this loan to purchase piglets, feed and additional items to sell at her store. Rosalie hopes to have her children finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and additional items to sell at her store

loans.name: Ritah's Group

texts.en:
Rita’s group is comprised of three hard working women. Ritah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kamala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children. All of her children are currently in school. Ritah has a business of selling clothes. She has had this business for 4 years.         

To help expand her business, Ritah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Ritah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, Ritah hopes to expand her business. Ritah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en:
Ryan is 29 years old and single. He is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. Ryan primarily grows rice crops to sell. He also owns a cow that helps with tilling his land.

Ryan has requested a loan to purchase 4 sacks of fertilizers, 1 quart of herbicides and other farm supplies he needs. Ryan hopes for his business to grow and to be able to save for his future family.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of fertilizers, 1 quart of herbicides and other farm supplies he needs

loans.name: Sulpicio

texts.en:
Sulpicio is 50 years old and is a married man with five children. The oldest child is 24 years old.

Sulpicio manages a rice farm and a fishpond. He sells his rice at the market. Sulpicio grows “bangus” (milkfish) in his fishpond. Sulpicio works hard to support his family especially his children’s education. He requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and feed. This loan will help Sulpicio continue earning from his farm and fishpond.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and feed.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 65-year-old married woman. She and her family reside in Banga, South Cotabato.

Teresita is a farmer. She said she learned farming when she was young because her parents were also farmers. Teresita primarily grows rice crops to sell. She plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to help improve her family’s living conditions through her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Tubulwanyise Naluvule Group

texts.en:
A retail enterprise is what this 54-year-old father of nine has been banking on for the last 15 years to earn his keep. Badru principally sells a variety of general merchandise, for example, sugar, salt, maize flour, plastics, paraffin, beans, ballpoint pens, exercise books, etc. He plies his trade in the metropolis of Kampala.

A checkered experience is what he expected at the inception of his business. The last 15 years have been marked by fluctuations in his fortunes. The bad times have not caught him off balance and in the good times, he has kept his feet on the ground. Remaining philosophical in the face of hard times has been a stock in trade he has reckoned on to weather the storms in his business transactions.

His retail shop has been doing good business owing to the good reputation he has and the fact that he meets the demand of his customers. Weekly his business's sales profits are to the tune of Uganda shillings 75,000. Badru also subsists on side income from his small farming business.

He says this Kiva loan will be used for the purchase of more retail goods to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail goods to resell.

loans.name: Khader

texts.en:
Khader is a Palestinian man. He is married and has eight sons and two daughters. He has got a license for distributing gas canisters in a vehicle he owns, and he wants to purchase more gas canisters to distribute, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for them, so he needs to take out a loan in the amount of $3,000 from FATEN. 

When Khader takes the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will have more gas canisters to distribute and that will improve his income positively and he can provide his family with better living conditions. Khader is photographed next to the gas canister distribution vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase more gas canisters to distribute.

loans.name: Gauthier Ghislain

texts.fr:
Client de 36 ans, marie et père de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 3 et 8 ans,deux sont a l’école primaire et une a l’école maternelle.
En 2003 , il ouvre un atelier de vulcanisation après avoir appris auprès d'un maitre après plusieurs années a l’arrêt de ses études en classe de seconde.
Son atelier est bien situe a la gare routière et il a de recettes de 25.000 frs a 30.000 frs par jour.Ses potentiels clients sont les taxi mans et les chauffeurs de bus et les personnels qui ont des crevaisons et usures  des pneus a tout instant.
A l'octroi de son nouveau prêt il va acheter un suppresseur d'air d'occasion, des chambres a air,quelques  pneus et des litres de colle.
Tres pragmatique , avec une grande maitrise de son travail ,il a pour ambition dans le futur d'ouvrir une vulcanisation très moderne.
texts.en:
This client of 36 is married and the father of three children whose ages range from 3 to 8 years old; two are in primary school and one in pre-kindergarten. 

In 2003, he opened a workshop for tire repair after having learned the trade from a master for several years when he ended his studies in 10th grade. His workshop has a good location near the bus station and he takes in 25,000 to 30,000 francs a day. His potential customers are taxi and bus drivers and people who have a flat tire or badly worn tire at any point. 

When he receives his loan, he will buy a used air compressor, some inner tubes, tires, and liters of glue. He is a very pragmatic man who masters his trade well, and his ambition for the future is to open up a modern tire repair shop.

loans.use: to buy an air compressor, inner tubes, tires, and glue.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a 33-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 1.5 years to 14 years old. Hi describes himself as a God-fearing, very humble man. 

He has a clothing business in Kibuye where he sells cloth, both new and second-hand, and also provides clothing repairs. He has been in this business for 6 years and employs one person. His stall is located in a large market and his customers are primarily young ladies and boys. He describes his biggest business challenge as the cost of materials and the influx of cheap materials.

Benard will use his Kes 20,000 loan to add stock to his stall. He hopes that he will be able to expand in future and open a new stall. His goal is provide a higher level of education for his children.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Baria

texts.en:
Baria is a 53-year-old single woman. She owns rental houses and has been a landlady for the past six years, making a monthly profit of KES 40,000. Baria has been loaned KES 50,000, which she wants to use for repairing her rental houses. This is her fourth loan. 

With the anticipated profit made she wants to buy land and build more rental houses. Baria hopes to succeed in all she does.

loans.use: to repair her rental houses

loans.name: Sayrat

texts.en:
Sayrat is a 48-year-old woman. She is married and has three sons and four daughters. She lives in Hebron city located in Palestine. Her husband has a decent retirement salary. Sayrat wants to help improve her family's source of income by raising poultry and birds and to benefit from their products to gain money. But Sayrat hasn't enough money to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $1,500 from FATEN.

When Sayrat gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will have her own project that will help to improve the family income and live with her family in better life conditions. Sayrat is photographed next to the place where she is raising poultry and birds.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and birds

loans.name: Njete C Shg Group

texts.en:
Albert is the facilitator for Njete C Self Help Group.  This group has five members. This is the group's second year with One Acre Fund and the group is planning to re-enroll for the 2012 program.  

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Albert and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Albert joined One Acre Fund in order to acquire new farming skills, access quality inputs, generate additional profits from harvest, and feed his families. With income from his harvest, Albert plans to pay for his children's school fees, repair his home, create savings, and purchase livestock. Each Njete C SHG member has signed up for 2012 input loans for 1/2 acre plots.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Khar  Ndiaye

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est une femme divorcée qui vit avec ses deux enfants.Elle tient un restaurant au bord de la route nationale qui traverse son village.Elle propose à ses clients des plats plats à base de produits locaux.En plus, elle vend des melons qu'elle achète auprès d'un exploitant agricole installé à un kilomètre du village.Elle arrive à se prendre en charge et à entretenir ses deux enfants avec les bénéfices tirés de son commerce.Elle sollicite de l'UIMCEC un prêt de 150 000F pour acheter de l'huile, de l'oignon, du haricot et d'autres produits divers.Son ambition est d'agrandir son restaurant.
texts.en:
This borrower is a divorced woman who lives with her two children. She runs a restaurant by the main road that goes through her village, and her dishes are based on local products. She also sells melons, which she buys from a farmer located one kilometer from the village. She manages to support herself and her children with the profits earned from her business activities. 

She is seeking a loan of 150,000 F from the UIMCEC to buy oil, onions, beans and various other items. Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy oil, onions, beans and various other products for her restaurant

loans.name: Nabeel

texts.en: Nabeel is a 47-year-old man. He is married and has eight sons and three daughters. He lives in Hebron city located in Palestine. His wife is employed with a decent income and he works in the field of home products sales. Nabeel wants to purchase a large amount of home products to sell as the feast occasion is around the corner. But the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay so he needs to take a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. When Nabeel takes the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will pay to purchase the amount of home products he needs and sell them during the feast occasion. This will increase his income and let the family live in better life conditions. Nabeel is photographed in the place where he sells his home products.

loans.use: To purchase home products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fabrics and threads to tailor clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock in a bus company

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 40 years old and married with three sons and four daughters. She lives in Al-Samou near Hebron City in Palestine. Her husband and one of her sons are employed with decent salaries. Fatima has a project making embroidery to sell. She wants to purchase a large quantity of beads for embroidery but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of JOD 400 from FATEN.  When Fatima gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will buy the needed amount of beads and make extra quantities of embroidery to sell. This will increase the family income, which helps them to live in better life conditions. Fatima is photographed in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To purchase beads for embroidery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase general food products (sugar, rice, vegetable oil)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables, fish, beans, groundnut and other condiments

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 46 years old and lives in Paynesville south. He is married and his wife is a business woman. They have two children who are presently attending school.

For the past three years Daniel has been operating a medicine store in his community where he sells a variety of medicines. He makes a lot of profits, hence he is the only one who is operating a medicine store in his community.

Daniel is requesting a loan to purchase more medicine such as paracetamol and cough syrup for his business. He plans to open a clinic in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine such as paractemol and cough syrup for his business

loans.name: Amélivi

texts.fr:
Amelevi est une femme âgée de 33 ans. Ellle est mariée å un chauffeur. Ellle a 3 enfants, dont 2 à l’école. Le premier a 11 ans et le dernier a 3 ans.  
Amelevi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2001. Ellle achète et revend des produits d’alimentation générale pour ses  clients dans sa boutique. Ellle travaille seule dans son activité. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la mévente. 
Amelevi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter divers produits d’alimentation générale. 
Dans les prochaines années, Amelevi voudrait élargir ses activités. Ellle dit qu’avec les profits, ellle prévoit de garantir l’avenir de ses garçons.
texts.en:
Amelevi is a 33-year-old woman. She is married to a chauffeur. She has three children with two of them in school. The oldest is 11 and the youngest 3.
Amelevi has worked as a shop merchant since 2010. She buys and resells general food products to her clients in her shop. She works alone at the shop and now her main challenge is the slump in sales. 
Amelevi has requested her first loan with WAGES in order to purchase a variety of general food products. 
In the next few years, Amelevi would like to grow her business. She says that with her profits, she plans to help her boys have a good future.

loans.use: to purchase general food products

loans.name: Mbuko

texts.en:
Mbuko is a 49-year-old married man. He has 8 children with ages ranging from 8 years to 29 years. 

Mbuko operates a retail shop where he sells household consumables in a trading centre. He has been involved in this business for 19 years. He describes his biggest business challenges as price fluctuations and demanding clients.

Mbuko will use the KES 50,000 loan to add stock to his retail shop. His hope for the future is to be able to open a wholesale shop and diversify into the water business.

loans.use: to add stock to his retail shop

loans.name: Ursula Ines Nadine

texts.fr:
Cliente de 38 ans, célibataire et mère de 5 enfants dont l’age  varie entre 5 et 18 ans. Et après son divorce ayant la responsabilité de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants , elle se lance dans la vente des articles religieux, des aromates des parfums, des chapelets 
En 1991 , elle ouvre une boutique de vente des articles religieux pour non loin d'un marche et d'une église dans un quartier de la ville située non loin de sa maison. 
Elle a des vente de 12.000 frs a 35.000 frs par jour, a l'octroi de son nouveau prêt elle veut acheter des cartons de bougies de toutes couleurs, des aromates, des parfums, des chapelets et tous ce dont cherche ses clients.
Tres motivée , elle a l’intention d'aller loin avec son business,avec ses bénéfices elle prend soin de ses enfants.
texts.en:
She is 38 years old, single and a mother of five children between the ages of 5 and 18. After getting a divorce, as she is now responsible to provide for her children, she started a business of selling religious articles, fragrances, perfumes and rosaries. 
In 1991, she opened a shop to sell religious articles as her neighborhood is not far from the market and a church.
Her sales are between 12,000 CFA francs and 35,000 CFA francs per day, with her new loan she plans to purchase cases of different colored candles, rosaries, fragrances, and perfumes, all of which are in high demand.
As she is very motivated, she plans to have a very successful business and take good care of her children with the profits.

loans.use: to purchase cases of different colored candles, rosaries, fragrances, and perfumes

loans.name: Isaiah Oguta

texts.en:
Isaiah is a married man with 2 children aged 6 and 9. His wife is a grocer. He considers himself to be religious, God fearing and humble.

Isaiah operates a business involved in the sale of shoes. He sells casual shoes, leather shoes and sports shoes. His customers consist of both travelers and city residents. He has been in this business for 12 years and employs one staff member.

His loan will be used to increase his stock of shoes to sell in his store. Isaiah hopes to build a sustainable shoe business and would like to purchase bulk shoes for wholesaling within 5 years.

loans.use: to increase the stock of shoes in his store

loans.name: Adjo Essinam

texts.fr:
Adjo essinam est une femme âgé(e) de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur de portable. Elle a 3 enfants, dont 2 à l’école. Le premier a 8 ans et le dernier a 5 ans.  
Adjo essinam travaille comme infirmière depuis 1999. Elle achète et revend des produits pharmaceutiques Elle est la seule personne impliquée dans son activité. 
Adjo essinam a requis son 3ème crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter d’acheter des produits pharmaceutiques.Elle veut investir dans son activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Adjo essinam voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit intervenir dans l’éducation des ses enfants.
texts.en: Adjo Essinam is a 36 year old woman. She is married to a reseller of mobile phones. She has 3 children, 2 of which are in school. The oldest is 8 years old and the youngest is 5 years old. Adjo Essinam has worked as a nurse since 1999. She buys and resells pharmaceutical products. She is the only person involved in her business. Adjo Essinam has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy pharmaceutical products. She wants to invest in her business. In the coming years, Adjo Essinam would like to expand her business. She says that, with her profits, she plans to be involved in the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Gorgui

texts.fr: Père de 19 enfants dont deux jumeaux, l'emprunteur est un homme marié polygame à 3 épouses.Il s'adonne à la médecine traditionnelle à base de racines et de feuilles d'arbre, pratique héritée de son père.Toutefois, sa principales activité restent l'agriculture et l'élevage durant l'hivernage. Il cultive le mil et l'arachide et  achète des animaux (vache  ou mouton) qu'il engraisse et revend au bout de 6 mois.Ses revenus lui permettent de faire face aux besoins de sa famille durant la logue période de soudure avant les récoltes.Il sollicite un pret de 150 000F auprès de l'UIMCEC pour acheter une vache et de l'aliment bétail.
texts.en: This borrower is a polygamous married man who has three wives and is father to 19 children, two of whom are twins. He is a devotee of traditional medicine based on roots and tree leaves, a practice he inherited from his father. His main activity is, however, farming and raising animals during the rainy season. He grows millet and groundnut and buys animals (cows or sheep) which he fattens up and resells after six months. His income enables him to cover his family's needs during the long lean season before the harvest. He is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs from UIMCEC to buy a cow and food for livestock.

loans.use: to buy a cow and food for livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 500 bags of charcoal for his business

loans.name: Mohamed Ibrahim's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present teachers of a primary school in Allen Town, an outskirt of Freetown. This group of teachers has come to SMT to request a loan of 4,400,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and repays on their behalf. 

Mohamed is the leader of this group of teachers. A native of Kambia district, in northern Sierra Leone, Mohamed is 33 years old, married, and has one child. Mohamed has requested this loan in order to pay his college fees.

loans.use: to pay his college fees

loans.name: Danka

texts.fr:
Danka est une femme âgée de 33 ans. Elle est mariée å un militaire. Elle a 2 enfants,tous à l’école. Le premier a âge du plus grand ans et le dernier a âge du plus petit ans.  
Danka travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2006. Elle achète et revend des sacs de charbons de mois. Elle travaille seule dans son activité. 
Danka a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter d’acheter  et revendre des sacs de charbons de bois. Elle veut faire un investissement dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Danka voudrait prospecter son activité pour agrandir son commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit épanouir sa famille.
texts.en: Danka is a 33 year old woman. She is married to a soldier. She has two children, both in school. The first is the oldest in years and the last is the youngest. Danka has been working as a reseller since 2006. She buys and resells bags of charcoal. She works alone in her business. Danka has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy and resell bags of charcoal. She wants to make an investment in the business. In the coming years, Danka would like to prospect for her business in order to grow her business. She says that, with the profits, she anticipates that her family will flourish.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr:
Ayélé est une femme  âgé(e) de 43 ans. Elle est mariée å un militaire. Elle a 2 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 25 ans et le dernier a 20 ans.  
Ayélé travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle achète et revend des pagnes ses clients dans sa maison. Elle est seule impliquée dans son commerce.
Ayélé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter et revendre des pagnes. Elle veut augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Dans les prochaines années, Ayélé voudrait devenir un grossiste en vente de pagnes. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Ayélé is a 43 year old woman. She is married to a solider. She has 2 children that both go to school. The oldest is 25 years old and the youngest is 20 years old. Ayélé has been working as a reseller since 2008. She buys and resells traditional cloth (pagnes) to her customers in her home. She is the only one involved with her business. Ayélé has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy and resell the traditional cloth (pagnes). She wants to increase her business revenue. In the coming years, Ayélé would like to become a wholesaler of traditional cloth (pagnes). She says, with the profits, she will provide schooling for her children.

loans.use: To buy traditional cloth (pagnes)

loans.name: Jean Baptiste Diérry

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un paysan qui cultive le mil, l'arachide  et le sorgho durant l'hivernage.Il entretient son épouse et ses cinq enfants avec cette activité après avoir arrêté la couture qui ne lui rapportait pas assez de revenus.Pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille, il pratique aussi l'élevage en mettant chaque année sur le marché une vache engraissée et bien soignée. Il est membre de l'UIMCEC et sollicite auprès de l'institution un pret de 150000 F pour l'achat d'une vache  et d'un sac d'aliment bétail concentré. Son ambition est d'élargir son activité d'embouche bovine.
texts.en: This borrower is a farmer who grows millet, groundnut and sorghum during the rainy season. He takes care of his wife and five children with this activity, having abandoned his sewing business which did not bring in enough income for him. In order to improve his family's living conditions, he also raises animals putting a fattened and well-treated cow on the market every year. He is a member of UIMCEC and is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs from the institution to buy a cow and a sack of concentrated livestock food. His ambition is to expand his beef fattening business.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a sack of concentrated livestock food

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 37-years-old and married to Regina. They have four children between 3 and 15 years of age.

Benson has been running a quarry business for the last four years, making a monthly profit of KES 14,000. This is his first loan. He plans to purchase an extra quarry site.

With the anticipated profit made he plans to educate his children to higher levels of education. In the near future he hopes to be supplying construction companies with stones from his quarry.

loans.use: to purchase an extra quarry site

loans.name: Aiyda

texts.en: Aiyda is a 24-year-old young woman. She is married and has two sons and one daughter. She lives in Jabalia refugee camp located in Gaza Strip in Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Aiyda wants to improve her family life conditions by purchasing new home furniture, but the amount of money Aiyda has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN of $1,500. When Aiyda gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase new home furniture and live with her family in healthy, comfortable home conditions. Aiyda is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is 37 years old and married to Augostina. They have three school-going children. 

Boniface has been running a quarry business for five years, making a monthly profit of KES.10,000. He has been loaned KES.30,000 which he plans to use to purchase another quarry site. This is his first loan.

With the anticipated profit made he plans to open a hotel in Kitengela. In the near future he hopes to purchase a lorry to transport the stones to customers.

loans.use: to purchase another quarry site

loans.name: Hannah's Group

texts.en: Meet with this group of teachers from Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This group of teachers has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 5,800,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges like paying school/college fees and buying house-building materials. At the end of each month, their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf. Hannah is the leader of this group of teachers. The 44-year-old is married to a teacher and the couple has six children. Hannah has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Serzhik

texts.ru:
Сержик родился в 1953 г. в городе Баку, где получил среднее образование. В 1988 году он переехал в Армению и поселился в городе Капане. 
Жена Сержика работала медсестрой, а сейчас она  домохозяйка и получает пенсию по инвалидности; обе дочери замужем и проживают отдельно от родителей. Сержик принимал участие в Нагорно-Карабахском конфликте, где получил контузию и сейчас он получает военную пенсию. 
Чтобы содержать свою семью, Сержик занимается предпринимательской деятельностью и работает без выходных. Сержик покупает мясо и молочные продукты из деревень Сьюникского региона и продает их в своей мясной лавке в городе Капане. Товар он приобретает четыре раза в месяц. 
Сержик является клиентом Нор Оризон (Nor Horizon) уже долгие годы и сейчас ему необходим кредит на сумму 300.000 драм для покупки большой партии мяса для своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Serzhik was born in 1953 in the city of Baku, where he obtained his secondary education.  He moved to Armenia in 1988 and settled in the city of Kapan.  Serzhik's wife used to work as a nurse and now is a homemaker, receiving a disability pension.  Both of their daughters are married and live separately from the parents.  Serzhik took part in the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict, where he was wounded and now receives a military pension.  In order to support his family, Serzhik is involved in his own business and works without days off.  He buys meat and milk products from the villages in the Syunik region and sells them in his butcher shop in Kapan.  He buys his products four times per month.  Serzhik has been a client of Nor Horizon for many years and now needs a loan in the sum of 300,000 dram for the purchase of a large lot of meat for his business.

loans.use: to buy a large lot of meat for resale
